Ahuihuiyuco se quedÃ³ sin su poblaciÃ³n de aproximadamente mil 300 habitantes. TodavÃ­a el 9 de junio se podÃ­an ver por sus veredas a algunas familias que buscaban salir del lugar en camionetas.

En este lugar, dedicado principalmente a la siembra de autoconsumo y a la elaboraciÃ³n de la cinta de palma, sÃ³lo quedÃ³ abierta la iglesia.

Se trata de una zona estratÃ©gica para el trasiego de drogas, pues conecta con Ciudad de MÃ©xico o Puebla, explica el activista Manuel Olivares, del Centro Morelos, mientras estira el brazo para seÃ±alar el camino que tiene a su derecha y que, en un punto, parece volverse uno con la sierra: "Esa ruta nos puede conectar con Zitlala, derecho llega a Copalillo y de ahÃ­ uno puede entroncar hacia la Ciudad de MÃ©xico o Puebla; son lugares muy estratÃ©gicos".

De lo que se trata es de sembrar terror en el enemigo, no hay un cÃ¡rtel que sea menos sanguinario que otro, descuartizan, matan, esas son las razones por las que la lucha es tan sangrienta y tan cruel y que por la que ahora pelean por las comunidades." Manuel Olivares.

La gente ha ido regresando de a poco, pero las escuelas y los centros de salud siguen vacÃ­os; las cortinas de los negocios bajadas y las pocas personas que hay, sÃ³lo caminan, caminan, frenan un poco cuando algo o alguien sale a su paso, otean, se cubren la boca, se sacuden las piernas y siguen.

En Tepozcuautla el panorama es similar.

"PrÃ¡cticamente se ve muy poca gente en las calles por el miedo, a partir de las 5 de la tarde la gente se regresa a su casa, como en una especie de toque de queda autoimpuesto, pero tambiÃ©n demuestra que no le tiene confianza a los militares, porque justo hay una comisarÃ­a ocupada por los militares a unos metros", continÃºa Manuel, quien comanda una MisiÃ³n Civil de ObservaciÃ³n con organismos internacionales a fin de hacer visible la emergencia.

Muchas casas siguen vacÃ­as, el retorno no se ha completado y, probablemente, no se complete; se sabe que muchas familias no piensan regresar ante la creciente prÃ¡ctica del reclutamiento forzado por parte de grupos de la delincuencia organizada.

Lo que antes se entendÃ­a por la lucha por la plaza era la lucha por el mercado de consumo, pero cuando el narcotrÃ¡fico toma tintes empresariales, los fines econÃ³micos de la delincuencia organizada incrementan, aumentan los secuestros, el cobro de piso, la venta de protecciÃ³n, la extorsiÃ³n, empiezan a controlar los servicios pÃºblicos." Manuel Olivares

El tema del desplazamiento por la violencia se da al menos desde hace 10 aÃ±os en Guerrero, explica JosÃ© Raymundo DÃ­az, del Colectivo contra la Tortura y la Impunidad.

"En el estado de Guerrero hay desplazamiento desde hace mucho tiempo, pero ha estado silenciado y ahora en Chilapa se estÃ¡ documentando y tratando de visibilizar estos casos de desplazamiento que se estÃ¡n dando desde 2015", seÃ±ala.

Fue entre el 9 y 14 de mayo de 2015 que un grupo de 300 personas armadas tomÃ³ la ciudad de Chilapa, hubo, entonces, entre 31 y 32 desaparecidos. La gravedad se acentuÃ³ porque los hechos se dieron con la presencia de la GendarmerÃ­a Nacional y el EjÃ©rcito.

De 2015 a la fecha, en Chilapa hay al menos 150 casos de desapariciones y sÃ³lo 14 se han podido denunciar ante la PGR para acceder al fondo de la ComisiÃ³n Ejecutiva de AtenciÃ³n a VÃ­ctimas (CEAV); al resto, las autoridades no les han acreditado la declaraciÃ³n de ausencia, denuncia el Centro Morelos, el cual se ha encargado de documentar cada uno de los casos.

Hemos visto el momento en que Chilapa era un paraÃ­so, llegaba mucha gente de otros lugares a vivir, nadie preguntaba nada mientras uno no se metiera en problemas, era un territorio libre para todos." Manuel Olivares.

ENTRE LA ANARQUÃA Y LA OMISIÃ“N

El desplazamiento en Ahuihuiyuco y Tepozcuautla se dio en "mucha anarquÃ­a, mucho desorden", seÃ±ala Manuel, pues aunque el EjÃ©rcito y la PolicÃ­a Municipal acompaÃ±aron a algunas personas, sÃ³lo las llevaron a la carretera y ahÃ­ las familias "le dieron para donde mejor entendieron", por eso no se tiene certeza sobre su paradero.

"Algunas familias fueron a dar a Chilpancingo, otras a Iguala, otras a Morelos, a diferentes partes del estado y del paÃ­s; eso tambiÃ©n tiene que ver con la desconfianza que tienen hacia el gobierno porque no fueron capaces de unificarse y plantearle al presidente municipal una soluciÃ³n.

"Cuando menos el presidente municipal de Chilapa no es ajeno a uno delos grupos de delincuencia organizada y la gente sabe que si van a presentar una denuncia al Ministerio PÃºblico mÃ¡s tardan en presentarla que el mismo MP que tomÃ³ la denuncia le estÃ© informando al amo, al que le sirva", acusa.

El centro de defensa de derechos humanos es claro en su mensaje, no quieren seÃ±alar a ningÃºn grupo delictivo, pero sÃ­ exigirle al gobierno que haga las averiguaciones previas, que las carpetas de investigaciÃ³n avancen, que "realmente se investigue y que realmente se castigue a los responsables."

El Estado tiene la obligaciÃ³n de garantizar nuestro derecho a la vida, a la integridad fÃ­sica, a nuestro patrimonio y, cuando no es capaz de esto, pues la gente tiene que exigirle. AdemÃ¡s nos enfrentamos a que el EjÃ©rcito ha generalizado la visiÃ³n de que los defensores de derechos humanos, defendemos a delincuentes, eso es muy grave porque tiene que ver con una criminalizaciÃ³n y estigmatizaciÃ³n hacia nuestro trabajo que provoca un linchamiento moral de la poblaciÃ³n hacia nosotros." Manuel Olivares.

CHILAPA Y NUEVE ASESINATOS POR DÃA

De julio de 2013 a la fecha, en Guerrero suman 5 mil personas desplazadas en al menos 30 comunidades de 20 de los 81 municipios que integran la entidad.

Chilapa es una de las regiones mÃ¡s violentas, pero, a diferencia del norte, aquÃ­ la lucha no es por los capos, sino por comunidades pequeÃ±itas, para que trabajen para un grupo y si se van con otro grupo, los matan". Abel Barrera, Centro de Derechos Humanos de la MontaÃ±a Tlachinollan.

Actualmente en Chilapa hay tres retenes militares, es una localidad de 31 mil 157 habitantes, segÃºn cifras del Inegi, y en un dÃ­a pueden ocurrir hasta nueve asesinatos.

Mientras que las desapariciones comenzaron desde 2014, con 19 personas; en 2015, 43; en 2016, 282; y hasta la primera quincena de septiembre de 2017, sumaban 188.

En lo que va del aÃ±o, en el municipio de Chilapa 19 comunidades han registrado hechos violentos, mientras que en Zitlala, siete.

Destaca el Ã©xodo de QuetzalcoatlÃ¡n de las Palmas, una comunidad en el municipio de Zitlala: el 6 de enero del aÃ±o pasado, un grupo armado entrÃ³, asesinÃ³ a seis personas, amenazÃ³ con regresar a matar a los demÃ¡s y la comunidad, cargando a sus muertos, se desplazÃ³.

Suena bastante grave, pero cargaron a sus muertos en una camioneta y todas las familias se salieron.

Hay gente que no soporta el sometimiento de los grupos criminales que los obliga a participar en actividades propias de la delincuencia y terminan huyendo". Manuel Olivares.

SONAR LAS ALARMAS

La maÃ±ana del pasado 19 de septiembre dos cuerpos desmembrados fueron dejados en cuatro bolsas en el barrio San Juan, en Chilapa. Ese mismo dÃ­a, llegaba a la cabecera municipal una MisiÃ³n Civil de ObservaciÃ³n. Ese mismo dÃ­a, mÃ¡s tarde, un sismo causarÃ­a gran devastaciÃ³n en Ciudad de MÃ©xico, Morelos y Puebla.

La MisiÃ³n de ObservaciÃ³n, organizada por la Red Nacional de Organismos Civiles de Derechos Humanos (Red TDT), y en la que participaron las Brigadas Internacionales de Paz (PBI), AmnistÃ­a Internacional, Serapaz MÃ©xico y el Centro de Derechos Humanos de la MontaÃ±a Tlachinollan, buscaba visibilizar los casos y reunirse con el gobernador de Guerrero, HÃ©ctor Astudillo Flores, a fin de emitir una serie de recomendaciones para atender la creciente crisis de inseguridad en Chilapa, sin embargo el encuentro fue pospuesto debido a la emergencia nacional que desatÃ³ el sismo del pasado 19 de septiembre.

La misiÃ³n concluyÃ³ que no hay condiciones de seguridad para las comunidades desplazadas e hizo un llamado al gobierno del estado para garantizar los derechos humanos de las vÃ­ctimas, las comunidades y los defensores de derechos humanos.

Mandan un operativo policiaco para acompaÃ±ar a la misiÃ³n y vemos que esos actores armados lo que hacen es vigilar el trabajo de los defensores y defensoras; falta visiÃ³n de derechos humanos para entender la problemÃ¡tica de las vÃ­ctimas. La forma en que se atiende a defensores y defensoras es colocar en el primer frente al EjÃ©rcito, a la PolicÃ­a.

Hubo tensiÃ³n al llegar a Chilapa, estaba un retÃ©n, es una manera de dar la bienvenida con el fusil en la mano." Abel Barrera Centro Tlachinollan

Para los activistas, la polÃ­tica de seguridad implementada, sobre todo en Guerrero, estÃ¡ siendo causante de la crisis de seguridad, porque consuma mÃ¡s violaciones graves a los derechos humanos, fomenta la impunidad y la falta de acceso a la justicia.
TITLE: Chilapa, el municipio secuestrado: Las comunidades que el narco desplazÃ³

SUMMARY:
If you have your dinner and go about your nightly business without the need for a sweet treat, well good on you.
From peanut butter brownie bars and banana split smoothie, to easy fudge and chocolate s'mores mug cake, here are eight easy, delicious desserts for all us lazy people.
Two-layer no-bake peanut butter brownie barsFrom Minimalist Baker.
If you're equally obsessed with peanut butter and brownies, try these no-bake dessert bars with a brownie crust and a peanut butter top.
For another healthier sweet treat, try these tahini-stuffed medjool dates coated in dark chocolate, coconut flakes and sesame seeds.
TEXT:
If you have your dinner and go about your nightly business without the need for a sweet treat, well good on you. But for the rest of us who look forward to dessert after dinner every single night, you need these recipes in your life.

There are options here for everyone -- healthy, gluten free, vegan -- but the recurring theme is 'no-bake and quick' because ain't nobody got time for baking and faffing about when Netflix is waiting.

From peanut butter brownie bars and banana split smoothie, to easy fudge and chocolate s'mores mug cake, here are eight easy, delicious desserts for all us lazy people.

1. Easy salted oat fudge

From Cookie and Kate.

Made with nut butter, chocolate chips, maple syrup and oats, these delicious chocolate squares taste like a cross between fudge and no-bake cookies. For extra flavour and texture play around with add-ins like shredded coconut, seeds and dried fruit. Here's the recipe.

2. Two-layer no-bake peanut butter brownie bars

From Minimalist Baker.

If you're equally obsessed with peanut butter and brownies, try these no-bake dessert bars with a brownie crust and a peanut butter top. Made with wholesome ingredients like dates, peanuts and almonds, this treat is considered more healthy than your regular brownie. Try the recipe here.

3. Five-minute chocolate fudge s'mores mug cake

From How Sweet Eats.

If you find mug cakes a bit plain, give this recipe a go -- imagine a biscuit base, rich chocolate fudge cake filling and a golden marshmallow topping. And you can make it in under five minutes. Sold. Get the recipe here.

4. Three-ingredient no-churn chocolate ice cream

From The Big Man's World.

Keen for ice cream? This healthy version uses frozen bananas, almond butter and cacao powder to create a smooth, creamy and sweet ice cream -- without dairy or refined sugar. Here's the recipe.

5. Tahini-stuffed dates

From Minimalist Baker.

For another healthier sweet treat, try these tahini-stuffed medjool dates coated in dark chocolate, coconut flakes and sesame seeds. Prep a batch to keep in the fridge and enjoy all week long. Try the recipe here.

6. Chocolate chip cookie dough

From The Big Man's World.

If you're the sort of person who eats most of the cookie dough before it heads into the oven (guilty), satisfy your sweet tooth with no-bake cookie dough made with oats, cashew butter, protein powder and chocolate chips. Get the recipe here.

7. Chocolate-drizzled fruit skewers

From The Healthy Maven.

For an even healthier dessert, these easy skewers are loaded with fruit and drizzled with melted chocolate. They're quick to make and are the ultimate fun treat for kids, too. Try the recipe here.

8. Banana split smoothie

From Minimalist Baker.

Fusing a banana split with a smoothie, this rich chocolatey shake is made from frozen bananas blended with cacao powder, dates, almond milk and almond butter. You need just nine ingredients, one blender and 10 minutes. Here's the recipe.
TITLE: 8 Easy Desserts You Can Make In Minutes

SUMMARY:
The call would have cost some Universal Credit claimants more than 11 percent of their weekly allowance, which is meant to â€œhelp with living costsâ€.
HuffPost UK Calls to the Universal Credit helpline are charged at up to 55p per minute from mobiles in England.
Universal Credit claimants without children and aged under 25 take home just Â£62.94 a week, according to the governmentâ€™s website.
It has also been revealed that calls to the Universal Credit helpline are free for Welsh language speakers.
Universal Credit is due to be rolled out more widely in the coming months, despite persistent reports of problems.
TEXT:
Universal Credit claimants languish on hold to a government helpline while racking up bills as high as Â£16, without the option of an immediate call back, contradicting claims made by Downing Street.

One call placed by HuffPost UK to the dedicated 0345 number on Wednesday afternoon took 12 and a half minutes to be answered in person, at which point an advisor refused to call back straight away due to data protection rules.

The call would have cost some Universal Credit claimants more than 11 percent of their weekly allowance, which is meant to â€œhelp with living costsâ€.

It came amid a growing row over the policy, as Theresa May was earlier forced to defend the up to 55p per minute call charges during Prime Ministerâ€™s Questions.

HuffPost UK Calls to the Universal Credit helpline are charged at up to 55p per minute from mobiles in England. Welsh language calls are free

Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn urged the PM to â€œshow some humanityâ€ and scrap the cost altogether.

The PMâ€™s official spokesperson later suggested there was an immediate call back option, with advisors able to return calls at no cost to the claimant â€œstraight awayâ€.

But Downing Streetâ€™s claim prompted derision from Labour, with Corbynâ€™s spokesperson saying: â€œThe No.10 line that you can ask for a â€˜call backâ€™ is a joke as theyâ€™ve cut so many staff you canâ€™t get through and are held in a queue.â€

And during HuffPostâ€™s call, our reporter was asked to input information via an automated answering service, yet at no time did the service ask for a telephone number for a call back.

After three minutes and 11 seconds, the call was placed in a queue as â€˜Springâ€™ from Vivaldiâ€™s Four Seasons played on loop.

â€˜You can call back laterâ€™

Automatic messages heard in the queue also undermined Number 10â€²s defence.

â€œAll our lines are still busy. Please hold and we will answer your call as soon as we can. Or if you prefer you can call back later,â€ a voice said at regular intervals.

After 12 minutes and 30 seconds, the call was eventually answered by an advisor who said they could not call the reporter back straight away due to data protection rules.

â€œFirstly, I need to know if you are registered with us and complete necessary security checks,â€ they said.

HuffPostâ€™s call ended after 13 minutes and 40 seconds - a total cost to callers on some mobile phone networks of Â£7.51.

Universal Credit claimants without children and aged under 25 take home just Â£62.94 a week, according to the governmentâ€™s website.

The helpline assists those who are confused by the new system or who need to register changes in circumstances.

Some 55,000 calls a week were made to the helpline during August, according to a freedom of information request (pdf).

The request revealed callers have experienced a â€œmaximumâ€ wait time of 29 minutes, costing Â£15.95 to those on mobiles.

â€˜Money I could be using for foodâ€™

â€˜Sueâ€™, a 54-year-old claimant explained to Citizens Advice Bureau (pdf) that she phoned the helpline because she couldnâ€™t use a computer.

â€œThe process is complicated if you arenâ€™t very good at using computers,â€ she said. â€œGoing to the job centre and using wifi all costs money I could be using for food.â€

Some 30 percent of respondents to a Citizens Advice survey of claimants reported calling the helpline more than 10 times.

An earlier call made by HuffPost dropped out unexpectedly after two minutes and 11 seconds, at a cost of Â£1.20 to those on a mobile.

It has also been revealed that calls to the Universal Credit helpline are free for Welsh language speakers.

Criticism has mounted of the new benefit system, which replaces Job Seekerâ€™s Allowance and combines all welfare entitlements into one monthly payment.

Trials of the policy have seen many claimants fall into arrears with rent payments and face homelessness as delays in the first payments of Universal Credit force others to use loan sharks and food banks.

It has been widely condemned by politicians on both sides of the House of Commons, and the issue dominated Wednesdayâ€™s PMQs.

Universal Credit is due to be rolled out more widely in the coming months, despite persistent reports of problems.

It comes as Tory minister Liz Truss appeared on the BBCâ€™s Daily Politics, urging people to go to a job centre to seek advice if they could not afford the charge.

In an awkward exchange, presenter Andrew Neil pointed out hard-pressed families could not afford the time.
TITLE: Revealed: What Really Happens When You Call The Universal Credit Helpline

SUMMARY:
An author, whose novel was photoshopped to create a bizarre â€œnun with a gunâ€ image of Isis recruiter Sally Jones, has hit out at the media for using the picture without any context.
Jones used her Twitter to recruit women and provided practical advice on how to join Isis in Syria.
The nun image, one of only a handful of Jones, is often used by the media without any context, implying it is real.
Sally Jones The 'nun with a gun' image of Sally Jones is actually a crude photoshop of the Divorcing Jack coverâ€œNobody delves any deeper.
â€œItâ€™s become the ultimate stock image.â€In 2014, the Daily Express ran the image under the caption: â€œSally Jones in her nun and gun outfitâ€.
TEXT:
An author, whose novel was photoshopped to create a bizarre â€œnun with a gunâ€ image of Isis recruiter Sally Jones, has hit out at the media for using the picture without any context.

Colin Bateman, who has seen the cover of his darkly comic 1995 book Divorcing Jack apparently doctored by Jones and used repeatedly by the press, said the picture has become the â€œultimate stock image.â€

â€œNobody ever asks why on earth a Syrian terrorist would be holding a Jack Russell,â€ he told HuffPost UK.

Sally Jones, who was also known as the White Widow, died earlier this year in a US drone strike in Syria, according to multiple reports, including one in The Sun, which printed the oft-used picture of her on its front page.

Jones used her Twitter to recruit women and provided practical advice on how to join Isis in Syria.

She is believed to have been behind dozens of terror plots and was the leader of the secret Anwar al-Awlaki battalionâ€™s female wing.

Reacting to news of Jonesâ€™ death on Facebook, Bateman said â€œshe just hijacked the image, which was then itself hijacked by the worldâ€™s mediaâ€.

The nun image, one of only a handful of Jones, is often used by the media without any context, implying it is real.

Bateman, a Northern Irish screenwriter and ex-journalist, told HuffPost he was dismayed how often the media would use the picture with no context or explanation of its origin.

Sally Jones The 'nun with a gun' image of Sally Jones is actually a crude photoshop of the Divorcing Jack cover

â€œNobody delves any deeper. Obviously thereâ€™s very little information about her so they grasp at what theyâ€™ve got. Nobody ever goes deep on it and asks why itâ€™s being used or where itâ€™s from or where it originated.

â€œItâ€™s become the ultimate stock image.â€

In 2014, the Daily Express ran the image under the caption: â€œSally Jones in her nun and gun outfitâ€.

In January 2015, The Times called it an â€œIsis recruitment posterâ€.

In September 2014, The Evening Standard ran it, calling it â€œbizarreâ€.

When asked if he wanted the media to stop using it, Bateman said: â€œI was a journalist for 20 years. I know how it works... Sometimes itâ€™s the easiest thing you grab [to use as a picture].

â€œBut I just think a little bit of context is useful to have.â€

HuffPost understands it was taken from one of Jonesâ€™ social media accounts when it was first reported that she had travelled with her husband Junaid Hussain to Syria to join Isis in 2013.

Twitter 'White Widow' Sally Jones has reportedly been killed in a US drone strike

He was killed by a US drone in 2015, and had reportedly been planning â€œbarbaric attacks against the Westâ€ including terror plots targeting high profile public commemorations this summer.

Bateman believes Jones herself may have created the image. She played in an all-female punk group in the 1990s and Bateman said this coincided roughly with the time of the bookâ€™s success.

â€œThe book was quite punky and had a lot of punk references. I presume she picked it up around then, because the image hasnâ€™t been on the book for quite a few years, so itâ€™s not something sheâ€™s picked up recently,â€ he said.

Bateman remembers first seeing the photoshopped image when he opened a newspaper and saw it on page three.

â€œIt was just a shock,â€ he said. â€œYou read into it and you realise how surreal and bizarre it is that this has come back to haunt you.â€

Since then, Bateman has had no one had ever approached him over the connection between his book and the picture.

He said when he first saw it on The Daily Mail, he posted a comment pointing out the connection but had no response.

â€œI know itâ€™s been used for terrible things. If in some way Iâ€™m connected to even one person being recruited to go out there. I really hate that fact,â€ he said.

â€œItâ€™s just a bizarre connection to have. Iâ€™m just sorry if any people have suffered because of it.â€

He added: â€œIt corrupts my happy memories of the book in a way but also Iâ€™m quite proud of the image and the book, the fact that people are still talking about it 22 years after it was published.â€

Bateman, who has written 33 novels and six screenplays - including the film adaptation of Divorcing Jack - said the episode may inspire him to write a novel.
TITLE: Sally Jones' Reported Death Prompts 'Divorcing Jack' Author To Lament How Media Use Photoshopped Nun Image

TEXT:
ADOPTION - Il y a des images qui font du bien. Et voir la rÃ©action de cette petite fille quand elle apprend qu'elle va finalement Ãªtre adoptÃ©e par sa famille d'accueil va sÃ»rement vous rÃ©chauffer le cÅ“ur.

So stellte dem Kriminologie-Professor zufolge die Gruppe der 14- bis 30-JÃ¤hrigen bundesweit im Jahr 2014 gerade einmal 9,3 Prozent der BevÃ¶lkerung. Demnach begingen junge MÃ¤nner bereits vor der FlÃ¼chtlingskrise fÃ¼nfmal so viele Gewaltdelikte wie der Durchschnitts-BÃ¼rger.

Bei Sexualdelikten seien die Zahlen Ã¤hnlich hoch, weiÃŸ der Forscher, der von 2000 bis 2003 fÃ¼r die SPD niedersÃ¤chsischer Justizminister war.

Hier rÃ¤cht sich offenbar der erschwerte Familiennachzug. "Wer Frau und Kinder bei sich hat, begeht weniger Straftaten", so Pfeiffer.

Zwar ist es Pfeiffer und Rettenberger zufolge ein Problem, dass viele FlÃ¼chtlinge aus Macho-Kulturen kÃ¤men. Doch klar ist den Experten zufolge auch: Die weit Ã¼berwiegende Mehrheit der Menschen mit einem traditionellen oder gar mittelalterlichen Frauenbild wird nicht gewalttÃ¤tig.

Pfeiffer gibt zu bedenken: Die groÃŸe Zahl der Zuwanderer mit Bleibeperspektive wisse genau, dass jede Straftat ihre Chance, "sich hier dauerhaft etwas aufzubauen, zerstÃ¶ren kann". Dies vermindere bei vielen de Bereitschaft, Straftaten zu begehen.

Aus Sicht Rettenbergers machen auch die LebensumstÃ¤nde manche FlÃ¼chtlinge zu TÃ¤tern. Denn vielen Asylsuchenden fehlen zunÃ¤chst in den Erstaufnahme-Einrichtungen die soziale Integration, ein geregelter Tagesablauf und eine Arbeitsstelle. "Unmut und Frustration sind die entscheidenden Quellen fÃ¼r AggressivitÃ¤t und sexuelle Gewalt", sagt der Kriminalpsychologe.

Die bayerische MÃ¤r von der massenhaften Zunahme an Vergewaltigungen

Ein Problem ist Experten zufolge die schlechte Kommunikation vieler Politiker, die glauben mit Zuspitzungen zur FlÃ¼chtlingskriminalitÃ¤t punkten zu kÃ¶nnen.

Selbst Polizeigewerkschafts-Chef Wendt sagt: "Mit Kriminalstatistiken sollte man keinen Wahlkampf machen."

So musste Landesinnenminister Joachim Herrmann die bayerische Vergewaltigungs-Statistik bereits kurz nach deren Vorstellung relativieren. Der CSU-Mann hatte behauptet, bayernweit habe im ersten Halbjahr mit 685 im Vergleich zum Vorjahr 48 Prozent mehr Vergewaltigungen gegeben.

Allerdings handelte es sich, wie das Ministerium spÃ¤ter einrÃ¤umen musste, um eine nicht einfach mit dem Vorjahr vergleichbare Zahl. Denn in der Statistik tauchen nach einer GesetzesverschÃ¤rfung seit diesem Jahr anders als noch 2016 nun auch sexuelle NÃ¶tigungen auf. Dies sowie ein verÃ¤ndertes Anzeigenverhalten sind nach Ansicht von Fachleuten wesentliche Ursachen fÃ¼r den Anstieg â€“ doch bei der ersten Vorstellung der Zahlen war davon keine Rede.

Doch was kann der Staat gegen die vorhandenen Probleme unternehmen?

Pfeiffer empfiehlt, diejenigen FlÃ¼chtlinge, die wie etwa viele Nordafrikaner keine Bleibeperspektive haben, noch deutlich stÃ¤rker als bislang mit freiwilligen RÃ¼ckkehrprogrammen zur Ausreise zu bewegen. Wendt prÃ¤feriert dagegen eine "konsequente Abschiebung von SexualstraftÃ¤tern unter den FlÃ¼chtlingen".

Diese schadeten ja auch den "tatsÃ¤chlich Verfolgtenâ€œ, da das Misstrauen in der BevÃ¶lkerung sonst weiter zunehme. Klar ist aber auch: Bei manchen Bewohnern von HÃ¶henkirchen-Siegertsbrunn wird es dauern, bis ihre Angst vergeht.

(mf)
TITLE: Was hinter den angeblich drastisch angestiegenen Vergewaltigungen durch FlÃ¼chtlinge steckt

SUMMARY:
Movie mogul Harvey Weinstein could be stripped of his British honour following the allegations of sexual assault and harassment against him, Downing Street has suggested.
But as Weinstein faced new claims of serial rape, Theresa Mayâ€™s spokesman signalled on Wednesday that he could lose the honour if found to have brought the system â€œinto disreputeâ€.
BAFTA, the British equivalent of the Oscars, also announced it was suspending Weinstein from its membership.
An open letter to the Prime Minister demanding action was signed by shadow ministers Chi Onwurah, Jack Dromey and Kevin Brennan.
Shadow Women and Equalities Secretary Dawn Butler and Womenâ€™s Parliamentary Labour Party chair Jess Phillips also demanded the honour be removed.
TEXT:
Movie mogul Harvey Weinstein could be stripped of his British honour following the allegations of sexual assault and harassment against him, Downing Street has suggested.

The Hollywood producer was awarded an honorary CBE in 2004 for services to the British film industry as he worked on a string of films that won Oscars and BAFTAs.

But as Weinstein faced new claims of serial rape, Theresa Mayâ€™s spokesman signalled on Wednesday that he could lose the honour if found to have brought the system â€œinto disreputeâ€.

In No.10â€²s strongest intervention yet in the controversy, the Prime Ministerâ€™s official spokesman stressed just how â€œunacceptableâ€ she viewed the allegations against Weinstein and praised the â€œcourageâ€ of women who had come forward.

Downing Streetâ€™s words came as a group of senior Labour politicians urged the Honours Forfeiture Committee to act swiftly to start the process of stripping away the CBE.

BAFTA, the British equivalent of the Oscars, also announced it was suspending Weinstein from its membership.

Later, the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences - which hosts the Oscars - said the sexual abuse allegations against Weinstein are â€œrepugnantâ€ and â€œabhorrentâ€ and it will be holding a meeting on Saturday to discuss any action to be taken.

Barack and Michelle Obama became the latest high profile political figures to condemn the former movie producer, saying that they were â€œdisgustedâ€ by the reports.

Bob Riha Jr via Getty Images Harvey Weinstein with Gwyneth Paltrow with her Oscar for 'Shakespeare in Love'

The disgraced Hollywood producer faced new claims on Tuesday night that he had sexually harassed actresses Gwyneth Paltrow and Angelina Jolie, along with many other women.

Weinstein has denied the charges of non-consensual sex â€œunequivocallyâ€. In a statement, his spokeswoman said: â€œMr Weinstein obviously canâ€™t speak to anonymous allegations, but with respect to any women who have made allegations on the record, Mr Weinstein believes that all of these relationships were consensual.â€

The PMâ€™s official spokesman said that May found the latest reports â€œdeeply concerningâ€.

â€œAny unwanted sexual activity is completely unacceptable and any allegations should be fully investigated.

â€œAnyone who comes forward to report these kind of allegations should be praised for their courage.â€

He added: â€œThe independent Honours Forfeiture Committee considers cases when the honours system is brought into disrepute. Their discussions are confidential. Itâ€™s right that we let them get on with their work.â€

PA Wire/PA Images Theresa May

British MPs from all parties have urged the committee to take action.

Former Tory Cabinet minister Maria Miller said it should consider the case, while former deputy Labour leader Harriet Harman said: â€œThese allegations cast a shadow over all the other people who proudly have CBE after their nameâ€.

An open letter to the Prime Minister demanding action was signed by shadow ministers Chi Onwurah, Jack Dromey and Kevin Brennan. Shadow Women and Equalities Secretary Dawn Butler and Womenâ€™s Parliamentary Labour Party chair Jess Phillips also demanded the honour be removed.
TITLE: Harvey Weinstein Could Be Stripped Of British Honour, No.10 Downing Street Says

TEXT:
Top candidate of Social Democratic Party (SPOe) and Chancellor Christian Kern, top candidate of Peoples Party (OeVP) and Foreign Minister Sebastian Kurz and head of Austrian far-right Freedom Party (FPO) Heinz-Christian Strache attend a TV discussion in Vienna, Austria, October 1, 2017. REUTERS/Leonhard Foeger | Leonhard Foeger / Reuters

Am 15. Oktober wÃ¤hlt Ã–sterreich einen neuen Kanzler

Die Spitzenkandidaten der fremdenfeindlichen FPÃ– und der konservativen Ã–VP trafen am Sonntag in einem TV-Duell aufeinander

Die Harmonie zwischen Kurz und Strache deutet auf eine mÃ¶gliche schwarz-blaue Koalition hin

Am kommenden Sonntag wÃ¤hlen die Ã–sterreicher ein neues Parlament â€“ und schon jetzt deutet sich eine beunruhigende Regierungskonstellation an. Eine so genannte schwarz-blaue Koalition aus der regierungserfahrenen Ã–VP und der rechtspopulistischen FPÃ– gilt als immer wahrscheinlicher.

Beim TV-Duell am Sonntag zeigten FPÃ–-Chef Heinz-Christian Strache und der konservative Ã–VP-Obmann Sebastian Kurz, wie wohlgesonnen sie sich sind.

Gleich zu Beginn der Diskussionsrunde auf dem Sender Puls4 kam es zu einer bemerkenswerten Szene.

FPÃ–-Mann Strache schenkte dem 31-jÃ¤hrigen Ã–VP-Chef eine Ausgabe des beliebten Detektivspiels â€˜Cluedoâ€˜. â€œVielleicht kÃ¶nnt mer das mit dem Herrn Kern spielen, vielleicht kommt man da drauf wer wirklich die Verantwortung hat,â€ schlug Strache vor.

Er bezog sich damit auf die Facebook-Hetzkampagne gegen den AuÃŸenminister, hinter der die sozialdemokratische Partei von Kanzler Christian Kern stecken soll.

Der Feind meines Feindes

Kurz und Kern hatten ihre Differenzen bereits in einem vorangegangenen Duell ausgetragen. Das sogenannte â€œDirty Campaigningâ€ war das am heftigsten diskutierte Thema. Kurzâ€™ Partei Ã–VP hatte am Freitag sogar eine Klage wegen Verhetzung gegen die Sozialdemokraten angekÃ¼ndigt.

Auf Facebook-Seiten mit den Namen "Wir fÃ¼r Sebastian Kurz" und die "Wahrheit Ã¼ber Sebastian Kurz" waren rassistische Inhalte im Namen des Ã–VP-Chefs verbreitet worden. Laut einer Recherche des Ã¶sterreichischen Magazins "Profil" und der Zeitung "Die Presse" soll der in Israel festgenommene Ex-Kern-Berater Tal Silberstein hinter der Kampagne stecken.

ZunÃ¤chst war jedoch die fremdenfeindliche FPÃ– in den Verdacht geraten, hinter den Fake-Profilen zu stecken. Ob tatsÃ¤chlich die SPÃ– den Auftrag zur Silberstein-Kampagne gegeben hat, ist zwar noch unklar. Klar ist jedoch, dass Ã–VP und FPÃ– in der Reaktion zusammengerÃ¼ckt sind.

"Geschenksackerl fÃ¼r den Hund"

WÃ¤hrend sich Kurz und Kern zankend in den Haaren lagen, verlief das Duell zwischen Strache und Kurz so weitaus harmonischer. Fast freundschaftlich.

Auch Kurzâ€™ machte dem FPÃ–-Mann â€“ so sah es die Sendung vor â€“ ein Geschenk â€“ und auch sein PrÃ¤sent hatte einen starken symbolischen Wert. Er Ã¼berreichte dem Kontrahenten ein â€œGeschenksackerlâ€ fÃ¼r dessen Hund â€“ bekanntlich der billigste Trick um sich Freunde zu machen. â€œSie haben einen wirklich coolen Hund, den ich immer wieder auf Facebook bewundern darfâ€, legte der Shootingstar der Ã¶sterreichischen Politik nach.



Ã–VP-Chef Sebastian Kurz schenkte FPÃ–-Mann Heinz-Christian Strache einen Quietsche-Erdball fÃ¼r dessen Hund. Quelle:

Screenshot Puls 4

Koalition is in the air

Die Debatte verlief dann auch weiter ohne groÃŸe Reibungen. In vielen Punkten pflichteten sich die Gegner bei.

Etwa was die militÃ¤rische NeutralitÃ¤t Ã–sterreichs anbelangt: Strache bekrÃ¤ftigte seine Ãœberzeugung, Ã–sterreich solle niemals Teil eines internationalen VerteidigungsbÃ¼ndnisses werden. â€œDas wollen wir unseren Kindern und Kindeskindern ersparen, dass wir nie wieder in einen Offensivkrieg oder Konflikt hinein gezogen werdenâ€.

Kurz widersprach nicht, hielt jedoch fest, dass er sich eine stÃ¤rkere Zusammenarbeit auf europÃ¤ischer Ebene im Kampf gegen den Terror wÃ¼nsche. Das hieÃŸe aber keineswegs, dass dies auf Basis einer europÃ¤ischen Armee oder eines NATO-Beitritts geschehen mÃ¼sse.

Und selbst wenn Uneinigkeit herrschte, legten die beiden einen bemerkenswert respektvollen Umgangston an den Tag, etwa im Punkt Migration.

Auf die Kritik des FPÃ–-Mannes an seinem spÃ¤ten Umschwung in der Migrationspolitik (â€œ2015 sind sie noch auf dem SchoÃŸ von Frau Merkel gesessen") reagierte Kurz mit einem Verweis auf das Koalitionsabkommen mit der SPÃ–, die er nicht Ã¼berstimmen wollte.

"Ich hÃ¤tte liebend gerne mit ihnen gestimmt, dass keine Familienbeihilfe ins Ausland geht, und vieles andereâ€œ, erklÃ¤rte Kurz. Der AuÃŸenminister machte keinen Hehl daraus, dass er bereit ist, Politik mit den Rechten zu machen.

Er sprach von den groÃŸen Fortschritten, die man seit 2015 gemacht habe. Die illegale Migration konnte â€œmassiv begrenzt werdenâ€, stellte der AuÃŸenminister fest und fÃ¼gte hinzu: â€œIch ladâ€™ Sie ein, unterstÃ¼tzen Sie mich dabei, diesen Kurs weiter fortzusetzenâ€.

Darf man das schon als Koalitionswunsch verstehen?



â€œDuett mit wenig MisstÃ¶nenâ€

Der Ã¶sterreichische â€œKurierâ€ glaubt genau das: "Man merkt, dass da zwei mÃ¶gliche Partner miteinander diskutiert haben,â€ wird der ehemalige Ã¶sterreichische Moderator Gerald GroÃŸ in der Analyse des Duells zitiert. Weiterhin kommt die Zeitung zu dem SchluÃŸ: Manchmal hatte man den Eindruck, dass die beiden sich geradezu Ã¼berwinden mÃ¼ssen, einander zu kritisieren.



Auch das Boulevardmedium â€œOE24â€ findet, dass sich beide inhaltlich Ã¼ber weite Strecken einig waren. â€œDie Presseâ€ schreibt von einem â€œDuett mit wenigen MisstÃ¶nenâ€.

Am Ende gab es nochmal Geschenke: Shootingstar Kurz Ã¼berreichte Strache ein Buch Ã¼ber Ã–VP-Stammvater Alois Mock, â€œdas daran erinnern soll, dass wir Ã–sterreicher, wenn wir wollen, die Kraft haben in Europa wirklich etwas zu bewirken.â€

Ob Kurz und Strache dieses Projekt tatsÃ¤chlich gemeinsam angehen, wird die Wahl am 15. Oktober zeigen.
TITLE: TV-Duell in Ã–sterreich: Eine Szene zeigt, was dem Land nach der Wahl blÃ¼hen kÃ¶nnte

L'accord de libre-Ã©change UE-Canada (CETA) a Ã©tÃ© imposÃ© aux forceps malgrÃ© les manifestations et l'intense dÃ©bat politique. Pendant ce temps, les nÃ©gociations avec le Mercosur (BrÃ©sil, Argentine, Paraguay et Uruguay) allaient bon train, dans la plus complÃ¨te opacitÃ©, et les Ã©leveurs bovins, une nouvelle fois, paieront l'addition.

AprÃ¨s avoir offert 50.000 tonnes aux USA puis 50.000 tonnes au Canada, l'Union europÃ©enne propose d'autoriser 70.000 tonnes de viande bovine Ã  l'importation en Europe, soit l'Ã©quivalent d'un quart de la production irlandaise, ou de celle de l'ensemble des Ã©leveurs du Massif Central en France. Ce jeu de Monopoly alimentaire mondial est fou. Il tue l'emploi chez nous et chez les autres, il dÃ©truit la vie rurale de nos campagnes, il accÃ©lÃ¨re la dÃ©forestation de la forÃªt amazonienne, il sacrifie notre souverainetÃ© alimentaire.

Hier, la Commission europÃ©enne a rendu compte des nÃ©gociations en cours devant la Commission de l'Agriculture du Parlement europÃ©en. Cette rÃ©union se dÃ©roulait Ã  huis-clos devant les dÃ©putÃ©s.

En octobre 2016, l'Union europÃ©enne a fait une offre qui permettra, selon elle, de gagner des marchÃ©s pour les secteurs europÃ©ens de l'automobile, de l'Ã©quipement, de la chimie et de la pharmacie. Les assurances et les banques seront Ã©galement bien servies, sans oublier bien entendu les services environnementaux et les grandes entreprises de l'alimentation et de la distribution. Volkswagen, Renault, BNP Paribas, BASF, Lactalis & Co comptent parmi les bÃ©nÃ©ficiaires. Ces entreprises Ã©conomiseront au passage 4 milliards d'euros de droit de douanes. Autant d'argent qui ne se retrouvera pas dans le budget de l'Ã©tat brÃ©silien pour amÃ©liorer les services publics mais dans les poches des actionnaires.

Les paysans, et en particulier les Ã©leveurs bovins, vont payer la facture et elle est sacrement salÃ©e. J'espÃ¨re que tous les dÃ©putÃ©s de tous les groupes politiques qui se sont indignÃ©s hier se mobiliseront dans leur pays et au Parlement europÃ©en pour s'opposer Ã  la ratification, et n'oublieront pas leur colÃ¨re le jour du vote. Mais dÃ¨s Ã  prÃ©sent, je vous encourage Ã  leur envoyer un email de soutien car certains pourraient flancher dans la derniÃ¨re ligne droite. Les emails sont simples : prenom.nom@ep.europa.eu

Pour moi, cela donne jose.bove@ep.europa.eu, pour les autres consulter la liste des dÃ©putÃ©s franÃ§ais sur: europarl.europa. eu/meps/fr/map.html

Pour lutter contre le populisme, rien ne vaut l'activisme.

Ã€ voir Ã©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Avec ce nouvel accord de libre Ã©change, ce sont encore les petits Ã©leveurs franÃ§ais qui vont payer la facture

SUMMARY:
Photo by Igor Ovsyannykov on UnsplashThis year India went through one of the single biggest tax reforms since Independence.
The GST is crippling India's craft communities and as always, it's the poor that suffer the most.
It's affected a lot of people in the craft industry.
Photo by Igor Ovsyannykov on UnsplashEleven million people work in the craft industry and many are either semi-literate or illiterate.
On one hand the Indian government champions its craft industry but on the other, it's taxing the very means by which the industry can prosper.
TEXT:
Photo by Igor Ovsyannykov on Unsplash

This year India went through one of the single biggest tax reforms since Independence. Designed to unify the country into a common market, the Goods and Services Tax promises to transform India's economy. But only a few months in, the cracks are beginning to show.

The GST is crippling India's craft communities and as always, it's the poor that suffer the most.

So why does this news bother me? Well, as a retailer of fair trade handloom accessories crafted by artisans in India, it makes sense for me to keep my ear to the ground. But it's more than that. I have a huge respect for those artisans who create such beautiful textiles.

Scouring the news online, I click through sad images of skinny artisans sat by idle handlooms. Handlooms that once filled the room with their clattering sounds, now lie silent. I see protests taking place all over India. Angry fists punching the air. Orchestrated strikes rising up from as far as Andhra Pradesh to Bengal. I read about Kashmiri carpet weavers with no work and sweet shops in Kolkota staging strikes.

It's affected a lot of people in the craft industry. In particular, rural self employed handloom weavers. Previously taxed at 0%, they now have to pay a 5% tax on raw materials. Manufacturing costs have gone up, orders have stopped coming in and rigorous paperwork mixed with confusing processes has disabled the illiterate.



Photo by Igor Ovsyannykov on Unsplash

Eleven million people work in the craft industry and many are either semi-literate or illiterate. They don't have registered businesses or accountants to help file their online returns, which now have to be completed three times a month. With no access to a computer, an accountant or an essential GST number to sell and ship their products, the future looks grim.

Wanting to find out more, I contacted House of Wandering Silk founder Katherine Neumann. As a social enterprise partner, I was keen to find out her thoughts;

The VAT tax system before was a big mess - full of loopholes and different across states and with so many tax brackets. GST helps to streamline and standardise the tax system here and has closed out a lot of the loopholes. But I think it was a mistake to raise taxes on the handloom sector. Some of our partners have had their textiles stuck with them, unable to post, as the couriers are demanding GST numbers to ship their goods. These people shouldn't be required to pay taxes. India has a very low rate of taxpayers, in other words most people and businesses are evading taxes. I think it would make more sense to focus on those who should be paying lots of taxes and make sure they do.

The harsh realities are that many artisans live below the poverty line in sub-standard mud brick housing. The majority are women, which in India brings with it huge challenges of gender, caste and social inequality. Though not reported widely, many weavers have succumbed to suicide, as increasing debt, rising prices of raw materials and shrinking markets push them over the edge. With little access to infrastructure, competition from cheaper machine-made textiles and profiteering middlemen - the GST just seems to be another blow to the already hard life of an artisan.



Photo by Igor Ovsyannykov on Unsplash

The issues haven't affected my business - yet. However I'm concerned about the future of handloom. The handloom sector is the second largest economy in India. Almost 95% of the world's hand-woven cloth is from here. Taking influence from the diverse cultures and regions of India, it's labour intensive methods and skills passed down through generations, has earned the respect of the world. So why isn't it celebrated in India like it is in the luxury market overseas? To see the decline of this industry would be a huge cultural blow to India and to us. As one of the most sustainable and green economies, the Indian government should be pushing this industry globally. It seems ironic that they are not doing more, considering there are many government funded fairs and events promoting weavers and textiles. There's even a National Handloom Day.

On one hand the Indian government champions its craft industry but on the other, it's taxing the very means by which the industry can prosper. It's preventing the poor from even earning enough to survive. By inadvertently targeting the vulnerable, they are alienating talent and potentially contributing to the exodus of rural workers, who would be forced to close their businesses and seek alternative employment in towns and cities.

As a brand that promotes the beauty of textiles and skills of artisans to a global market, I hope the protests don't fall on deaf ears and the movement to bring tax relief to the handloom industry succeeds.

After all, it's part of India's history and heritage. It's part of its DNA.
TITLE: Hanging By A Thread: Why The Introduction Of India's Tax Reforms Is Crippling Craft Communities

ADVERTISEMENTYedu Krishnan, the first Dalit priest of Kerala, scripted history when he performed prayers at the Manappuram Mahadeva temple at Valanjavattom in Pathanamthitta district on Monday.
Challenging centuries of discrimination and prejudice against Dalits in India, the 22-year-old opened the sanctum sanctorum of Shiva temple at Keecherival.
Krishnan is one of the six Dalit priests who have been recruited by the Travancore Devaswom Board, which manages over 1,000 shrines in the state, including the famous Lord Ayyappa temple at Sabarimala.
For the past five years, I was working as a priest at Devi Temple at Valiyakulangara in Ernakulam district.
The recruitment of the Dalit priests comes ahead of the 81st anniversary of the historic Temple Entry proclamation on November 12.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Yedu Krishnan, the first Dalit priest of Kerala, scripted history when he performed prayers at the Manappuram Mahadeva temple at Valanjavattom in Pathanamthitta district on Monday.

Challenging centuries of discrimination and prejudice against Dalits in India, the 22-year-old opened the sanctum sanctorum of Shiva temple at Keecherival.

Krishnan is one of the six Dalit priests who have been recruited by the Travancore Devaswom Board, which manages over 1,000 shrines in the state, including the famous Lord Ayyappa temple at Sabarimala.

Speaking to The Indian Express, Krishnan, who hails from the C Pulaya community in Thrissur, said, "I never felt any discrimination over caste. For the past five years, I was working as a priest at Devi Temple at Valiyakulangara in Ernakulam district. Today, when I left, many non-Dalit visitors to the temple turned emotional."

Krishnan, who was born to daily-wage laborers Ravi PK and Leela, told The Times of India that he was fascinated with temples since age six and that he had started learning Sanskrit from Class V. The young priest is presently pursuing his MA in Sanskrit Literature.

Krishnan told TOI, "This is the culture of Kerala. The nation should follow this."

The new Dalit recruits have reportedly been told to join their allotted temples in 15 days.

Kerala Hindu Aikya Vedi general secretary E S Biju told The Indian Express that there have been protests against the appointment of Dalits as priests in the past. "However, now there is a change in the mindset of people. The concern of the faithful is that the priests should be well-versed in temple matters and should lead a life becoming of a priest," he said.

The recruitment of the Dalit priests comes ahead of the 81st anniversary of the historic Temple Entry proclamation on November 12. PTI pointed out that the royal decree opened temples in the erstwhile state of Travancore to those who were regarded as lower caste Hindus.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: First Dalit Priest Of Kerala Scripts History By Performing Prayers At Shiva Temple

TEXT:
Dem Tod von der Schippe gesprungen? Vielleicht! In jedem Fall haben sich Stars wie Christina Applegate (45) und Angelina Jolie (42) einschneidenden Operationen unterzogen, um den Krebs zu besiegen. Sie und viele andere Promi-Damen lieÃŸen sich beide BrÃ¼ste entfernen, im Fachjargon Mastektomie genannt.

"Eine schrecklich nette Familie " mit Christina Applegate kÃ¶nnen Sie sich bei Amazon Prime ansehen

Christina Applegate

Als Kelly "Dumpfbacke" Bundy wurde sie mit der Erfolgssitcom "Eine schrecklich nette Familie" (1987-1997) bekannt. Alles andere als dumm war dagegen ihre Entscheidung fÃ¼r das Leben: 2008 lieÃŸ sich Christina Applegate nach einer Brustkrebs-Diagnose die Original-BrÃ¼ste entfernen. Vor zwei Wochen wurden ihr auch EierstÃ¶cke und Eileiter entfernt.

Angelina Jolie

Eine riesige Welle schlug auch das Ã¶ffentliche Bekenntnis zur Brust-OP von Hollywood-Superstar und Sex-Symbol Angelina Jolie. Sie hatte sich 2013 die BrÃ¼ste entfernen lassen, ein Jahr spÃ¤ter folgten die EierstÃ¶cke - "Meine Kinder werden nicht sagen mÃ¼ssen: 'Meine Mutter ist an Eierstockkrebs gestorben'."

Anastacia

SÃ¤ngerin Anastacia (49) wÃ¤hlte ebenfalls die drastische Variante, nachdem sie seit der Diagnose 2003 jahrelang gegen den Brustkrebs angekÃ¤mpft hatte. Als der Krebs 2013 wiederkam, unterzog sie sich einer beidseitigen Mastektomie.

Rita Wilson

Das Thema erneut auf den Tisch gebracht hat Filmemacherin Rita Wilson (60, "My Big Fat Greek Wedding"). Wie sie 2015 bekanntgab, war bei ihr Brustkrebs diagnostiziert worden, woraufhin sie sich zur OP entschloss.

Olivia Newton-John

Bei dem britisch-australischen "Grease"-Star Olivia Newton-John (69) wurde 1992 Brustkrebs diagnostiziert. Sie unterzog sich einer Mastektomie. 25 Jahre lang hÃ¶rte man nichts mehr zum Thema. Tolle Aussichten eigentlich, doch leider gab die KÃ¼nstlerin im Mai 2017 bekannt, erneut gegen die heimtÃ¼ckische Krankheit ankÃ¤mpfen zu mÃ¼ssen.

Sharon Osbourne

Reality-Star und Schockrocker-Gattin Sharon Osbourne (65) erhoffte sich ebenfalls viel von der drastischen Operation. Die Angst vor einem mÃ¶glichen Brustkrebs veranlasste auch sie dazu, sich beide BrÃ¼ste abnehmen zu lassen, wie sie 2012 bekanntgab.

Kathy Bates

Auch Kathy Bates (69, "Misery") verÃ¶ffentlichte 2012, dass sie sich wegen Brustkrebs ihre beiden BrÃ¼ste abnehmen lieÃŸ. "Nach langer Ãœberlegung habe ich eine doppelte Mastektomie vornehmen lassen. Zum GlÃ¼ck muss ich mich keiner Strahlen- oder Chemotherapie unterziehen", erklÃ¤rte sie damals in einem Interview. Zuvor hatte sie bereits ihren Eierstockkrebs Ã¼berstanden.

Patricia Kelly

Kurz vor ihrem 40. Geburtstag wurde bei Patricia Kelly (47) Brustkrebs diagnostiziert. Daraufhin lieÃŸ sie sich im Oktober 2010 das Gewebe in ihrer Brust herausoperieren. "Es hat unmenschlich wehgetan. Man hatte das GefÃ¼hl, als wenn tausend Messer die Brust zerschneiden. Es brannte alles wie Feuer", schilderte die SÃ¤ngerin die Operation spÃ¤ter im Interview mit "Stern TV". Seitdem trÃ¤gt sie eine Prothese.

Wie genau die OP ablÃ¤uft, erklÃ¤rte der einstige Kelly-Family-Star im Interview auch: "Der Innenbereich, also das Gewebe wurde entfernt, die Haut bleibt bestehen und die Prothese ersetzt das Gewebe." Sie sei dankbar, dass sie sich trotz der Prothese weiblich fÃ¼hlen kÃ¶nne und freut sich: "Ich hÃ¤tte vor der OP nie gedacht, dass es so schÃ¶n ist. Ich bin nur dankbar: Ich kann trotzdem schÃ¶n und weiblich sein." So wird es den anderen Stars hoffentlich auch ergangen sein...
TITLE: Diese Promi-Frauen lieÃŸen wegen Krebs ihre BrÃ¼ste entfernen

TEXT:
TV-Duell in Niedersachsen: SPD-Mann Weil gerÃ¤t bei einer entscheidenden Frage ins Schwimmen | NDR

Das TV-Duell vor der Niedersachsenwahl wurde zu einem hitzigen Wettstreit

SPD-MinisterprÃ¤sident Weil prÃ¤sentierte sich gut aufgelegt â€“ bei einer Frage verlor er den Faden

GewissermaÃŸen ist die Landtagswahl in Niedersachsen schon jetzt die bessere Bundestagswahl. Wenige Tage bevor die WÃ¤hler Ã¼ber das neue Parlament in Hannover abstimmen, bewegen sich CDU und SPD in Umfragen auf AugenhÃ¶he.

Auch beim TV-Duell der Spitzenkandidaten Stephan Weil (SPD) und Bernd Althusmann (CDU) am Dienstagabend mussten Zuschauer die Differenzen der Volksparteien nicht mit der Lupe suchen.

Stattdessen lieferten sich MinisterprÃ¤sident Weil und sein konservativer Herausforderer ein leidenschaftliches Duell.

Der SPD-Kandidat, den viele nach dem plÃ¶tzlichen Verlust der Regierungsmehrheit nach dem FraktionsÃ¼bertritt der GrÃ¼nen Elke Twesten bereits angezÃ¤hlt hatten, konnte Althusmanns Angriffe Ã¼ber weite Strecken abwehren.

Sonntagsfrage #LTWNds Niedersachsen â€¢ INSA/BILD: SPD 33 %, CDU 32 %, GRÃœ 10 %, FDP 10 %, AfD 7 %, LIN 5 %, Son 3 % â€“ https://t.co/3YZHdks9fW pic.twitter.com/7MkZqClZtU â€” Wahlrecht.de (@Wahlrecht_de) 9. Oktober 2017

Nur bei einer entscheidenden Frage kam der SPD-Mann ins Schwimmen. Dabei hÃ¤tte er es besser wissen mÃ¼ssen.

Weil will sich nicht zu Rot-Rot-GrÃ¼n Ã¤uÃŸern

Als die Frage nach mÃ¶glichen Koalitionen nach dem Urnengang der Niedersachsen am Sonntag aufkam, schaltete Althusmann auf Angriff. Auch der CDU-Kandidat weiÃŸ, dass ein rot-rot-grÃ¼nes BÃ¼ndnis â€“ anders als im Bund â€“ in Niedersachsen in Reichweite ist.

"Vielleicht Ã¤uÃŸern Sie sich dazu heute mal", forderte der CDU-Mann in Bezug auf die Linkspartei. "Sie eiern herum."

FÃ¼r die Konservativen ist das links-grÃ¼n-sozialdemokratische Miteinander ein Schreckgespenst. Und auch Weil schien sich nicht offensiv zu einer solchen Option positionieren zu wollen.

Der Sozialdemokrat blockte recht ungeschickt ab: Man befasse sich natÃ¼rlich Ã¤uÃŸerst kritisch mit den Linken. "Das ist eine ganz klare Aussage." War es nicht.

Fast war es, als habe der MinisterprÃ¤sident das Bundes-Desaster der SPD gar nicht mitbekommen, als die Sozialdemokraten den Wahlkampf mit der Ambition den Kanzler zu stellen bestritten, aber keine Regierungsoption prÃ¤sentieren konnten. Viele SPDler an der Basis hatten sich ein frÃ¼hes Bekenntnis zu Rot-Rot-GrÃ¼n gewÃ¼nscht.

Im Fall Twesten kann Weil punkten

Bei anderen Themen sah der SPD-Mann aus Hamburg besser aus. Die CDU habe sich im Fall Twesten unanstÃ¤ndig verhalten, polterte Weil. "Das bleibt in den HinterkÃ¶pfen der Menschen, weit Ã¼ber SPD-geneigte Kreise hinaus", erklÃ¤rte er und sprach damit ein fÃ¼r den CDU-Herausforderer kritisches Thema an.

Auch der MinisterprÃ¤sident merkte, dass er einen Treffer gelandet hatte. Er verstehe ja, dass Althusmann nicht Ã¼ber den Parteiwechsel der GrÃ¼nen-Abgeordneten reden wolle, der die Wahl erst nÃ¶tig gemacht hatte, legte er nach. "Das war ein schwerer Fehler â€“ ich glaube, das hÃ¤ngt Ihnen wie ein MÃ¼hlstein um den Hals, Herr Althusmann.â€œ

Der konterte eher halbherzig: "Sie hat sich entschieden, in die CDU-Fraktion zu kommen."

Bildungspolitik und Dieselskandal

Das im zweitgrÃ¶ÃŸten Bundesland wichtigste Wahlkampfthema ist die Bildungspolitik. FÃ¼r Althusmann boten sich hier im TV-Duell des NDR die besten Chancen zur Attacke. Der CDU-Mann war bis 2013 selbst Kultusminister, der rot-grÃ¼nen Schulpolitik wird derweil zumeist ein eher bescheidenes Zeugnis ausgestellt.

"Nicht versetzt", urteilte Althusmann daher. Besonders am Konzept der Inklusion machte er sich zu Schaffen. Die SPD habe bei der Integration von Kindern mit Behinderung in den Schulalltag zu viel gewollt: "Wir brauchen dringend eine Atempause." Weil vertrat den gegensÃ¤tzlichen Standpunkt: Inklusion sei nunmal ein Menschenrecht.

Der ambitionierte Plan sei umsetzbar, auch weil seine Regierung mehr PÃ¤dagogen und Betreuer eingestellt habe. Ohnehin habe auch Althusmann in seiner Zeit als Kultusminister viele Fehler gemacht, die es nun auszubaden gelte, so die Meinung des MinisterprÃ¤sidenten.

Bei einem anderen Thema wollte Weil dagegen lieber auf die Bremse treten. Das Thema VW sei "zu wichtig, um damit Wahlkampf zu machen". Althusmann dagegen Ã¤tzte, Weil lasse sich von den Konzernchefs vorfÃ¼hren. Vom Dieselskandal habe der VW-Aufsichtsrat aus den Medien erfahren.

Weil muss sich noch immer vorwerfen lassen, eine RegierungserklÃ¤rung nach dem Abgas-Skandal vorher mit dem Konzern abgestimmt zu haben.

So war es der CDU-Mann, der wohl den empfindlichsten Treffer landete: "Sie sind am Ende vom Konzern-Vorstand durch die Manege gezogen worden."



(jg)
TITLE: TV-Duell in Niedersachsen: SPD-Mann Weil gerÃ¤t bei einer entscheidenden Frage ins Schwimmen

SUMMARY:
"But now, as the father of four daughters, this is the kind of sexual predation that keeps me up at night.
Ben Affleck also took care to mention that we need to do better in "protecting our sisters, friends, coworkers and daughters."
(Weinstein has several daughters, and that doesn't seem to have checked his behavior in any way.)
"Such vile degradations demean our wives and daughters," tweeted former Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney at the time.
It's no wonder that some boys grow up to sexually assault women and others grow up wanting to protect them.
TEXT:
"As someone who knows fans of country music, I was horrified by the mass shooting at a concert in Las Vegas" â€• said no one ever. That's because you only need to be human to understand that fatally gunning down 58 people and wounding hundreds of others is a heinous, immoral act.

In the same vein, you should only need to be human to understand that it's wrong when a man sexually harasses and assaults a woman, grabbing her body without her permission, demanding she put her hands on his naked flesh, blocking her from leaving a room, or pushing her head down to his crotch.

These are all things that Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein did to young women who were looking to him as a potential mentor and boss, according to accounts in The New York Times and The New Yorker. If they didn't comply, Weinstein reportedly threatened that he'd end their careers.

Clearly bad stuff.

Yet at least a couple of celebrity men put out statements or gave interviews about these revelations with a qualifier â€• emphasizing that as fathers of daughters, they found this behavior abhorrent.

"Look, even before I was famous, I didn't abide this kind of behavior," mega-star Matt Damon said in an interview with Deadline Hollywood in which he condemned Weinstein's behavior and denied reports that he had helped cover it up. "But now, as the father of four daughters, this is the kind of sexual predation that keeps me up at night. This is the great fear for all of us."

Later in the interview, Damon says, "We have to be vigilant and we have to help protect and call this stuff out, because we have our sisters and our daughters and our mothers."

Ben Affleck also took care to mention that we need to do better in "protecting our sisters, friends, coworkers and daughters." (Weinstein has several daughters, and that doesn't seem to have checked his behavior in any way.)

Singer Vanessa Carlton urged actress Gwyneth Paltrow to speak out because she has a daughter â€• as if the pain of Weinstein's other victims and possible future victims wasn't enough.

Daughter qualifiers played an even bigger role in Pussygate one year ago, when Republicans rushed to condemn Donald Trump's statements on the now-infamous "Access Hollywood" tape.

"Such vile degradations demean our wives and daughters," tweeted former Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney at the time.

"As the grandfather of two precious girls," Jeb Bush said, "I find that no apology can excuse away Donald Trump's reprehensible comments degrading women."

As I wrote back then, the implication behind these kinds of statements is that women are only worthy of basic respect in relation to men.

If a man is killed or murdered, it's much harder to find similar quotes from politicians talking about their sons and fathers and grandsons.

That's because men see each other as humans. And a lot of men still don't view girls or women that way. Indeed, almost from birth, boys and girls are taught that they're very different from each other. And stereotypes about how girls are weak and boys are strong are drilled into kids. It's no wonder that some boys grow up to sexually assault women and others grow up wanting to protect them.

In a sense, sexual assault is the flip side of the "daughter statement." In both situations, a woman is an object â€• to grope or to protect from groping. She's not a person, but a thing that men have power over.

Of course, having children is extremely meaningful. And, yes, some parents feel a heightened urge to guard their offspring that also leads them to feel heightened empathy for other kids. At least, that's been the case for me personally. And the truth is, for men, having a daughter can be somewhat transformative.

But that's simply not a prerequisite for feeling empathy for victims of sexual assault.

Not everyone felt compelled to mention their offspring in their recent statements about Weinstein. Former President Barack Obama, whose own daughter interned for the producer, made no mention of the fact that he is the father of girls in his statement on Tuesday.

"Michelle and I have been disgusted by the recent reports of Harvey Weinstein. Any man who demeans and degrades women in such fashion needs to be condemned and held accountable, regardless of wealth or status," Obama wrote.

"We should celebrate the courage of women who have come forward to tell these painful stories," he added. "And we all need to build a culture, including by empowering our girls and teaching our boys decency and respect, so we can make such behavior less prevalent in the future."

Decency and respect. You don't need a daughter to understand that.
TITLE: Why The 'I'm A Father Of Daughters' Line Is Irrelevant In The Discussion Of Sexual Assault

SUMMARY:
South African President Jacob Zuma (L), former African Union Chairperson and presidential hopeful Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma (C) and South African Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa (R) dance after the closing session of the South African ruling party African National Congress (ANC) policy conference on July 5, 2017 in Johannesburg, South Africa.
That's if a first glance at the provincial voting allocations are anything to go by.
KwaZulu-Natal is still the biggest and most influential voting bloc, with 870 voting delegates for a share of 18,4%.
His province's share of voting delegates jumped by 57,6% from 2012, from 467 delegates to 736 delegates and is now the second biggest voting bloc.
It will be the fourth largest voting bloc at Nasrec with 13,6% of the voting delegates.
TEXT:
South African President Jacob Zuma (L), former African Union Chairperson and presidential hopeful Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma (C) and South African Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa (R) dance after the closing session of the South African ruling party African National Congress (ANC) policy conference on July 5, 2017 in Johannesburg, South Africa.

ANALYSIS

The numbers don't seem to add up for Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa in his bid to succeed President Jacob Zuma as leader of the governing ANC. That's if a first glance at the provincial voting allocations are anything to go by.

And David Mabuza, the ANC strongman in Mpumalanga and its provincial chairperson there, is now the kingmaker. He has recently advanced the candidature of Zweli Mklhize, the ANC's treasurer general, as a unity candidate.

There has been a surge in voting delegates in Mpumalanga and North West. This is bad news for Ramaphosa.

Gwede Mantashe, the ANC's secretary general, forwarded the final tally for voting delegates to all nine provincial secretaries on Friday, and it seems to indicate that Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma, President Zuma's preferred candidate, to be in a very strong position ahead of the party's elective conference in December.

According to the letter by Mantashe 4 723 branch delegates will have the right to vote. The calculation is based on one voting delegate per branch that has 100 paid-up members. For every 250 paid-up members extra, branches receive one extra voting delegates. The branch delegates will be joined by representatives from the leagues, who also have voting rights. Provinces' voting size is based on proportional representation given the number of members in "good standing", or paid-up.

First thoughts

1. KwaZulu-Natal is still the biggest and most influential voting bloc, with 870 voting delegates for a share of 18,4%. No wonder Zuma is pushing for the provincial executive committee to appeal the ruling which disbanded it.

2. There has been a surge in voting delegates in Mpumalanga and North West. This is bad news for Ramaphosa.

3. The Eastern Cape has relinquished its position as the second biggest province in the ANC -- and that's even worse news for Ramaphosa.

4. Mabuza, Mpumalanga's premier, is now a kingmaker. His province's share of voting delegates jumped by 57,6% from 2012, from 467 delegates to 736 delegates and is now the second biggest voting bloc.

4. North West, where Supra Mahumapelo holds sway, more than doubled its share of voting delegates, jumping by 130%.

5. The erstwhile "premier league" (Free State, North West and Mpumalanga) command 35% of the vote, although Mabuza has since denounced its existence.

6. Limpopo, his place of birth, might be ray of light for Ramaphosa. (He has won the endorsement of the provincial chairperson as well as its biggest region.) It will be the fourth largest voting bloc at Nasrec with 13,6% of the voting delegates.

7. Dlamini-Zuma's path to the presidency: She needs KwaZulu-Natal, plus North West, Free State and Mpumalanga.

8. Ramaphosa's path to the presidency: He seemingly has the Eastern Cape, Western and Northern Cape, Gauteng and Limpopo. He needs Mpumalanga.

9. Dlamini-Zuma will win if she gets Mpumalanga, even if Limpopo goes to Ramaphosa.

10. The leagues (women, youth and veterans) will vote as provinces. Their share has yet to be determined, but all have pledged loyalty to Dlamini-Zuma.

Provincial voting allocations (Mangaung 2012 in brackets):

KwaZulu-Natal 870 (974) 18,4%

Mpumalanga 736 (467) 15,6%

Eastern Cape 648 (676) 13,7%

Limpopo 643 (574) 13,6%

North West 548 (234) 11,4%

Gauteng 508 (500) 10,8%

Free State 409 (324) 8%

Northern Cape 197 (176) 4%

Western Cape 182 (178) 4%
TITLE: Nasrec 2017: Mantashe's Numbers Hand Pole Position To Dlamini-Zuma

SUMMARY:
Harvey Weinstein is facing more than 20 allegations of sexual misconduct, harassment and assault, and stories continue to trickle out.
But for some men, the takeaway from these allegations is that men should avoid meeting with women.
THINK:If Weinstein had obeyed @VP Pence's rules for meeting with the opposite sex, none of those poor women would ever have been abused.
â€œOn Wall Street, certain senior men have tried to avoid closed-door meetings with junior women.
When men decide to limit their interactions with women in order to â€œprotectâ€ women (and themselves), the only people who lose out are those women.
TEXT:
Harvey Weinstein is facing more than 20 allegations of sexual misconduct, harassment and assault, and stories continue to trickle out. The horrifying allegations have kicked off discussions about the way industries like Hollywood enable abuse, and the shame attached to the big and small violations women deal with on a daily basis. But for some men, the takeaway from these allegations is that men should avoid meeting with women. On Tuesday night, Seb Gorka, former Deputy Assistant to President Donald Trump, tweeted, â€œIf Weinstein had obeyed @VP Penceâ€™s rules for meeting with the opposite sex, none of those poor women would ever have been abused.â€ (Mike Pence has previously stated that he follows the â€œBilly Graham Rule,â€ and wonâ€™t eat a meal alone with a woman except for his wife or attend events where there is alcohol present without her.)

THINK:



If Weinstein had obeyed @VP Pence's rules for meeting with the opposite sex, none of those poor women would ever have been abused. pic.twitter.com/Kgl9FF7nam â€” Sebastian Gorka DrG (@SebGorka) October 11, 2017

This morning, conservative radio host Erick Erickson wrote a piece asking everyone to â€œrevisit Mike Penceâ€™s rule about meeting with women aloneâ€ in light of the Weinstein allegations. â€œMike Pence could never be accused of wanting to have sex with someone other than his wife in these sorts of situations because he avoids putting himself and the other person into these situations,â€ he wrote. There are a few obvious problems with the suggestion that men must avoid being alone in a room (or at a restaurant table) with a woman in order to avoid committing sexual harassment â€• or at least avoid charges of harassment. First, it implies that men are unable to control their own behavior when in the presence of a woman, and that men have no way of gauging the difference between a professional relationship and a sexual or sexually violating one. (Men, you deserve better than that! I believe in your ability to interact with a woman and not harass or assault her!) It also implies that when women agree to a one-on-one professional meeting with a man, they are putting themselves in harmâ€™s way â€• just a hop, skip and a jump away from â€œasking for it.â€

If you think being in the same room with a woman makes it hard to avoid raping or harassing her, perhaps you should stay home. Forever. pic.twitter.com/TN17d1asrN â€” Jessica Valenti (@JessicaValenti) October 11, 2017

Additionally, when men, who tend to still be the gatekeepers of any industry, decide that they must roll back spending time with their woman colleagues or employees, it can have real, lasting impact on those womenâ€™s careers. A recent New York Times report looked at the ways powerful men across industries have begun scaling back their interactions with female colleagues because of a fear that they might end up facing harassment allegations. â€œIn Silicon Valley, some male investors have declined one-on-one meetings with women, or rescheduled them from restaurants to conference rooms,â€ reported Claire Cain Miller. â€œOn Wall Street, certain senior men have tried to avoid closed-door meetings with junior women. And in TV news, some male executives have scrupulously minded their words in conversations with female talent.â€ Professional intimacy and relationship-building are key to advancing in any industry. Thatâ€™s how lower-level employees find mentors or sponsors, or find out about new professional challenges. People give opportunities and recognition to people they trust, and that trust is built through person-to-person interaction â€• both at the office and outside of it. When men decide to limit their interactions with women in order to â€œprotectâ€ women (and themselves), the only people who lose out are those women. Ultimately, the problem isnâ€™t that a woman might be asked to meet a film executive or an investor or her male boss at [insert any company here] for coffee; the problem is that the film executive/investor/boss might use that meeting to exploit her. Letâ€™s put the onus for professional behavior where it belongs â€• on the male power-brokers â€• rather than punishing the women who have to deal with their predatory behavior.
TITLE: Men Argue Sexual Assault Is Just What Happens When Men Meet With Women

ADVERTISEMENTA committee set up by the University Grants Commission (UGC) has suggested removing the words "Muslim" from Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) and "Hindu" from Banaras Hindu University (BHU) to reflect the secular character of these central universities.
While BHU was not in the audit, ordered by the Ministry of Human Resource Development (HRD), the committee mentioned the Varanasi-based university in its observations about AMU.
The committee suggested that Aligarh Muslim University be called Aligarh University or be named after its founder, Sir Syed Ahmed Khan, the newspaper further reported.
Speaking on the condition of anonymity, panel members told IE that AMU is a centrally funded university and its name should reflect it being a secular institution.
While underlining the problem of "inbreeding" at the campus, the committee pointed out that the majority of its faculty members were former students of AMU.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

A committee set up by the University Grants Commission (UGC) has suggested removing the words "Muslim" from Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) and "Hindu" from Banaras Hindu University (BHU) to reflect the secular character of these central universities.

The Indian Express reported today that the suggestion was made by one of the five committees set up by the UGC to probe complaints of irregularities against ten central universities. While BHU was not in the audit, ordered by the Ministry of Human Resource Development (HRD), the committee mentioned the Varanasi-based university in its observations about AMU.

The committee suggested that Aligarh Muslim University be called Aligarh University or be named after its founder, Sir Syed Ahmed Khan, the newspaper further reported.

Speaking on the condition of anonymity, panel members told IE that AMU is a centrally funded university and its name should reflect it being a secular institution.

The committee has also described AMU as a "feudal" institution and called for measures to improve the circumstances of poor Muslims enrolled in the campus.

While underlining the problem of "inbreeding" at the campus, the committee pointed out that the majority of its faculty members were former students of AMU. It suggested a five-year gap before former students could be recruited in the faculty.

In its observation about AMU, the committee does not mention that the Bharatiya Janata Party government at the Centre is opposed to the minority status of the university and the matter is pending in the Supreme Court.

Also on HuffPost India:
TITLE: UGC Panel Suggests Dropping 'Muslim' From AMU And 'Hindu' From BHU: Report

TEXT:
The original cast of â€˜The Hitchhikerâ€™s Guide To The Galaxyâ€™ have reunited to record a brand new episode of the cult sci-fi classic for the seriesâ€™ 40th anniversary.

Itâ€™s been 12 years since fans were treated to a big screen adaption of the show, starring Martin Freeman and Bill Bailey.

Now a sixth instalment, entitled â€˜Hexagonal Phaseâ€™, is set to air next spring on the seriesâ€™ original home of Radio 4.

#HitchhikersGuide returns to @BBCRadio4 for its Hexagonal Phase (with original radio cast) to mark 40th anniversary: https://t.co/OTLV3fG5r5 pic.twitter.com/C6iYMeqABp â€” BBC Press Office (@bbcpress) October 11, 2017

The BBC station first broadcast Douglas Adamsâ€™ sci-fi comedy in 1978. A further four series followed between 1980 and 2005, as well as a hit TV version in 1981.

â€˜Hexagonal Phaseâ€™ has been adapted from Eoin Colferâ€™s spin-off novel â€˜And Another Thingâ€¦â€™, which was commissioned to mark the 30th anniversary of the first novel.

Simon Jones will again play the quintessentially English Arthur Dent, who travels through space and time following the destruction of Earth.

Rex Martin Freeman starred in the 2005 big screen adaption of the classic cult sci-fi comedy.

Speaking about reprising his role, Simon Jones said: â€œIt seems extraordinary that itâ€™s been forty years since we recorded the first pilot episode for BBC Radio; how modest were our expectations then, and how amazing a worldwide phenomenon it became, and continues to be.

â€œI never expected to still be searching for a decent cup of tea and some kind of answer to Life, the Universe and Everything almost a lifetime later.

â€œStill, the dressing-gown and towel may be a little threadbare, like my hair, but my voice, much to my surprise, hasnâ€™t changed a decibel, and despite years in America, I can still talk Arthurâ€™s â€˜indignant-poshâ€™.â€

Samantha BÃ©art, who will co-star in the latest adaptation, tweeted a copy of the new script, captioning it: â€œBack to work.â€
TITLE: â€˜Hitchhikers Guide To The Galaxyâ€™ Original Cast Reunite To Record Brand New Episode Of Cult Sci-Fi Series For 40th Anniversary

Rose McGowan is calling out powerful men in Hollywood who she says knew about Harvey Weinsteinâ€™s alleged sexual assault and serial harassment of women in the industry, but kept quiet.
On Tuesday, the â€œCharmedâ€ actress tweeted at Ben Affleck hours after the actor tweeted a statement condemning Weinstein.
In his statement, Affleck said the claims against the film producer, his friend, â€œmade me sick.â€In response, McGowan called Affleck a liar, alluding the actor has been well aware of Weinsteinâ€™s sexual misconduct for quite a while.

TEXT:
Rose McGowan is calling out powerful men in Hollywood who she says knew about Harvey Weinsteinâ€™s alleged sexual assault and serial harassment of women in the industry, but kept quiet.

On Tuesday, the â€œCharmedâ€ actress tweeted at Ben Affleck hours after the actor tweeted a statement condemning Weinstein. In his statement, Affleck said the claims against the film producer, his friend, â€œmade me sick.â€

In response, McGowan called Affleck a liar, alluding the actor has been well aware of Weinsteinâ€™s sexual misconduct for quite a while.

@benaffleck â€œGODDAMNIT! I TOLD HIM TO STOP DOING THATâ€ you said that to my face. The press conf I was made to go to after assault. You lie. â€” rose mcgowan (@rosemcgowan) October 10, 2017

Ben Affleck fuck off â€” rose mcgowan (@rosemcgowan) October 10, 2017

â€œâ€˜GODDAMNIT! I TOLD HIM TO STOP DOING THATâ€™ you said that to my face. The press [conference] I was made to go to after assault. You lie,â€ she wrote to him.

The assault McGowan is referring to is most likely included in a bombshell New York Times report that said McGowan was one of at least eight women who had reached settlements with Weinstein over sexual harassment allegations. According to the Times, McGowan received a $100,000 settlement from Weinstein in 1997 after â€œan episode in a hotel room during the Sundance Film Festival.â€

McGowan declined to comment for the Times (some speculated that she has kept quiet because her settlement may have involved a non-disclosure agreement). But that hasnâ€™t stopped the 44-year-old from being vocal on Twitter since the Times report was published.

On Monday she tweeted the following to Affleckâ€™s â€œGood Will Huntingâ€ co-star and Weinstein friend Matt Damon, during her very public petitioning to dissolve The Weinstein Company board:

Hey @mattdamon whatâ€™s it like to be a spineless profiteer who stays silent? pic.twitter.com/rp0OrRrpqJ â€” rose mcgowan (@rosemcgowan) October 9, 2017

TheWrap founder Sharon Waxman also named Damon in a piece in which she claimed that while she was working for The New York Times, the paper killed a 2004 article she wrote on Weinsteinâ€™s sexual misconduct due in part to a phone call from Damon.

It looks like McGowan is going to keep speaking out. In the past day she has tweeted support for actress Asia Argento, who came forward about Weinstein assaulting her.

ride or die, sister, I got you forever @AsiaArgento I love you â€” rose mcgowan (@rosemcgowan) October 10, 2017

Representatives for McGowan and Affleck did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s request for comment on the situation.

McGowan also hit back and Michael Eisner, former CEO of Disney and president of Paramount Pictures, who tweeted Tuesday that he had fired the Weinstein brothers because they were â€œirresponsible.â€ Weinstein, he added, was an â€œincorrigible bullyâ€ but he â€œhad no idea he was capable of these horrible actions.â€

I needed a laugh, thank you https://t.co/qXDWYXZmkU â€” rose mcgowan (@rosemcgowan) October 10, 2017
TITLE: Rose McGowan Tells Ben Affleck To 'F**k Off' After He Condemns Weinstein
