Sowas habe ich noch nie gesehen.â€Auch der Imker Mickey Hedegus, der den Schwarm beseitigen sollte, war beeindruckt.
Beim Ã–ffnen der Wand stieÃŸ der Imker dann nach und nach auf immer mehr Bienen und Waben.
Der Imker wird mehr als 30 mal gestochenEr nutzte einen Vakuumsauger und konnte 95 Prozent der Bienen aus der Wand in Boxen sammeln.
Auch die Waben entfernte er aus der Wand und nahm sie mit, um die Bienen zu retten und nicht tÃ¶ten zu mÃ¼ssen.
Um sie dennoch nicht tÃ¶ten zu mÃ¼ssen, brachte der Imker sie in ein isoliertes Gebiet in Mountainside, New Jersey.
TEXT:
Ein Mann in Hillside, New Jersey, hÃ¶rte ein lautes Summen hinter der Wand seines Wohnzimmers

Ein Schwarm von 30.000 Bienen hatte sich dort eingenistet

Wie ein Imker die Bienen entfernt, seht ihr im Video oben

Ein Mann aus Hillside in New Jersey fragte sich, was sich hinter seiner Wohnzimmerwand verbirgt. Immer wieder hÃ¶rte er lautes Summen. Er vermutete einen Insektenschwarm hinter dem GemÃ¤uer.

Und damit sollte er Recht behalten. Denn es war ein Schwarm aus 30.000 Bienen, wie unter anderem das Wissenschaftsportal â€œScience Alertâ€ berichtet.

â€œDas ist verrÃ¼ckt! Sowas habe ich noch nie gesehen.â€

Auch der Imker Mickey Hedegus, der den Schwarm beseitigen sollte, war beeindruckt. â€œDas ist verrÃ¼ckt! Sowas habe ich noch nie gesehenâ€, sagte er der â€Washington Postâ€.

Der BienenzÃ¼chter bohrte zunÃ¤chst ein kleines Loch in die Wand, um mithilfe einer Kamera die GrÃ¶ÃŸe des Schwarmes einzuschÃ¤tzen.

Beim Ã–ffnen der Wand stieÃŸ der Imker dann nach und nach auf immer mehr Bienen und Waben. â€œDas sind mindestens 30.0000 und Ã¼ber 40 Pfund Honigâ€, sagte Hedegus.

Der Imker wird mehr als 30 mal gestochen

Er nutzte einen Vakuumsauger und konnte 95 Prozent der Bienen aus der Wand in Boxen sammeln. Auch die Waben entfernte er aus der Wand und nahm sie mit, um die Bienen zu retten und nicht tÃ¶ten zu mÃ¼ssen.

Offenbar handelte es sich um eine sehr aggressive Art. â€œIch wurde trotz meines Schutzanzugs mindestens 30 Mal gestochen. Das sind afrikanisierte Honigbienen. Diese Art baut besonders viel Waben und Honig an, sie sind aber auch Ã¤uÃŸerst aggressivâ€, sagte er.

Um sie dennoch nicht tÃ¶ten zu mÃ¼ssen, brachte der Imker sie in ein isoliertes Gebiet in Mountainside, New Jersey.

(nsc)
TITLE: Ein Mann hÃ¶rte plÃ¶tzlich GerÃ¤usche hinter seiner Wohnzimmerwand - kurz darauf muss das Haus evakuiert werden

SUMMARY:
- Benny Andersson (70) ist es zu einem beachtlichen Teil zu verdanken, dass die Band ABBA zu einem globalen Pop-PhÃ¤nomen des 20.
Denn er schrieb unter anderem die Songs fÃ¼r die vierkÃ¶pfige Gruppe.
Andersson: Diese Frage bekomme ich oft gestellt und immer antworte ich wieder: Ich weiÃŸ es nicht, denn wenn, dann habe ich mehrere.
Andersson: Vielleicht - ich lese die Musik nicht, ich habe sie einfach im Kopf.
Andersson: Meine Band "Benny Anderssons Orkester" und ich, wir spielen alles von schwedischer Folkmusik bis hin zu Dance-Music der 40er und 50er Jahre und auch einige ABBA-Cover.
TEXT:
"Thank You For The Music", "Dancing Queen" oder "Mamma Mia!" - Benny Andersson (70) ist es zu einem beachtlichen Teil zu verdanken, dass die Band ABBA zu einem globalen Pop-PhÃ¤nomen des 20. Jahrhunderts avancierte. Denn er schrieb unter anderem die Songs fÃ¼r die vierkÃ¶pfige Gruppe. Nach letzterem Lied wurde sogar ein Musical und der Film "Mamma Mia!" mit Pierce Brosnan (64) und Meryl Streep (68) benannt. Und wÃ¤re Madonnas Song "Hung Up" so erfolgreich geworden, hÃ¤tte sie nicht AuszÃ¼ge aus ABBAs Hit "Gimme Gimme Gimme" dafÃ¼r hergenommen? Die Nachrichtenagentur spot on news hat mit Benny Andersson gesprochen und dabei verriet er, warum seine Enkelkinder das Wichtigste fÃ¼r ihn sind und dass er es bereut, KlavierstÃ¼cke nicht direkt vom Notenblatt spielen zu kÃ¶nnen.

Herr Andersson, Sie waren Mitglied einer der erfolgreichsten Formationen des 20. Jahrhunderts. FÃ¼r was sind Sie noch besonders dankbar?

Hier kÃ¶nnen Sie Benny Anderssons neues Album "Piano" bestellen

Benny Andersson: Ich bin fÃ¼r vieles dankbar. Am wichtigsten ist natÃ¼rlich, dass ich gesund bin und sechs Enkelkinder habe. Aber auch, dass ich in meiner Arbeit erfolgreich und von GlÃ¼ck begÃ¼nstigt bin, Ã¼berhaupt so lange im Musik-Business arbeiten zu kÃ¶nnen.

Sie waren Hauptsongwriter fÃ¼r ABBA. Was ist Ihr Lieblingslied?

Andersson: Diese Frage bekomme ich oft gestellt und immer antworte ich wieder: Ich weiÃŸ es nicht, denn wenn, dann habe ich mehrere. "Knowing Me, Knowing You", "Dancing Queen" oder "The Winner Takes It All" sind wahrscheinlich meine drei Lieblingshits.

Ihr neues Album "Piano" kam kÃ¼rzlich in die LÃ¤den. Spielen Sie auch privat viel Klavier oder tun Sie das mehr im Tonstudio?

Andersson: Ich spiele jeden Tag Klavier - oft von 10 bis 16 Uhr und das seit vielen Jahren. Wenn ich es satt habe meine eigene Musik zu spielen oder neue zu schreiben - dann spiele ich auch gerne StÃ¼cke von anderen KÃ¼nstlern auf dem Klavier.

Was war Ihre grÃ¶ÃŸte Inspiration fÃ¼r Ihr neues Album?

Benny Andersson: Ehrlich gesagt dachte ich nur: Inzwischen habe ich so viele selbstgeschriebene Songs, dass ich davon doch einfach ein paar hernehmen kÃ¶nnte und diese auf dem Klavier spiele. Kein Orchester, keine Lyrics - nur ich und das Klavier - sonst nichts. Ich fing mit ein paar Songs an und irgendwann hatte ich so viele zusammen, dass sie fÃ¼r ein Album reichten. Ich will kein Klavierspieler sein, ich will einfach nur Musik machen.

Bereuen Sie etwas in Ihrem Leben oder Ihrer Karriere nicht getan zu haben?

Andersson: Manchmal finde ich es schade, dass ich Musik nicht professionell lesen oder schreiben kann. Ich habe mich inzwischen aber damit abgefunden, denn es funktioniert auch so - ohne diese FÃ¤higkeit. Wenn ich zum Beispiel StÃ¼cke fÃ¼r groÃŸe Orchester schreibe, dann helfen mir Freunde dabei, meine Arbeit fÃ¼r das Orchester verstÃ¤ndlich zu machen. Ich bereue nicht, dass ich keine akademische Ausbildung habe. Manchmal vermisse ich einfach, dass ich nicht direkt vom Notenblatt KlavierstÃ¼cke spielen kann. Stattdessen hÃ¶re ich aber auf bestimmte Records und spiele die vom GehÃ¶r her nach.

Ist das nicht ein viel grÃ¶ÃŸeres Talent, Musik einfach vom GehÃ¶r nachspielen zu kÃ¶nnen?

Andersson: Vielleicht - ich lese die Musik nicht, ich habe sie einfach im Kopf. Alles was ich hÃ¶re und was mir gefÃ¤llt, bleibt in meinem Kopf. Ich spiele immerhin schon seit sechzig Jahren Klavier, also seit ich zehn Jahre alt bin. Also das was in meinem Kopf ist, ist gleichzeitig auch in meinen HÃ¤nden. Wenn ich einen Song im Kopf habe, kann ich ihn auf dem Klavier spielen - selbst, wenn ich ihn noch nie zuvor gespielt habe.

Wenn Sie sich in einer Zeitschrift oder im Spiegel sehen - was denken Sie?

Andersson: Ich habe gelernt, mit mir und meinem Aussehen zu leben, sagen wir es so. (lacht)

KÃ¶nnten Sie sich vorstellen, selbst in einem Musical wie "Mamma Mia!" aufzutreten?

Andersson: Ich wÃ¼rde nie in einer Serie oder einem Musical mitspielen. Nur Ã¼ber meine Leiche - ich bin kein Schauspieler.

Was war Ihre beste Erfahrung auf der BÃ¼hne?

Andersson: Meine Band "Benny Anderssons Orkester" und ich, wir spielen alles von schwedischer Folkmusik bis hin zu Dance-Music der 40er und 50er Jahre und auch einige ABBA-Cover. Jedes zweite Jahr spielen wir auf einem Event, zu dem 5.000-7.000 Leute kommen. Die Leute tanzen oder sitzen einfach nur auf der Wiese und hÃ¶ren zu - das liebe ich sehr. Es geht mir nicht um das Performen, sondern um das Musizieren an sich.

Was wÃ¼rden Sie Ihrem frÃ¼heren Ich raten, wenn Sie die MÃ¶glichkeit dazu hÃ¤tten?

Andersson: Er soll sich nicht sorgen, wÃ¼rd ich ihm sagen. Alles wird gut.
TITLE: "ABBA"-Produzent Benny Andersson im GesprÃ¤ch

SUMMARY:
The network insisted he not use an NBC News crew for the interview, and neither was he to mention his NBC News affiliation.
Gilbert Carrasquillo via Getty Images Ronan Farrow had reportedly been told by NBC News executives that he didnâ€™t have enough reporting to go on air with his Harvey Weinstein story.
But Farrow was told by multiple NBC News executives and producers that the reporting and interviews he had conducted werenâ€™t sufficient for a televised story.
By July, Farrow was ready with a bombshell story about Weinstein that included on-camera interviews with accusers and interviews with four female and male former Miramax and Weinstein Co. executives.
NBC insiders have told HuffPost that this has led some employees to wonder if this was an internal talking point that NBC executives were using to justify the lack of coverage.
TEXT:
In mid-August, Ronan Farrow, an NBC News contributor, had secured an interview with a woman who was willing to appear on camera, in silhouette, her identity concealed, and say Harvey Weinstein had raped her, according to four people with close knowledge of the reporting. It was a pivotal moment in a testy, months-long process of reporting a story that had bedeviled a generation of media and Hollywood reporters.

Farrow had a lot of material already. In March, he had acquired a damning and much-coveted audio recording in which Weinstein admits to having groped an Italian model. He had interviews with former executives and assistants whoâ€™d worked closely with Weinstein who spoke about the culture of harassment and abuse he perpetrated. And now he had someone ready to accuse Weinstein of rape, on camera.

But at that moment Farrow was also caught in the pincers of an NBC News edict. He had been told by executives at NBC News that he didnâ€™t have enough reporting to go on air with his Weinstein story, according to four sources, and he had been told by the network to stop reporting on it. NBC tried to put a stop to the interview with the woman accusing Weinstein of rape. The network insisted he not use an NBC News crew for the interview, and neither was he to mention his NBC News affiliation. And so that was how Ronan Farrow wound up paying out of his own pocket for a camera crew to film an interview.

As a project for NBC News, Farrowâ€™s story was effectively dead. Later that month, he received permission to take his reporting to another news organization. The story that resulted, published Tuesday by The New Yorker, was a blockbuster: multiple women accusing Weinstein of rape and other sexual misconduct, accompanied by the audio of Weinstein admitting to sexual assault.

Jacopo Raule via Getty Images An audio of Harvey Weinstein arguing with a young model at a hotel was included with The New Yorker article.

At an NBC News town hall Wednesday, NBC News President Noah Oppenheim said: â€œThe notion that we would try to cover for a powerful person is deeply offensive to all of us. We were on that long list of places that chased this thing, tried to nail it, but werenâ€™t ultimately the ones who broke it.â€

Then he struck a rueful tone, suggesting that the NBC iteration of the story had died of natural causes. â€œWe reached a point over the summer where we, as an organization, didnâ€™t feel that we had all the elements that we needed to air,â€ he said.

Yet interviews with 12 people inside and outside NBC News with direct knowledge of the reporting behind Farrowâ€™s story suggest a different cause of death. All of the sources who spoke to HuffPost asked not to be named, either because they werenâ€™t authorized to speak to the media about the story or because they were fearful of retribution from NBC News executives. These sources detailed a months-long struggle within NBC News during which Oppenheim and other executives slow-walked Farrowâ€™s story, crippling it with their qualms and irresolution.

Toward the end, the concerns seemed to take on a personal tone, and it became difficult to tell where the Weinstein teamâ€™s attempts to discredit the story left off and NBC Newsâ€™ editorial forbearance began. According to multiple sources inside and outside of NBC News who worked on the aborted story, Oppenheim related to Farrow what Weinsteinâ€™s lawyers had said in complaint to NBC: that Farrow had a conflict of interest because Weinstein had helped revive the career of Farrowâ€™s estranged father, director Woody Allen. Weinsteinâ€™s representatives would later use a similar line of attack when the story landed at The New Yorker. The magazine, known for its rigorous vetting process, saw no conflict of interest.

Oppenheimâ€™s statement and the pushback that NBC News has been sharing on background to reporters conflicts significantly with the accounts of people who worked on the story inside NBC News and elsewhere, according to several sources with close knowledge of the reporting.

Farrow, who began reporting the story in January and by late July had interviewed at least eight women, some on the record, had been told twice that the story was â€œreportable,â€ meaning it had passed the networkâ€™s stringent fact checking and legal process, according to four people with detailed knowledge of the process. A separate NBC investigative journalist was also asked to re-report his work, and her review raised no flags, these people said.

Gilbert Carrasquillo via Getty Images Ronan Farrow had reportedly been told by NBC News executives that he didnâ€™t have enough reporting to go on air with his Harvey Weinstein story.

Farrow scored his first major reporting coup in January: an on-camera interview with actress Rose McGowan during which she accused Weinstein of sexually assaulting her when she was 23 years old. The Times has reported that McGowan settled her sexual assault claim with Weinstein for $100,000 in 1997. Ultimately, McGowan withdrew her permission for NBC News to use the footage after sheâ€™d received legal threats from Weinstein.

In March, Farrow obtained audio in which Weinstein admits to having sexually assaulted Italian model Ambra Battilana Gutierrez. The audio was recorded a day after Gutierrez had gone to the New York Police Department and told officers that Weinstein had groped her breasts and attempted to put a hand up her skirt.

The NYPD fitted Gutierrez with a wire, and she recorded her conversation with Weinstein at the Tribeca Grand Hotel in New York.

Weinstein is heard on the recording pressuring Gutierrez to join him in his hotel room, and toward the end of the tense exchange he admits heâ€™d sexually assaulted her. When Gutierrez asked Weinstein why he had groped her breasts the day before, he answered, â€œOh, please, Iâ€™m sorry, just come on in,â€ and â€œIâ€™m used to that. Come on. Please.â€

Gutierrez asked, â€œYouâ€™re used to that?â€

â€œYes,â€ Weinstein said, adding, â€œI wonâ€™t do it again.â€

For two years, reporters from numerous publications had been attempting to obtain that damning audio. To many publications, the audio on its own would have merited a stand-alone news story. And even if the network had deemed it unworthy of television, NBC News could have published the story online, which Farrow, along with Rich McHugh, an NBC News investigative producer, also pursued. In fact, Farrow was said to be eager to get some of their reporting out in hopes that it would break the dam and other sources would come forward.

By April, NBC News had two big scoops in its pocket: an on-record interview with McGowan and the explosive audio of Weinstein admitting to sexual assault. But Farrow was told by multiple NBC News executives and producers that the reporting and interviews he had conducted werenâ€™t sufficient for a televised story. According to four sources, Farrow and McHugh also prepared a lengthy text story to run on the NBC News website, but Farrow was told it wouldnâ€™t run.

By July, Farrow was ready with a bombshell story about Weinstein that included on-camera interviews with accusers and interviews with four female and male former Miramax and Weinstein Co. executives.

At this point, Farrow and McHugh were ready to move forward with the story but were told by NBC executives that the story had to go up to NBC News Chairman Andy Lack for approval and that the story would be under review by Steve Burke, executive vice president of Comcast and president and CEO of NBCUniversal â€” a highly unusual level of scrutiny, according to three NBC News staffers, who had never heard of Burkeâ€™s office needing to review a story.

In August, according to four sources familiar with the conversations, Farrow was repeatedly told by the network that he didnâ€™t have enough reporting done to go to air but that he should also stop reporting on Weinsteinâ€™s story, putting him in an untenable position.

One of the people Farrow had interviewed on camera for the story was veteran media reporter Ken Auletta. Earlier in his career, Auletta had tried to break the story of Weinsteinâ€™s predations. According to two sources familiar with the interview, and as reported in slightly different form by the Daily Beastâ€™s Lloyd Grove, Auletta, after having reviewed Farrowâ€™s reporting, said on camera something along the lines of, â€œIf NBC News sits on this evidence Ronan has, it is a black eye for the organization and a huge scandal.â€

Farrow ultimately brought his reporting to The New Yorker, which published his blockbuster account on Monday after putting his piece through its gauntlet of editors and fact checkers.

â€œRonan Farrow, who came to us about two months ago, had very serious reporting already accomplished,â€ said David Remnick, editor in chief of The New Yorker. â€œAnd with extremely hard work, and with work with a lot of my colleagues here at The New Yorker, he deepened the piece and made it publishable. And it is something that exemplified great investigative journalism.â€

NBC had initially been reticent about reporting on other news outletsâ€™ stories on Weinstein as well. Last Thursday, when The New York Times first broke the story of Weinsteinâ€™s long history of alleged sexual abuse, both CBS and ABC carried the Weinstein story on their evening broadcasts. But NBC was conspicuously absent among its competitors and didnâ€™t air a Weinstein piece that evening on â€œNBC Nightly News,â€ despite having had seven hours to put together a story (the Times article was published at 11 a.m. EDT).

Some NBC sources said that the broadcast was jam-packed with breaking news, including reporting on the aftermath of the Las Vegas shooting and the NBC News report that Secretary of State Rex Tillerson called President Donald Trump a â€œmoron.â€ But the broadcast also had room for a segment on NFL player Cam Newtonâ€™s sexist remarks to a female reporter and a segment about Rock and Roll Hall of Fame nominees.

Two sources familiar with the production told HuffPost that Oppenheim made the final decision not to include a Weinstein story in the broadcast, telling staff that Weinstein wasnâ€™t a nationally recognizable figure. That weekend, when â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ executive producer Lorne Michaels was criticized for not including any Weinstein jokes, he told The Daily Mail that â€œitâ€™s a New York thing,â€ suggesting something similar. NBC insiders have told HuffPost that this has led some employees to wonder if this was an internal talking point that NBC executives were using to justify the lack of coverage.

Slaven Vlasic via Getty Images NBC News President Noah Oppenheim said at a town hall: â€œThe notion that we would try to cover for a powerful person is deeply offensive to all of us."

The next morning, NBC was, once again, bested by its competitors when ABCâ€™s â€œGood Morning Americaâ€ ran a segment that was 10 minutes long and CBSâ€™ â€œThis Morningâ€ ran a five-minute segment. NBCâ€™s â€œTodayâ€ show simply had anchor Craig Melvin read off a teleprompter part of a story that largely included Weinsteinâ€™s pushback as opposed to the detailed allegations made in the Times.

The news that NBC had the audio of Weinstein admitting to sexual assault shocked and frustrated NBC News employees who spoke to HuffPost, saying that the mood in the newsroom had grown dark over the missed opportunity to break a big story.

It reminded several people who spoke to HuffPost of another time that NBC lost the chance to break a story involving a man admitting to alleged sexual misconduct.
TITLE: How Top NBC Executives Quashed The Bombshell Harvey Weinstein Story

SUMMARY:
This Sunday, the independent news website The Wire published an investigative report by journalist Rohini Singh on the changing fortune of Jay Amit Shah, the son of BJP President Amit Shah.
Before I proceed I must add that there have been similar allegations of corruption against Amit Shah made by officials in the Gujarat dispensation that had been reported by various publications.
In fact in 2010 among many other publications, The Hindu carried a report titled 'Gujarat government buried CID report on Amit Shah'.
Jay Amit Shah should not have bothered writing those words of caution because the present day media understands even the unsaid.
But Jay Amit Shah should not have bothered writing those words of caution because the present day media understands even the unsaid.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Remember LK Advani's famous assertion about the media on their passive obedience to the Indira Gandhi regime during emergency? "You (journalists) were asked to bend, but you began to crawl!"

I was not born then, but I hear from my seniors in the profession that most mainstream journalists embarrassed their fraternity by displaying their unflinching loyalty to Indira Gandhi for fear of being arraigned by her. In 2017 there is no emergency â€” at least there has been no declaration to the effect â€” but many from my profession have chosen to prostrate before the powers before being asked to bend.

This Sunday, the independent news website The Wire published an investigative report by journalist Rohini Singh on the changing fortune of Jay Amit Shah, the son of BJP President Amit Shah. The report created ripples on social media within minutes of being published. Singh made damning allegations against the son of the president of a party that came to power in 2014 claiming to be the panacea to a ten-year-old corrupt Congress regime.

Before I proceed I must add that there have been similar allegations of corruption against Amit Shah made by officials in the Gujarat dispensation that had been reported by various publications. In fact in 2010 among many other publications, The Hindu carried a report titled 'Gujarat government buried CID report on Amit Shah'.

The BJP claimed these reports were politically motivated just like his arrest in the Sohrabuddin Sheikh fake encounter case in Gujarat in 2010. Shah was the first serving home minister of a state in India to face this ignominy. All was forgotten in 2014 as Modi rose to prominence as the man who wanted to rid the country of the malaise of corruption.

Indian politician and former Gujarat minister Amit Shah (L) and his son Jay celebrate on his arrival at his residence after his release from Sabarmati Central Jail in Ahmedabad late on October 29, 2010.

'Na Khaaonga, na khaane doonga', he roared in his speeches and the Indian voter accepted with great relief his war against graft. The ten-year-old Congress regime with its corruption-tainted ministers had exhausted the average Indian. It needed a change. The PM continued with his barbs against ex-PM Manmohan Singh stating that "Manmohan Singh knew the art of bathing with a raincoat on" â€” a reference to Singh's alleged silence over the corruption of his ministers.

But for a party which considered transparency on corruption and financial impropriety as sacrosanct, similar allegations made by The Wire on Sunday based on paperwork stung the BJP rank and file to such an extent that it got one of its most media-friendly political heavyweight Piyush Goyal to address a press conference not just to defend a non-political entity but also to proudly proclaim that Jay Amit Shah would slap a 100 crore defamation suit against the organization and its reporter.

The BJP, of all parties, should know this best as it has followed a similar protocol in the past not just with allegations against Robert Vadra.

This press conference was preceded by a similar one addressed by Congress leader Kapil Sibal seeking accountability from the BJP over the allegations. This was normal political outcome of an investigation.

The BJP, of all parties, should know this best as it has followed a similar protocol in the past not just with allegations against Robert Vadra, but post various other media investigations including the Coal scam and the 2G scam which led to the downfall of the UPA. But if you are a consumer of mainstream Indian television news, you were made to believe this Sunday that only one such presser took place, that in which the BJP lashed out at a leftist website for defaming its leader.

Blackout

There was an eerie silence on news channels, some focused on karva chauth, others on Muslim appeasement, the rest on pressing issues such as the Hrithik Roshan-Kangana Ranaut spat. With a few exceptions â€” yes those very exceptions which rescue the media each time â€” others made you believe that the last time you witnessed a big investigative story was the appearance of Honeypreet Insaan on their television channels.

Jay Amit Shah should not have bothered writing those words of caution because the present day media understands even the unsaid.

Some of the media houses, conspicuous in their silence, were last seen talking of the need to protect free speech post the murder of journalist Gauri Lankesh.

In the concluding statement of his claim of defamation, Jay Amit Shah said, "If anyone else republishes/re-broadcasts the imputations made in the said article, whether directly or indirectly, such person or entity will also be guilty of the very same criminal and/or civil liability."

In an ideal world this intimidation should have led to an outrage in the media.

In an ideal world this intimidation should have led to an outrage in the media. An investigative report like any other report should have been the subject of discussion, criticism, arguments, debate â€” these being the fundamentals of journalism. Silence by intimidation being the last on the charter of a journalistic organization. But Jay Amit Shah should not have bothered writing those words of caution because the present day media understands even the unsaid. The media did not need a threat, it had already obliged, it had long memorized those unsaid rules of being in circulation in the present day dispensation.

Yes, there were a few journalists who stuck their neck out, for on them rests the onus of protecting free speech each time it is under threat. Those handful of journalists with a public voice defend the ethics of the profession and risk losing their job each day. These journalists have become the shoulders that bear the pretense of free speech in India while their colleagues read from the nationalist scripts dictated by the government.

And no, these journalists are doing no favour to us. This is basic, ethical journalism where a reporter needs to worry about the facts in her story and not the consequences of it, not the smear campaign, nor the character assassination.

I remember a senior editor telling me last year at my book event that I can afford to be critical of the government and publish a book because I speak from a position of privilege.

I remember a senior editor telling me last year at my book event that I can afford to be critical of the government and publish a book because I speak from a position of privilege. I do not have any loans to re-pay, no kids to look after, no family to run, unlike him who has to bear these responsibilities. I was quite stunned and I still am. Since when did journalism become a profession to fulfill our financial and social obligations. I have more respect for my journalist friends who have crossed over to corporate communications and public relations to feed their needs and ambition.

At least they do not shape the opinion of a generation that looks up to them.

Do not hold The Wire and its reportage as the ultimate truth and the last word on the story. Question it, criticize it, debate it, hold its journalists accountable, laud them for their work if you so believe. But your silence on this story and on other such investigations in the past is only proving right what the cynical common man on the street believes 'ye media bika huva hai' (the media is sold).
TITLE: 'The Wire' Story On Jay Amit Shah Deserves Debate And Discussion, Not Silence From The Media

SUMMARY:
Cricketer Ben Stokes has issued an apology to Katie Price and her son Harvey, over a video he posted online imitating the teenagerâ€™s infamous â€˜Loose Womenâ€™ appearance last year.
More than a year later, a video began doing the rounds of Ben imitating Harvey, which was slammed by Katie in September, who urged her Twitter followers to â€œshame himâ€ over the leaked clip.
PPAUK/Rex/Shutterstock Ben StokesBen posted an apology on Twitter on Wednesday (11 September), writing: â€œEarlier this year I was shown a clip of Harvey being asked on â€˜Loose Womenâ€™ how he responds to internet trolls.
â€œIt was absolutely not my intention to offend Harvey, Katie or anybody else.â€Ken McKay/ITV/Rex/Shutterstock Katie and Harvey Price on 'Loose Women'He continued: â€œI have written to both Harvey and Katie to say sorry and prior to this offered to meet in person at the end of last month with a view to also getting behind their petition about online bullying.
I do hope I can put this right.â€Please see below my apology to Katie and Harvey pic.twitter.com/hFx5DnBb8H â€” Ben Stokes (@benstokes38) October 11, 2017Clips of Harvey swearing live on â€˜Loose Womenâ€™ went viral when the incident took place in 2016.
TEXT:
Cricketer Ben Stokes has issued an apology to Katie Price and her son Harvey, over a video he posted online imitating the teenagerâ€™s infamous â€˜Loose Womenâ€™ appearance last year.

In May 2016, Harvey gave an interview alongside his famous mum on the ITV daytime show, to discuss trolling, and during the talk, dropped the C-bomb live on air, in the middle of the day.

More than a year later, a video began doing the rounds of Ben imitating Harvey, which was slammed by Katie in September, who urged her Twitter followers to â€œshame himâ€ over the leaked clip.

PPAUK/Rex/Shutterstock Ben Stokes

Ben posted an apology on Twitter on Wednesday (11 September), writing: â€œEarlier this year I was shown a clip of Harvey being asked on â€˜Loose Womenâ€™ how he responds to internet trolls.

â€œI loved Harveyâ€™s directness with his response - he said what most of us think but perhaps arenâ€™t brave enough to say, let alone on live TV.

â€œI foolishly attempted to copy the clip after I saw it a few times. I should never have done this and I am so sorry.

â€œIt was absolutely not my intention to offend Harvey, Katie or anybody else.â€

Ken McKay/ITV/Rex/Shutterstock Katie and Harvey Price on 'Loose Women'

He continued: â€œI have written to both Harvey and Katie to say sorry and prior to this offered to meet in person at the end of last month with a view to also getting behind their petition about online bullying. I do hope I can put this right.â€

Please see below my apology to Katie and Harvey pic.twitter.com/hFx5DnBb8H â€” Ben Stokes (@benstokes38) October 11, 2017

Clips of Harvey swearing live on â€˜Loose Womenâ€™ went viral when the incident took place in 2016.

Two fans even got the 15-year-oldâ€™s quote tattooed on their feet and their inkings received the seal of approval from Katie when they met her at a club night months after.

One Glastonbury attendee also made a flag with Harveyâ€™s message emblazoned on it, prompting Katie to say she was â€œso proud my son Harveyâ€™s comment to trolls and bullies has made it on a flagâ€.

Accidental Daytime TV Swearing
TITLE: Ben Stokes Apologises To Katie Price And Harvey Over Impression Video

SUMMARY:
The tropical storm was named a hurricane overnight and the US National Hurricane Centre has warned it could strengthen over the coming days.
The remnants of the hurricane is expected to reach the UK on Monday, coinciding with the 30th anniversary of the Great Storm.
#Ophelia has become the 10th consecutive Atlantic tropical storm to attain hurricane strength this season.
It will coincide with the 30th anniversary of the Great Storm of 1987, which hit southern England overnight on October 15.
â€œAfter that, indications are that by that point it will then have weakened and be no longer a hurricane or tropical storm, it will be extratropical.
TEXT:
Gusts of up to 70mph and wet weather could batter Britainâ€™s shores as Hurricane Ophelia crosses the Atlantic Ocean in the coming days, despite other parts of the country basking in the heatwave approaching from Spain this weekend.

The tropical storm was named a hurricane overnight and the US National Hurricane Centre has warned it could strengthen over the coming days.

The remnants of the hurricane is expected to reach the UK on Monday, coinciding with the 30th anniversary of the Great Storm.

The Met Office has warned that the unsettled weather could cause disruption.

#Ophelia has become the 10th consecutive Atlantic tropical storm to attain hurricane strength this season. Moving slowly SW of the Azores. pic.twitter.com/QcrDDwP0Uu â€” Met Office Storms (@metofficestorms) October 11, 2017

The west of the country will see the worst of the weather, with winds of between 60mph and 70mph forecast.

Ophelia is the tenth consecutive Atlantic tropical story to attain hurricane strength this season, the Met Office said.

It will coincide with the 30th anniversary of the Great Storm of 1987, which hit southern England overnight on October 15. The storm caused damage estimated at Â£1 billion and claimed 18 lives.

The Met Office said that the Great Storm of October 15 and 16, 1987, was a â€œwake-up callâ€ for weather service providers and helped to identify gaps in severe weather forecasting capability.

#30yearsago people were woken by the #greatstorm, How would we forecast and communicate about a similar weather event today? pic.twitter.com/SjS4CRVpwr â€” Met Office (@metoffice) October 11, 2017

Met Office forecaster Alex Burkhill said: â€œOphelia became a hurricane overnight and the forecast track takes it eastwards towards Iberia for the weekend.

â€œAfter that, indications are that by that point it will then have weakened and be no longer a hurricane or tropical storm, it will be extratropical.

â€œBut then it will continue its way towards the British Isles, probably reaching us very early next week.â€

Burkhill said cold sea temperatures mean Ophelia will not be strong enough to be categorised as a hurricane when it hits Britain.

But he added: â€œItâ€™s definitely something that we are keeping an eye on, for the possibility of some disruptive weather early next week.â€

The unsettled weather looks likely to continue into Tuesday due to a separate band of low pressure, and will remain changeable throughout the rest of the week.

Despite the weather warnings for next week, some parts of the UK are set to experience a rise in temperatures this weekend, with some areas in the south east of the country experiencing 24C (75F).

The balmy weather is thanks to scorching temperatures in the Mediterranean.
TITLE: Hurricane Ophelia's Tail Due To Hit UK On Anniversary Of The Great Storm

SUMMARY:
The United States menâ€™s team has missed out on the 2018 FIFA World Cup, following a stunning loss to Trinidad and Tobago Tuesday evening.
The team from Trinidad and Tobago, which has been out of World Cup contention for months, beat Team USA 2-1.
â€” Grant Wahl (@GrantWahl) October 11, 2017The FIFA World Cup is a month-long menâ€™s tournament played every four years.
Honduras will play a two-leg qualification series with Australia next month for a final spot in the World Cup.
Thereâ€™s no extra points for even qualifying first, or second, or third.â€Next yearâ€™s World Cup will take place in Russia.
TEXT:
The United States menâ€™s team has missed out on the 2018 FIFA World Cup, following a stunning loss to Trinidad and Tobago Tuesday evening. It will be the first time the U.S. team will be excluded from the event since 1986.

The team from Trinidad and Tobago, which has been out of World Cup contention for months, beat Team USA 2-1.

â€œWe played poorly. The first goal was unfortunate, the second was an incredible shot. There is nothing wrong with what we are doingâ€ in U.S. Soccer, Coach Bruce Arena said after the game. â€œWe didnâ€™t qualify for the World Cup, and that was my job... to qualify.â€

Arena came on board after coach Jurgen Klinsmann was fired at the end of 2016 following a series of losses by Team USA in a bout of regional qualifying matches for next yearâ€™s World Cup.

The United States has been eliminated from World Cup 2018. The most surreal and embarrassing night in US soccer history. â€” Grant Wahl (@GrantWahl) October 11, 2017

The FIFA World Cup is a month-long menâ€™s tournament played every four years. It features 32 teams from around the globe.

There are three direct qualification spots reserved for nations in CONCACAF, the Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football.

The top six CONCACAF nations have been playing off for those spots since November 2016, and the U.S. was well positioned before Tuesdayâ€™s final round of games, sitting third in the standings.

But while U.S. lost to bottom-ranked Trinidad and Tobago, fifth-place Honduras beat top-ranked Mexico and fourth-place Panama upset No. 2 Costa Rica.

This unlikely trio of results left the U.S. languishing in fifth place in the standings, while Mexico, Costa Rica and Panama now qualify automatically for the World Cup. Honduras will play a two-leg qualification series with Australia next month for a final spot in the World Cup.

â€œYou either qualify for the World Cup or you donâ€™t,â€ Michael Bradley, captain of the U.S. team, said Monday, according to The New York Times. â€œThereâ€™s no extra points for how you qualify. Thereâ€™s no extra points for even qualifying first, or second, or third.â€

Next yearâ€™s World Cup will take place in Russia.
TITLE: Team USA Misses Out On FIFA World Cup

A Labour MP has been criticised for failing to adequately answer a question on â€œdouble standardsâ€ in the wake of the Universal Credit helpline controversy, having being caught off guard during an interview on Thursday.
But as listeners were quick to point out, there was an easy defence for the Labour MP:This is woeful.
Destitute people aren't ringing up the Labour Party to get the money they need to survive.
â€” Jack Seale (@jackseale) October 12, 2017Debbie Abrahams obviously needs training on debating if she can't defend completely different uses of 0345 numbers.
The call would have cost some Universal Credit claimants more than 11 percent of their weekly allowance, which is meant to â€œhelp with living costsâ€.
TEXT:
A Labour MP has been criticised for failing to adequately answer a question on â€œdouble standardsâ€ in the wake of the Universal Credit helpline controversy, having being caught off guard during an interview on Thursday.

Debbie Abrahams, the shadow work and pensions secretary, was condemning the Governmentâ€™s use of a 0345 number for claimants - which HuffPost yesterday revealed could leave callers significantly out of pocket - when she was ensnared by LBC host Jim Diamond.

Abrahams was exercised about the 55p per minute call charges which Theresa May had been forced to defend during Prime Ministerâ€™s Questions on Wednesday, accusing the Conservatives of lacking â€œhumanityâ€.

Labour MP tears into govt for using 0345 numbers, but is lost for words when LBC host tells her Labour use them too https://t.co/utRB2qxabJ â€” LBC (@LBC) October 12, 2017

â€œPeople can be racking up costs if they are using their mobile, if they donâ€™t have a landline... at an average of Â£3.30 a call.

â€œSomeone on a low-income to get the support they need to have to pay Â£3.30... that is a lot of money.â€

Diamond then informed Abrahams that Labour uses an 0345 number for people wanting to sign up as members and asked, â€œif it is so badâ€ why does the party use it?

But as listeners were quick to point out, there was an easy defence for the Labour MP:

This is woeful. Didnâ€™t it occur to her that Labour membership and claiming your benefits are two very different things? https://t.co/Im2QNfW7Zt â€” Stephen Bush (@stephenkb) October 12, 2017

This doesn't work does it. Destitute people aren't ringing up the Labour Party to get the money they need to survive. â€” Jack Seale (@jackseale) October 12, 2017

Debbie Abrahams obviously needs training on debating if she can't defend completely different uses of 0345 numbers. https://t.co/cHQbQ2Vgub â€” Simon Bye ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ (@SW11simon) October 12, 2017

A clearly flummoxed Abrahams replied: â€ I donâ€™t know. I think you make a very valid point. I had no idea about this and yes, we need to get our own house in order as well.â€

When Diamond pushed her further, Abrahams tried to steer the conversation back to the Conservatives: â€œLets not forget this is a Government programme and youâ€™ve got me on here taking about this.â€

After Diamond interjected to reaffirm his point, Abrahams concluded: â€œI agree with you. So can we move on.â€

HuffPost tried contacting the government helpline on Wednesday and waited up to 12 and a half minutes to be answered in person. The call taker then refused to call us back straight away due to data protection rules.

The call would have cost some Universal Credit claimants more than 11 percent of their weekly allowance, which is meant to â€œhelp with living costsâ€.
TITLE: Labour MP Debbie Abrahams Caught Out In Interview Over 0345 Universal Credit Helpline

TEXT:
DENVER â€• They couldn't find porridge or, for that matter, Goldilocks.

But that was of little concern to the three bears that broke into a pizza shop in Estes Park, Colorado, this week.

Judging from surveillance footage of the early Sunday heist, the ursine family â€• unlike Goldilocks â€• was perfectly content eating food that wasn't "just right." The mother bear and her two cubs made a meal of cold pizza dough and salami, rifling through a trash can and a prep table to find it.

Antonio's Real New York Pizza shared the video on Facebook. The bears gained entrance to the kitchen by ripping the drive-through window out of the wall, according to the restaurant. They ate more than 40 pounds of dough and caused around $1,000 in damage.
TITLE: 3 Bears Break Into U.S. Restaurant, Find No Porridge

SUMMARY:
Founder of Annaborgia â€“ ethical glamour, slow fashion & sustainable bridal wear made in Italy & USA.
Director of Labour Behind the LabelTime To Practice Not Preach On Zero Waste Fashion Imagine a blanket that covers about a quarter of the UK - spanning about 60billion square meters.
That's how much fabric is wasted by the fashion industry during the cutting and manufacturing process.
Imagine the irony of a much-loved industry that's second only to oil as the world's most polluting line of business: that's the fashion industry too.
Fashion designerHow Can We Shift Sustainable Fashion From Niche To Norm?
TEXT:
Why Don't We Wear Our Wedding Dresses Again? Despite their best intentions, few women these days ever wear their bridesmaid's dresses again and although it's probably the most expensive dress they'll ever own, most women only wear their wedding dress once. Ethical fashion advocate. Founder of Annaborgia â€“ ethical glamour, slow fashion & sustainable bridal wear made in Italy & USA.

The Myth Of Magnificence: Price, Perception And Why Provenance In Luxury Matters To cite Oscar Wilde, too many of us know the price of everything, but the value of nothing. Thankfully, transparency is now determining price tags much more than before and consumers will vote with their purses. Economics of scale state that it's the global companies who have the most capacity to foster systemic change, so let's hope that 'luxury' leads the way. Freelance writer, PR consultant and editor

Alpaca: 10 Things To Know And Love About This Supremely Sustainable Fibre Alpaca fibres are sorted and classified by their thickness and colour, by hand. This process can never be mechanised because the variable characteristics of the fibre can only be identified by experienced hands and eyes. Founder, STUDY 34

Time To Put An End To Killer Heels Shoe production is a shady world. There is little to no transparency throughout the shoe industry, and complex global supply chains make it nearly impossible to pick up a shoe in a high street store and trace its origins. Director of Labour Behind the Label

Time To Practice Not Preach On Zero Waste Fashion Imagine a blanket that covers about a quarter of the UK - spanning about 60billion square meters. That's how much fabric is wasted by the fashion industry during the cutting and manufacturing process. Imagine the irony of a much-loved industry that's second only to oil as the world's most polluting line of business: that's the fashion industry too. Garment technologist, pattern cutter, researching sustainable innovation through a technical design process.

Is High Street Sustainability An Oxymoron? Personally, I can think of plenty of other things to make me feel happier. But, being British, they usually depend on the weather: gardening, relaxing with family, enjoying a barbeque. If it's raining, I might finally get round to making the conservatory hygge for winter. CSR & sustainability consultant and blogger

How We Engineer A Solution To The Skills Gap Designed by Royal College of Art graduate Ryan Mario Yasin, Petit Pli employs the Negative Poisson's ratio to allow garments to expand in both directions - enabling them to continuously fit children as they grow. A neat solution to the problem of quickly outgrown clothing, so familiar - and frustrating - to parents. James Dyson Award Manager

Does Sustainability Need To Be Sexy To Sell? Even if you identify as someone who cares deeply about saving planet Earth, chances are, when you get dressed each morning, you're motivated first and foremost by style. That a product looks good, functions well, and has no negative impact is the goal. But, as the flawed human beings that we are, our decision making process usually follows this logic; design first and impact last. Communications Strategist living in The Netherlands. Originally from New Zealand, she now calls Amsterdam home.

Is Zero Waste Beauty The Next Big Trend? If you want to buy from a zero waste beauty brand, what should you be looking for? Let's go through the life cycle of a beauty product and unpick its journey from cradle to grave so that we can build up a clearer picture. Biologist, Environmental Scientist and Director of Formula Botanica, the award-winning organic cosmetic science school

Sexy Stories: You Might Be Wearing One At a gathering last year I listened with interest as Vanessa Friedman, Fashion Director at The New York Times, explained that in order for consumers to get on board with the words 'sustainable' and 'ethical' then we, the designers and makers of clothing, needed to find a way to make it sexy. Founder, STUDY 34

Why Vegan Leather Is On The Rise Consumers today are much more conscious of the ethics of what they're buying. High on the list is an approach to fashion which takes care of the environment and the people who make the things we wear. And this is where vegan leather comes in. Enthusiast of all the things that make the world a better place. / goblackwood.co.uk

Redefining Female Innovation: Sustainable Fashion It's funny how one can be so engrained in a journey that it takes someone else to point out how far you've come. I recently had my portrait taken by p... CEO of Ananas Anam Ltd.

Cradle to Cradle: Fashion's Grave Reality The circular economy. Closing the loop. Cradle to cradle. These are all phrases you may well have heard of. If not, best to familiarise yourself w... Founder, STUDY 34

Single-Use Plastic Is Never Fantastic We all have the planet's best interest at heart. No one wants to see turtles hurt by straws or beaches littered with plastic bottles, but we can all do our bit to be a little more eco-friendly. It doesn't have to be a huge change either, we all take a reusable bag to the shops now that it cost 5p to buy one. It's just as simple to make other sustainable swaps. Fashion designer

How Can We Shift Sustainable Fashion From Niche To Norm? Photo credit: Fashion for Good How can we put sustainability onto the mainstream fashion agenda? How can smaller brands compete? And who's to blam... Communications Strategist living in The Netherlands. Originally from New Zealand, she now calls Amsterdam home.
TITLE: HuffPost UK Sustainable Fashion: Blogs, Advice And Reports On The Sustainable Fashion World

SUMMARY:
The Manus centre will be demolished, and it is thought asylum seekers will be moved to either Nauru or other facilities on Manus Island.
Refugees on Manus Island have been told they can apply to move to the other Australian-run offshore detention centre of Nauru, as the facility in Papua New Guinea nears its final shutdown and demolition.
The sign posted in the Manus facility stated that transferring to Nauru "will not affect eligibility or progress of U.S. resettlement applications".
Ridiculous that they'll spend millions to send and dump refugees in Nauru rather then bring them to safety in Australia.
"It's a last desperate measure because they've got the same problem on Nauru as Manus, in that Nauru won't allow these people to stay forever.
TEXT:
The Manus centre will be demolished, and it is thought asylum seekers will be moved to either Nauru or other facilities on Manus Island.

Refugees on Manus Island have been told they can apply to move to the other Australian-run offshore detention centre of Nauru, as the facility in Papua New Guinea nears its final shutdown and demolition.

Signs were posted inside the Manus Island facility on Tuesday stating that refugees who waiting on approval to resettle in the United States as part of the controversial 'swap' deal could apply for transfer to Nauru until a decision was reached.

The Manus centre is in the process of being demolished, following a 2016 PNG Supreme Court decision that detention on the island breached the country's Constitution, but refugees and asylum seekers remain inside the centre and refuse to leave. It will officially close on October 31.

Media release: Choose your limbo: After 4 years of suffering, AUGov tells refugees on Manus they can go to Nauru RPC https://t.co/NXL2UtoJv2 pic.twitter.com/gSv4Sno7P1 â€” HumanRightsLawCentre (@rightsagenda) October 10, 2017

Just 50 people -- 25 each from Manus and Nauru -- were accepted in the first round of the U.S. resettlement process last month. The sign posted in the Manus facility stated that transferring to Nauru "will not affect eligibility or progress of U.S. resettlement applications".

In a statement to HuffPost Australia, the Department of Immigration and Border Protection said:

The Government of Nauru has agreed to receive PNG-determined refugees in Nauru to await third country resettlement. Relocation is voluntary; no one will be forced to move to Nauru. We continue to work with the Governments of Nauru and PNG to implement appropriate arrangements for people at the Manus RPC.

Behrouz Boochani, an Iranian journalist and refugee on Manus, said he doubted any would take up the Nauru offer.

"It's the latest political trick to get the refugees out of the Manus detention centre, because they have not left the centre despite the Government's efforts to push them out in the past few months," he told HuffPost Australia.

"I talked with the refugees and they are saying they don't want to go to Nauru.

"People are really frustrated and disappointed by this news. After four years of pain the Australian Government should transfer us to a safe place, not to another hell."

Sending refugees from Manus prison camp to Nauru is unacceptable. How can the gov want to send people from hell to another hell after 4yrs? â€” Behrouz Boochani (@BehrouzBoochani) October 10, 2017

The Nauru offer comes within three weeks of the Manus centre's planned shutdown, and confusion as to where the refugees and asylum seekers left in PNG will be moved to. HuffPost Australia understands men on Manus will be moved to one of three new facilities on Manus, depending on their refugee status. It is understood only one of these centres will house a medical facility. It is unclear how these new facilities will be classified, considering the Supreme Court's decision that the existing centre and detention itself on Manus were unconstitutional. So far, no official information has been released about the three new facilities.

In the latest update posted on the Department's website, as of July 31 there were 791 men in detention on Manus.

Here's what men on #Manus who are being considered for settlement in US, are being given by Australian Gov today to try and convince them to go to #Nauru now. Ridiculous that they'll spend millions to send and dump refugees in Nauru rather then bring them to safety in Australia. pic.twitter.com/7UokhCE4AJ â€” ASRC (@ASRC1) October 10, 2017

Ian Rintoul of the Refugee Action Coalition said that while facilities on Nauru were "marginally better" than those on Manus, that moving refugees there from PNG was not a suitable alternative.

"It's a last desperate measure because they've got the same problem on Nauru as Manus, in that Nauru won't allow these people to stay forever. Hundreds of people will be left behind. This is just moving deckchairs on the Titanic," he told HuffPost Australia.

The sign announcing the Nauru option states that refugees transferring there "will have access to the same services and resettlement arrangements as other refugees on Nauru", which would ostensibly mean access to only a 20-year visa rather than a permanent visa.

Rintoul said he was concerned that medical and accommodation facilities on Nauru would not be able to absorb the extra strain of more refugees from Manus. He also criticised the plan to move remaining refugees to new facilities on Manus, which he also claimed were inadequate.

"The Government goes from disaster to disaster, it's a rolling crisis, there's no resettlement plan. They're trying to shift everyone out of the centre to other barrack accommodation on Manus but the Manus province itself says it wont allow refugees to settle," he said.

"They're taking people out of the frying pan and into the fire, to places with even worse resources. It will be a complete disaster."
TITLE: Manus Island Refugees To Move To Nauru, As Centre Nears Shutdown

Aber in den Diskussionen dreht es sich immer um muslimischen Frauen, die einen Niqab tragen.
Jetzt ist das Vermummungsverbot in Kraft getreten und sie Ã¼berlegt, nach Kroatien zu ziehen.
In einem GesprÃ¤ch verriet mir eine Dame: "Ich mÃ¶chte wissen, wie die Frauen darunter aussehen, man muss doch das Gesicht erkennen kÃ¶nnen."
Und wenn es uns wirklich um die Freiheit der Frauen geht:Wieso zahlen wir ihnen dann nicht faire GehÃ¤lter?
Wieso gibt es in Ã–sterreich nicht die Ehe fÃ¼r Alle?
TEXT:
Mit nur einem Tweet gelingt es der Ã¶sterreichischen Journalistin und Moderatorin Lou Lorenz die Lage zwischen Deutschland und Ã–sterreich auf den Punkt zu bringen.

Am 1. Oktober 2017 schrieb sie: "In Ã–sterreich tritt heute das Vermummungsverbot in Kraft. In Deutschland die Ehe fÃ¼r alle."

Der Kontrast, der auf nur einen Blick den Unterschied zwischen den zwei deutschsprachigen LÃ¤ndern zeigt, ist aber noch viel stÃ¤rker.

Hauptsache, Burkas verbieten!

In Ã–sterreich nennt man das Kind ungern beim Namen. Deswegen gilt seit Tagen nicht etwa das jahrelang besprochene "Burkaverbot", sondern das "Vermummungsverbot". Man soll in der Ã–ffentlichkeit sein Gesicht so zeigen, dass man erkennbar ist. Legitim und fair.

Aber in den Diskussionen dreht es sich immer um muslimischen Frauen, die einen Niqab tragen. FÃ¤lschlicherweise wird der Niqab immer mit der Burka verwechselt. Die Hauptsache ist, man will ihn verbieten.

Was ist der Unterschied? Beim Niqab sind nur die Augen sichtbar, bei der Burka nicht einmal diese, denn die Frau sieht darunter nur durch ein Gitter in die AuÃŸenwelt hinaus. Absurd? FÃ¼r manche sicher.

In den letzten Jahren habe ich mit vielen unterschiedlichen Frauen Interviews gefÃ¼hrt. Drei von ihnen waren Niqabis.

Eine Ã¶sterreichische Kroatin, die vor einigen Jahren zum Islam konvertiert ist, trug lange Zeit lediglich ein Kopftuch. Durch einen Unfall wurde ihr Gesicht jedoch total entstellt. Sie traute sich wochenlang nicht mehr aus der Wohnung, weil die Menschen auf den StraÃŸen das taten, was sie am besten kÃ¶nnen: Sie starren.

Erst diese Erfahrung bewegte sie dazu, einen Niqab zu tragen. Die Leute starren immer noch, aber weitaus weniger. Jetzt ist das Vermummungsverbot in Kraft getreten und sie Ã¼berlegt, nach Kroatien zu ziehen.

Ich lass mir von MÃ¤nnern in AnzÃ¼gen nicht sagen, wie ich mich zu kleiden habe

Eine andere Bekannte von mir hat nicht lange gezÃ¶gert: Sie ist sofort nach Serbien gezogen. Ihre letzten Worten waren: "Ich lasse mir doch von MÃ¤nnern in AnzÃ¼gen nicht vorschreiben, wie ich mich zu kleiden habe! Ich bin weg."

Kleidung hin oder her - als Journalistin interessiert mich eine ganz andere Frage: Welches gesellschaftliche Problem ist durch das Gesetz gelÃ¶st?

In Ã–sterreich gibt es schÃ¤tzungsweise 150 Niqabis. Angenommen diese werden jetzt alle den ihren Schleier ablegen, was dann? Was wird sich Ã¤ndern? Sie werden wohl kaum alle erblonden. Aus Fatima wird nicht einfach Stefanie.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Frau in Berlin beleidigt eine Muslima und versucht, ihr das Kopftuch herunterzureiÃŸen

Die ganze Aktion ist reiner Populismus auf dem RÃ¼cken muslimischer Frauen. Doch was denken sich die politischen Akteure dabei? Etwa, "mit denen kÃ¶nnen wir es machen, die sind UnterdrÃ¼ckung und Bevormundung von Haus aus gewÃ¶hnt?"

Doch nicht nur muslimische Frauen leiden unter der AbsurditÃ¤t des Gesetzes. Laut dem Journalisten Florian Klenk sind sogar Clowns angezeigt worden.

AuÃŸerdem mussten Musiker ihre Masken wÃ¤hrend eines Ã¶ffentlichen Auftritts abnehmen. Ein Augenzeuge berichtete in einem Post von U-Bahn-FahrgÃ¤sten, die fremde Frauen dazu zwangen, ihre Verschleierung abzunehmen.

Frauen werden verbal angefeindet und kÃ¶rperlich attackiert

In der Zeitung las ich einen Bericht Ã¼ber ein Werbemaskottchen, dass von der Polizei dazu gezwungen wurde, den Kopf seines KostÃ¼ms abzunehmen. Der junge Mann war als Hai verkleidet und machte Werbung fÃ¼r das Unternehmen McShark.

Doch was ist mit den verschleierten und ach so unterdrÃ¼ckten Frauen? In Ã–sterreich werden sie jetzt auf den StraÃŸen verbal angefeindet und sogar kÃ¶rperlich attackiert - meistens in der Anwesenheit ihrer Kinder.

Wo ist die Logik, wenn durch das Gesetz Frauen auf der StraÃŸe in die Enge getrieben werden, um ihnen ins Gesicht zu boxen, oder, ihnen buchstÃ¤blich die Kleidung vom Leib zu reiÃŸen?

Doch wie reagieren Musliminnen eigentlich auf den Versuch den Islam StÃ¼ck fÃ¼r StÃ¼ck aus der Ã–ffentlichkeit zu beseitigen?

Die KÃ¼nstlerin Asma Aiad hat ein Fotoprojekt mit dem Namen "Ceci nÂ´est pas une Burqa" in die Welt gesetzt, um zu veranschaulichen, wie ziellos das Gesetz eigentlich ist.

Das Projekt erlangte durch seinen Humor viel mediale Aufmerksamkeit und verbreitete sich schnell im Internet. Auch der Berliner Youtube-Kanal "Die DatteltÃ¤ter" griff das Thema auf. Die Kernthese: "Solange du einen Besen in der Hand hast, stÃ¶rt sich keiner an deinem Kopftuch."

In einer Zeit, in der saudi-arabische Frauen endlich Autofahren dÃ¼rfen ihnen fÃ¼r uns selbstverstÃ¤ndliche Freiheiten bietet, verbieten wir Menschen, sich so zu kleiden, wie sie es mÃ¶chten.

Im Deckmantel der Freiheit mÃ¼ssen sich muslimische Frauen anhÃ¶ren, dass alles was sie tragen, eine Zwangsjacke ist.

"Wir haben damals unsere BHs verbrannt", teilte mir vor kurzem eine Frau mit. "Aber Sie tragen doch im Moment einen", war meine Antwort. NatÃ¼rlich verbrennen wir symbolisch so einiges, aber nur, um diesen Symbole wieder neu definieren zu kÃ¶nnen.

Aus dem Auge heiÃŸt nicht aus dem Sinn

Nur, weil der Niqab nun aus den Augen ist, ist er noch lange nicht aus dem Sinn. Denn wenn man UnterdrÃ¼ckung bekÃ¤mpfen mÃ¶chte, dann sollte man dort anfangen, wo die Idee dieser sitzt: In den KÃ¶pfen der Menschen.

Niemand entscheidet darÃ¼ber, was ein Mensch trÃ¤gt, wie frei oder unterdrÃ¼ckt er ist.

Angela Merkel wird immer mit MÃ¤nnern verglichen, weil sie auf Make-Up verzichtet und in den Augen der Medien "einen mÃ¤nnlichen Auftritt" hinlegt. Melania Trump wird als "Puppe" bezeichnet, weil sie Model war und fÃ¼r die Medien "schÃ¶n weiblich" ist.

Marylin Monroe war eine eine intelligente Frau und begnadete Schauspielerin, die so lange als Sexsymbol missbraucht wurde, bis sie starb. Nicht viel anders erging es auch Romy Schneider.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Schulwechsel: Vater will nicht, dass seine Tochter von einer Lehrerin mit Kopftuch unterrichtet wird

Frauen werden in der Ã–ffentlichkeit immer auf ihr Aussehen reduziert, in SchublÃ¤den gesteckt und mundtot gemacht. In einem GesprÃ¤ch verriet mir eine Dame: "Ich mÃ¶chte wissen, wie die Frauen darunter aussehen, man muss doch das Gesicht erkennen kÃ¶nnen."

Meine Frage darauf konnte sie nicht beantworten: "Wieso? WÃ¼rden Sie mit den Frauen sprechen, wenn Sie deren Gesicht sehen wÃ¼rden?" Wahrscheinlich nicht.

Wie viele Niqab-TrÃ¤gerinnen steckten hinter TerroranschlÃ¤gen? Wie viele sind in den letzten Jahren kriminell auffÃ¤llig geworden?

Und wenn es uns wirklich um die Freiheit der Frauen geht:

Wieso zahlen wir ihnen dann nicht faire GehÃ¤lter?

Wieso gibt es keine Barrierefreiheit fÃ¼r alleinerziehende MÃ¼tter?

Wieso gibt es in Ã–sterreich nicht die Ehe fÃ¼r Alle?

Wieso gibt es kein Anti-Diskriminierungsgesetz?

Wieso gibt es kein Gesetz gegen Hetze?

Ja, Vermummung jeglicher Art ist nun in Ã–sterreich mit 150 Euro strafbar, aber die KÃ¶pfe sind leider noch dieselben geblieben.
TITLE: Verschleierte Hetze: Das Ã¶sterreichische Burka-Verbot zeigt, dass es nie darum ging, Frauen zu befreien

SUMMARY:
Image caption Steve Hewlett 1958-2017Full text of the lecture as delivered at the Royal Television Society on 28 September 2017:I am honoured to be asked to deliver this, the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture.
Thank you to the RTS, the Media Society and to Rachel for inviting me to deliver it.
It's great to have Steve's boys - Freddie, Billy, Bertie - here, his sister Sue and other members of the family too.
Steve's death was news - national news - which, had he been here to see it and to see you all gathered here for the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture - would have produced one of those characteristically laconic Hewlett chuckles.
It was news, of course, because millions had grown used to turning up the car radio or stopping the ironing or waiting before turning on the kettle to make sure they not miss the latest weekly instalment of the Hewlett cancer chronicle - in which a middle aged man described the pain in his oesophagus; the splitting of his nails or chapping of his feet; the search for the drug or the treatment that might buy him some relief and some more time before the end which he sensed and we sensed was coming all too fast.
TEXT:
Image caption Steve Hewlett 1958-2017

Full text of the lecture as delivered at the Royal Television Society on 28 September 2017:

I am honoured to be asked to deliver this, the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture.

Thank you to the RTS, the Media Society and to Rachel for inviting me to deliver it. It's great to have Steve's boys - Freddie, Billy, Bertie - here, his sister Sue and other members of the family too.

Steve's death was news - national news - which, had he been here to see it and to see you all gathered here for the first annual Steve Hewlett memorial lecture - would have produced one of those characteristically laconic Hewlett chuckles.

It was news, of course, because millions had grown used to turning up the car radio or stopping the ironing or waiting before turning on the kettle to make sure they not miss the latest weekly instalment of the Hewlett cancer chronicle - in which a middle aged man described the pain in his oesophagus; the splitting of his nails or chapping of his feet; the search for the drug or the treatment that might buy him some relief and some more time before the end which he sensed and we sensed was coming all too fast.
TITLE: Nick Robinson

Des pompiers de quelques municipalitÃ©s au QuÃ©bec utilisent Â«illÃ©galementÂ» un appareil pour faciliter leurs dÃ©placements en situation d'urgence, gagner du temps et sauver des vies. Il s'agit du feu vert clignotant non autorisÃ© par le ministÃ¨re de la SÃ©curitÃ© publique.

Selon nos informations, au moins quatre municipalitÃ©s permettent ou ont permis jusqu'Ã  tout rÃ©cemment Ã  leurs pompiers d'installer un feu vert clignotant dans leurs vÃ©hicules personnels, sans avoir obtenu l'autorisation du gouvernement du QuÃ©bec. Il s'agit de Sainte-Rose-de-Watford, dans ChaudiÃ¨re-Appalaches, de Shannon, dans la rÃ©gion de QuÃ©bec et de Saint-Armand, dans les Cantons-de-l'Est. Ã€ Sainte-Catherine-de-la- Jacques-Cartier, aussi dans la rÃ©gion de QuÃ©bec, on indique que son utilisation a cessÃ© cette annÃ©e.

Â«Je sais que je n'ai pas le droit de l'utiliser, mais je ne le fais que rarement et uniquement en situation d'urgenceÂ», admet le lieutenant Nicolas Desautels du Service incendie de Saint-Armand.

L'affiche installÃ©e aux points d'entrÃ©e de la municipalitÃ© de Shannon.

Celui qui oeuvre au sein d'une brigade de 20 pompiers souligne que le feu vert clignotant, mÃªme s'il n'est pas dotÃ© d'une sirÃ¨ne, permet une importante Ã©conomie de temps. Â«Quand j'utilise le clignotant, je sauve de 5 Ã  7 minutes pour effectuer le trajet d'environ 10 km qui sÃ©pare ma maison de la caserne. Les gens me laissent passer dans le trafic. Et vous savez que chaque seconde compte pour sauver des vies lors d'un incendieÂ», ajoute M. Desautels qui demande au gouvernement Couillard d'autoriser rapidement cet instrument partout au QuÃ©bec.

LIRE AUSSI:

Â» Le QuÃ©bec fait face Ã  une inquiÃ©tante pÃ©nurie de pompiers

Ã€ Sainte-Catherine-de-la- Jacques-Cartier, on dit ne plus l'utiliser sachant que la loi ne le permet pas. Â«On l'a utilisÃ© de 2016 Ã  2017, mais notre demande de dÃ©rogation au gouvernement a Ã©tÃ© refusÃ©e. Nous ne voulions pas continuer d'Ãªtre dans l'illÃ©galitÃ©. Pourtant, cet outil a toute son importance surtout pour nous qui devons composer avec un embouteillage monstre en raison de l'achalandage du Village vacances Valcartier. Quand les voitures sont pare-chocs contre pare-chocs sur des dizaines de kilomÃ¨tres, il est essentiel que nous puissions nous rendre le plus rapidement possible Ã  la caserneÂ», se dÃ©fend Steven McCarthy, directeur du Service incendie de cette caserne de 27 pompiers.

La Ville de Shannon, elle, estime Ãªtre conforme Ã  la rÃ©glementation et ce, mÃªme si le gouvernement du QuÃ©bec n'a jamais donnÃ© son feu vert pour l'utilisation de ce dispositif. C'est qu'une rÃ©solution du conseil municipal a Ã©tÃ© adoptÃ©e en avril 2016 permettant Ã  ses pompiers l'usage de ce gyrophare lors de dÃ©placements vers la caserne Ã  la suite d'un appel d'urgence.

Â«Nous avons installÃ© trois affiches aux trois points d'entrÃ©e de la ville. Toute manÅ“uvre impliquant l'emploi du clignotant vert sur une urgence doit demeurer sÃ©curitaire et respecter le code de sÃ©curitÃ© routiÃ¨re en vigueur, pas question de brÃ»ler un feu rouge ou de ne pas faire un arrÃªt obligatoire. Le clignotant vert est simplement un outil d'identification dans le but de sensibiliser le citoyen Ã  faciliter le passage lors d'un dÃ©placement vers la caserne afin de diminuer le temps de rÃ©ponse Ã  une urgenceÂ», mentionne Marie France Lambert, agente aux communications Ã  Shannon.

La rÃ©solution prÃ©cise que l'application de cette mesure est autorisÃ©e sur le territoire de la Ville de Shannon uniquement. ConsÃ©quemment, les territoires touchant l'entraide mutuelle avec les autres municipalitÃ©s ne font pas partie du territoire approuvÃ©.

D'autres pompiers dÃ©fient la loi

D'autres pompiers de d'autres municipalitÃ©s du QuÃ©bec disent avoir Â«expÃ©rimentÃ©Â» le feu vert clignotant Â«seulement pour des dÃ©monstrations aux mÃ©diasÂ», lance rapidement Michel Desjardins, un pompier qui milite depuis trois ans pour que les articles 226.2 et 287.1.1 soient ajoutÃ©s et actifs au code de la sÃ©curitÃ© routiÃ¨re du QuÃ©bec.

Proposition d'ajouts:



L'article 226.2: Le vÃ©hicule routier, autre qu'un vÃ©hicule d'urgence, conduit par un pompier visÃ© par la Loi sur la sÃ©curitÃ© incendie peut Ãªtre muni d'un gyrophare vert amovible uniquement lorsque ce pompier agit dans le cadre d'un Ã©vÃ©nement visÃ© par cette loi. Ce gyrophare autorise le conducteur, lorsque la situation l'exige, Ã  circuler sur l'accotement et Ã  immobiliser son vÃ©hicule Ã  tout endroit. Le conducteur doit agir de maniÃ¨re Ã  ne pas compromettre la sÃ©curitÃ© des usagers de la route. L'article 287.1.1: Le conducteur d'un vÃ©hicule routier qui contrevient au deuxiÃ¨me alinÃ©a de l'article 226.2 est passible d'une amende de 300 $ Ã  600 $.

Â«L'autre jour un policier de la SQ m'a dit: ''pourquoi tu n'a pas allumÃ© ton feu vert j'aurais pu te laisser passer sur l'accotement et t'Ã©viter de perdre du temps au pÃ©rimÃ¨tre de sÃ©curitÃ©'". Je lui ai rÃ©pondu que je n'avais pas le droit.Â»

Â«Le feu vert clignotant permet de faire un couloir pour laisser passer les pompiers au volant de leurs voitures personnelles comme c'est le cas lorsque nous sommes Ã  bord du camion pompierÂ», a-t-il expliquÃ©.

M. Desjardins souligne qu'Ã  plusieurs endroits au Canada, le feu vert clignotant est lÃ©gal. Â«L'Ontario l'utilise et Ã§a fonctionne Ã  merveille. En Alberta, ils sont rendus au feu rouge avec sirÃ¨ne. Les vÃ©hicules personnels des pompiers sont de vÃ©ritables vÃ©hicules d'urgenceÂ».

Des rÃ©sultats convaincants?

PrÃ©sentement, le gouvernement du QuÃ©bec accepte que les MRC de BÃ©cancour et la MRC Les Collines-de-l'Outaouais fassent l'usage du feu vert clignotant dans le cadre d'un projet-pilote de trois ans dÃ©butÃ© en 2015 et qui se terminera en aoÃ»t 2018.

Le HuffPost QuÃ©bec a mis la main sur des statistiques colligÃ©es par le ministÃ¨re de la SÃ©curitÃ© publique Ã  partir du rapport sur l'effet de l'utilisation du feu vert clignotant entre le 13 octobre 2015 au 31 octobre 2016.

Le nombre total d'interventions (tout type d'appel confondu) est de 1863 pour les deux MRC participantes au projet-pilote. Dans 83 % des cas, les utilisateurs du feu vert clignotant estiment avoir ainsi facilitÃ© leurs dÃ©placements. Plus de 16% des sapeurs disent avoir sauvÃ© plus de deux minutes. Le projet-pilote vise 418 pompiers rÃ©partis dans 31 casernes pour une population totale de 69 645 habitants.

Â«Il a aussi Ã©tÃ© dÃ©montrÃ© que les arguments contre l'utilisation du feu vert clignotant et les craintes Ã©taient par le fait mÃªme non fondÃ©sÂ», assure Michel Desjardins.

Le ministÃ¨re de la SÃ©curitÃ© publique n'a pas Ã©tÃ© en mesure de rÃ©pondre Ã  notre demande d'entrevue.
TITLE: Des pompiers Â«illÃ©gauxÂ»... pour sauver des vies

DÃ©jÃ  engagÃ© dans un bras de fer particuliÃ¨rement virulent avec Manuel Valls, Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon ne veut rien lÃ¢cher sur le drapeau europÃ©en, dont il conteste la prÃ©sence dans l'hÃ©micycle de l'AssemblÃ©e nationale. En rÃ©action, Emmanuel Macron a annoncÃ© ce mardi qu'il allait officiellement reconnaÃ®tre le drapeau bleu et or lors d'un sommet de l'Union europÃ©enne, la semaine prochaine, afin qu'il ne puisse plus Ãªtre "enlevÃ© de l'hÃ©micycle".

Ce Ã  quoi le dÃ©putÃ© des Bouches-du-RhÃ´ne a ripostÃ© ce mercredi 11 octobre par un communiquÃ© contestant la lÃ©galitÃ© de cette reconnaissance. "Monsieur le prÃ©sident vous n'avez pas le droit d'imposer Ã  la France un emblÃ¨me europÃ©en confessionnel. Il n'est pas le sien et la France a votÃ© contre son adoption sans ambiguÃ¯tÃ©", Ã©crit Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon, lui-mÃªme ancien eurodÃ©putÃ©, en faisant rÃ©fÃ©rence au rejet par la France du traitÃ© constitutionnel europÃ©en qui instaurait l'emblÃ¨me europÃ©en.

Le drapeau et l'hymne europÃ©ens ont nÃ©anmoins Ã©tÃ© reconnus par 16 des 28 pays de l'Union europÃ©enne par la signature d'une dÃ©claration commune annexÃ©e au traitÃ© de Lisbonne.

Pour le cofondateur de la France insoumise, cette dÃ©claration "ne peut Ãªtre signÃ©e" par le chef de l'Etat "sans vote ni accord du Parlement franÃ§ais". "La Constitution et le simple souci de la dÃ©mocratie autant que l'attachement Ã  la plus simple exigence laÃ¯que ne le permettent pas", Ã©crit le dÃ©putÃ© des Bouches-du-RhÃ´ne.

S'agissant de l'argument "confessionnel" invoquÃ©, celui-ci fait rÃ©fÃ©rence au crÃ©ateur du drapeau europÃ©en, ArsÃ¨ne Heitz, qui avait dit avoir puisÃ© l'inspiration dans des reprÃ©sentations de la Vierge Marie. DÃ¨s le 20 juin, aprÃ¨s son Ã©lection, Jean-Luc MÃ©lenchon avait dÃ©noncÃ© la prÃ©sence du drapeau europÃ©en bleu Ã©toilÃ© dans l'AssemblÃ©e: "Franchement, on est obligÃ© de supporter Ã§a?" avait-il lancÃ©. "C'est la RÃ©publique franÃ§aise ici, pas la Vierge Marie", avait-il ajoutÃ©.

Soutien du Front national et des souverainistes

Dans un amendement rejetÃ© en commission mais qui doit Ãªtre Ã  nouveau dÃ©battu dans l'hÃ©micycle mercredi aprÃ¨s-midi, le groupe Insoumis plaide que "la France n'est pleinement en phase avec son projet politique historique d'indÃ©pendantisme et de promotion de la paix que si elle dÃ©passe tout ancrage rÃ©gional et zonal" et invoquÃ© "une difficultÃ© Ã  mettre un drapeau qui ne fait pas consensus".

La proposition de la France insoumise a reÃ§u le soutien des dÃ©putÃ©s du Front national, partisans d'une sortie de l'Union europÃ©enne (Ã  terme).
