La vida da muchas vueltas, incluso para los diplomÃ¡ticos y sus nÃ©mesis. El primer ministro de CanadÃ¡, Justine Trudeau, y su antecesor Stephen Harper estarÃ¡n en Washington maÃ±ana para hablar sobre el mismo tema: la renegociaciÃ³n del Tratado de Libre Comercio de AmÃ©rica del Norte (TLCAN).

Los diplomÃ¡ticos canadienses participarÃ¡n en eventos separados en el dÃ­a en que inicia la cuarta ronda de negociaciones del TLCAN en Washington. Un dÃ­a despuÃ©s, el jueves 12, Trudeau realizarÃ¡ una visita de Estado en MÃ©xico.

El ex primer ministro canadiense del partido conservador estarÃ¡ como panelista en un evento organizado por el bufete de abogados de Dentons. En estas conferencias tambiÃ©n participarÃ¡n el secretario de Comercio de EU, Wilbur Ross; Arturo SarukhÃ¡n, exembajador de Mexico en Estados Unidos; y Newt Gingrich, confidente de Trump y expresidente de la CÃ¡mara de Representantes de Estados Unidos.

Por otro lado, Trudeau, que llegÃ³ esta tarde a Washington, se reunirÃ¡ maÃ±ana con el presidente estadounidense Donald Trump para hablar de comercio.

Se espera que en la reuniÃ³n con Trump, el Primer Ministro de CanadÃ¡ hable sobre el impuesto de 220% que el Departamento de Comercio estadounidense aprobÃ³ a las importaciones de aviones fabricados por la canadiense Bombardier, luego de que la armadora estadounidense Boeing se quejÃ³ de que la empresa habÃ­a cometido prÃ¡cticas desleales de comercio.

Wheels up for DC & Mexico City this week â€“ lots of work to do with our allies on trade, jobs, gender equality & growing our economies. pic.twitter.com/nF2L08Aq04

TEXT:
HuffPost is hitting the road this fall to interview people about their hopes, dreams, fears â€• and what it means to be American today.

The events were an idea from the nonprofit Crescent Peace Society, which has been seeking to raise awareness and improve understanding of Muslim cultures through interfaith events and dialogue since its founding in 1996.

The volunteer-run group was started by a handful of Muslim parents after the Oklahoma City bombing, when some of their kids were afraid to return to school because classmates said they were responsible for the attack.

Since then, the group has been organizing annual interfaith dinners, local â€œvisit a mosqueâ€ events, and a yearly iftar to break the Ramadan fast â€• all with non-Muslim community members so they can get to know Muslims face-to-face and counter misconceptions.

But late last year, almost exactly two decades after the groupâ€™s founding, Trump won the presidency with a campaign full of anti-Muslim rhetoric. Crescent Peace Society, which is based in the suburb of Overland Park, Kansas, received a wave of requests from neighbors around the Kansas City area â€œwho wanted to do something for the Muslim community but didnâ€™t know how â€• or had never even met a Muslim,â€ the groupâ€™s president, Ahsan Latif, told HuffPost.

Thatâ€™s when he started the monthly â€œMeet a Muslimâ€ events, inviting non-Muslims to sit around a table with Muslims and just talk â€• about current events, their families, their faith, anything. The events, which are free and open to the public, have been at locations including an Islamic Center, a church and a synagogue. The first drew about 200 people and subsequent events have brought in about 150 each.

â€œI was surprised by my own misconceptions, particularly about the lives of women within the Muslim religion,â€ participant Becky Plate, who is non-Muslim, told HuffPost by email of her experience at one event. â€œI consider myself a pretty well-informed individual ... but even I had allowed news stories, about things like women secretly learning to drive in Saudi Arabia, to color my opinions.â€

For Latif, this type of myth-busting is exactly what the events are all about.

â€œIt distills our mission down to one event: getting to know people on a person-to-person basis,â€ Latif said. â€œItâ€™s harder to demonize someone or think theyâ€™re monolithic when you actually get to know them.â€

â€œWe speak as average people, not as mosque officials,â€ he added. â€œSo people get to know who regular people are who practice the faith.â€

Crescent Peace Society Muslim and Jewish community members speak at a "Meet a Muslim" event at a synagogue in March.

Latif, a 36-year-old attorney who had attended the organizationâ€™s annual dinners when he was younger, became president of the group three years ago after â€œone of the aunties asked me to â€• and I donâ€™t like to say no to the aunties,â€ he said.

Latif usually kicks off the events with a short introduction about the group and Islam in general and then hands control back to the tables â€• which each have at least one Muslim â€œmoderatorâ€ â€• to carry on their own, more intimate discussions.

The tables all have handouts to help guide conversation, with facts about Islam and Muslims in Kansas City and the U.S. After an hour or so, the Muslim moderators rotate to new tables. Latif said he makes a point of ensuring a diverse group of Muslims are present, with moderators including everyone from an Iraqi refugee to a Somali-American couple to an African-American recent convert, â€œso they can see we come in all different looks and ethnicities,â€ he said.

Table moderator Zehra Shabbir, who is Muslim and has been a member of Crescent Peace Society for four years, has attended several events. She was â€œsurprisedâ€ both by the level of concern for and solidarity with Muslims she saw from non-Muslim attendees, as well as by some of the misconceptions people had about Islam, including everything from the veil to womenâ€™s rights.

â€œHow can there be such a negative outlook on a group of people that nearly 60 percent of Americans have never even spoken to?â€ Shabbir told HuffPost by email. â€œThat stat alone makes initiatives like this important. We all fear the unknown, but that fear can be broken once you sit down with someone different and just talk to them.â€

Jennifer Bustos-Gomez This photo was shared to the Crescent Peace Society Facebook page in June by a community member who had attended an interfaith event. It included the comment: "Gracious, warm hospitality accompanied by amazing cuisine. Thank you for giving us the chance to break bread together. This is exactly how real communities are built, made stronger. We were honored to be your guests."

The Crescent Peace Societyâ€™s â€œMeet a Muslimâ€ events are one of a handful of similar initiatives that have sprung up across the country since the election. One Muslim couple started a â€œdinner with your Muslim neighborâ€ project in Seattle, for instance, and a Muslim veteran has been traveling the country with a sign reading â€œIâ€™m Muslim and a U.S. Marine, ask anything.â€

When asked whether such projects place undue responsibility on Muslims to have to humanize themselves to non-Muslims, particularly in an environment of increased fear among the Muslim community, Latif demurred.

â€œThereâ€™s a lot of discussion in progressive circles on whose job it is to humanize people, and I understand itâ€™s off-putting to explain, â€˜Iâ€™m just a human being just like you are,â€™â€ he said. â€œBut weâ€™ve found in our work that waiting for other people to do the work doesnâ€™t get anything done. You have to take that first step and hope that other people will join you.â€

â€œIf we donâ€™t speak, then other people write the narratives for us,â€ he added.

Amid a recent rise in anti-Muslim hate groups nationwide â€• and spate of hate crimes in recent years in the Kansas City area â€• Latif recognizes the effect and reach of the groupâ€™s events are small. But even if they touch only a few hundred people, he believes they still have value.

â€œThere are so few Muslims and so much said about them,â€ Latif said. â€œEven just meeting people who [already] support us, they can say to their extended families: â€˜Iâ€™ve met a Muslim person and this is what I found out,â€™ so itâ€™s a ripple that hopefully reverberates further out.â€
TITLE: In Face Of Islamophobia, This Group Hosts â€˜Meet A Muslimâ€™ Events In Kansas

SUMMARY:
â€œGuardians Of The Galaxyâ€ director James Gunn is mincing no words when it comes to the sexual harassment accusations against Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein allegations and stories of similar incidents Gunn has since heard.
Gunn posted a powerful note on Facebook, headlined â€œOn Sexual Predators In Hollywood (and the World),â€ that highlighted the pervasiveness of sexual assault and harassment.
The director starts the note by explaining he was discussing the allegations against Weinstein with female friends and was horrified by how casually the women spoke of abuse theyâ€™ve endured.
The New York Times set off the furor with a story last Thursday that detailed numerous allegations of sexual harassment by Weinstein spanning decades.
And evil men are doing this everywhere, every day, in every occupation, and every type of household, all over the world.
TEXT:
â€œGuardians Of The Galaxyâ€ director James Gunn is mincing no words when it comes to the sexual harassment accusations against Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein allegations and stories of similar incidents Gunn has since heard.

Gunn posted a powerful note on Facebook, headlined â€œOn Sexual Predators In Hollywood (and the World),â€ that highlighted the pervasiveness of sexual assault and harassment. The director starts the note by explaining he was discussing the allegations against Weinstein with female friends and was horrified by how casually the women spoke of abuse theyâ€™ve endured.

â€³And then another round of stories started, of these women being grabbed and molested and abused by bosses and managers and agents,â€ Gunn said. â€œAnd then another round started: endless incidents of these women being subject to the unsolicited sexual advances of men, ranging from your every day entitled Hollywood scumbucket douchebag to attempted rape.â€

Gunn criticized â€œeveryone who enabled [Weinstein] to get away with such behavior.â€

The 65-year-old Weinstein was fired from his own production company on Sunday night, but many have criticized the board of The Weinstein Company for not acting sooner amid years of rumors about his behavior. The New York Times set off the furor with a story last Thursday that detailed numerous allegations of sexual harassment by Weinstein spanning decades. The article said Weinstein had agreed to at least eight private settlements with women.

A former New York Times reporter, Sharon Waxman, claims that while working for the paper in 2004, she tracked down evidence of Weinsteinâ€™s misconduct. But, Waxman said, pressure from the influential filmmaker and actors Matt Damon and Russell Crowe resulted in her story being â€œgutted.â€

Gunn, in his post, said that while Hollywood was â€œrifeâ€ with sexual predators, itâ€™s widespread â€œEVERYWHERE.â€

â€œWhen someone is coerced sexually it not only affects that person, but the lives of those around that person, like rows of dominoes falling in every direction,â€ Gunn said. â€œIt demolishes trust and comfort in all of society. And evil men are doing this everywhere, every day, in every occupation, and every type of household, all over the world.
TITLE: Director James Gunn Slams Harvey Weinstein And All Sexual Predators In One Post

"In der Tat ist das heute ein groÃŸer Tag, den wir in ein paar Stunden mit der Unterschrift besiegeln", sagte Spohr.

Air Berlin - die nach Lufthansa bisher zweitgrÃ¶ÃŸte deutsche Fluglinie - hatte Mitte August Insolvenz angemeldet. Der Flugbetrieb seitdem war nur durch einen Kredit des Bundes Ã¼ber 150 Millionen Euro gesichert.

Die GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrung hatte drei Wochen lang exklusiv mit dem deutschen MarktfÃ¼hrer Lufthansa sowie mit dem britischen Billigflieger Easyjet Ã¼ber den Verkauf von Teilen des hoch verschuldeten Unternehmens verhandelt. Fraglich war zuletzt, ob auch eine Einigung mit Easyjet gelingt.

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTNEW DELHI -- The Union Cabinet on Thursday cleared revised pay scales for nearly eight lakh teachers and academic staff of higher educational institutions following the implementation of the Seventh Pay Commission.
HRD minister Prakash Javadekar told reporters that the approved pay scales would be applicable from January 1, 2016.
"The implementation of the pay revision will enhance the teachers' pay in the range of Rs 10,400 and Rs 49,800 as against the extant entry pay due to the implementation of the 6th Pay Commission for the pay of teachers.
For state government funded institutions, the revised pay scales will require adoption by the respective state governments.
The measures proposed in the revised pay structure are expected to improve quality of higher education and also attract and retain talent, Javadekar said.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

NEW DELHI -- The Union Cabinet on Thursday cleared revised pay scales for nearly eight lakh teachers and academic staff of higher educational institutions following the implementation of the Seventh Pay Commission.

The decision will benefit 7.58 lakh teachers and equivalent academic staff in the 106 universities and colleges which are funded by the UGC and the union HRD ministry and also 329 universities which are funded by state governments and 12,912 government and private aided colleges affiliated to state public universities.

"In addition, the revised pay package will cover teachers of 119 centrally funded technical institutions -- IITs, IISc, IIMs, IISERs, IIITs and NITIE," a statement said after the meeting.

HRD minister Prakash Javadekar told reporters that the approved pay scales would be applicable from January 1, 2016.

The annual central financial liability on account of this measure would be about Rs 9,800 crore.

"The implementation of the pay revision will enhance the teachers' pay in the range of Rs 10,400 and Rs 49,800 as against the extant entry pay due to the implementation of the 6th Pay Commission for the pay of teachers. This revision would register an entry pay growth in the range of 22 per cent to 28 per cent," the statement said.

For state government funded institutions, the revised pay scales will require adoption by the respective state governments.

The Centre will bear the additional burden of the states on account of revision of pay scales. The measures proposed in the revised pay structure are expected to improve quality of higher education and also attract and retain talent, Javadekar said.
TITLE: Cabinet Clears Pay Hike For 7.58 Lakh Teachers In Central And State Universities

En una Ã©poca en la que chavitas de 24 aÃ±os se autonombran directoras generales de sus propias empresas (conformadas Ãºnicamente por ellas, cabe mencionar), no pude evitar preguntarme porque yo, a mis 20 y 16, nomÃ¡s no me creo CEO... Â¡ni de mi propia vida! #sufrocomoprecious

No sÃ© si vivas en la CDMX o no, pero las Ãºltimas semanas han sido realmente atÃ­picas, por no decir caÃ³ticas. Por mi parte, despuÃ©s del temblor estuve tres dÃ­as enclaustrada en San Juan del RÃ­o con la empresa donde trabajo, tratando de descifrar, entender y resolver el futuro de la industria editorial (digo "enclaustrada" pero la verdad es que la pasÃ© muy bien y sÃ­ me dio tiempo de ir a correr un dÃ­a).

El viernes sÃ­ fui a la oficina, pero de eso que nada mÃ¡s lees mails... y tÃ­pico que lees tres y llegan cinco, Â¿asÃ­ cÃ³mo? Pero bueno. De lunes a miÃ©rcoles, misma historia; sÃºmale que todavÃ­a no agarraba bien el rollo de la nueva rutina â€“de cuando llega un jefe nuevoâ€“ Â¡cuando me volvÃ­ a ir!, esta vez a CuliacÃ¡n a recoger un premio, del cual te contarÃ© en otro post. La cosa es que no estÃ¡s tÃº para saberlo, pero yo sÃ­ para contarlo: me siento fuera de control.

Eso de vivir el dÃ­a a dÃ­a esperando "que la vida me sorprenda" ha estado 'cool', pero hasta cierto punto.

No solo porque me sÃºper enamorÃ© de un niÃ±o que me hace sentir como el emoticÃ³n de los ojitos de corazÃ³n ğŸ˜, sino porque mi productividad â€“desde antes de que temblaraâ€“ se fue a pique. Yo le echo la culpa al sÃ­ndrome del burnout y al hecho de que durante dos meses fui exprimida cual naranja, hasta que quedÃ© exhausta, sin energÃ­a, creatividad, sentido del humor, alegrÃ­a ni esperanza. Bueno, exagerÃ©, pero sÃ­ me sentÃ­a drenada. Cansada de estar cansada y harta. Bien bonito #not.

Por eso platicar con la coach Jessica VÃ¡zquez sobre cÃ³mo volverme la CEO de mi vida me entusiasmÃ³. Porque pienso que, fuera de la salud, no hay nada mÃ¡s feo que sentir que la vida te vive, que las riendas de tu vida las llevarÃ­a mejor un caballo de carreras desbocado y sin jinete, en fin, entiendes mi punto.

Eso de vivir el dÃ­a a dÃ­a esperando "que la vida me sorprenda" ha estado cool, pero hasta cierto punto. Como dice mi novio (sÃ­, la verdad sÃ­ me creo mucho jijiji): me urge un sistema que me garantice el Ã©xito no solo a nivel profesional, sino personal. EstÃ¡ bien ser espontÃ¡nea y flexible y cuanto adjetivo en tendencia me quiera adjudicar, peeeeero tambiÃ©n se tiene uno que trazar metas y objetivos, y trabajar cada dÃ­a para avanzar hacia ellas aunque sea un poquito.

Sin el afÃ¡n de balconearme, lo que me dijo Jessica fue que el Board of Directors (consejo directivo) de mi empresa â€“o sea yoâ€“ tiene que estar conformado por:

Â· La mente: la voz chinga-quedito de la razÃ³n y el juicio

Â· El corazÃ³n: las emociones, mensajeras con sugerencias e indicaciones

Â· El cuerpo: las sensaciones fÃ­sicas que tambiÃ©n se manifiestan

Â· El espÃ­ritu: la parte mÃ¡s sabia y serena (y olvidada la mayorÃ­a del tiempo)

Ojo: todos los integrantes son igualmente importantes y deben trabajar en perfecto equilibrio. Yo, honestamente, tiendo a ser sÃºper emocional y de repente se me sube lo kabbalista.

Una vez trazado el plan de acciÃ³n (clarividencia previa requerida), hay que empezar a usar un score card. TraducciÃ³n: hay que llevar un registro de acciones concretas, comportamientos observables, sÃºper especÃ­ficos, que nos llevan al punto donde queremos estar. Porque no es lo mismo decir "sigo llegando tarde", a reconocer que antes eran 60 minutos de retraso y ahora son 15. La motivaciÃ³n â€“y respectiva celebraciÃ³nâ€“ son distintas. QuizÃ¡ siga siendo impuntual, pero hay mejorÃ­a y eso tambiÃ©n cuenta. La objetividad es bÃ¡sica #niNOaldrama.

De acuerdo con Jess, vivir la vida con soberanÃ­a que todos soÃ±amos es posible si tenemos 3 simples cosas: 1) curiosidad, 2) amabilidad y 3) coraje.

Un Ãºltimo tip para el proceso de introspecciÃ³n: lanza al aire una pregunta que te quite la paz, respira profundamente (inhala y exhala al menos 10 veces) y empieza el juego del por quÃ© / para quÃ© . Ejemplo: Quiero una carga de trabajo mÃ¡s balanceada. Â¿Para quÃ©? Para rendir mÃ¡s y hacer las cosas con mÃ¡s cuidado. Â¿Para quÃ©? Para sentirme orgullosa de mi trabajo y en paz con mi jefe. Â¿Para quÃ©? (...)

Luego de responder dos o tres veces, empezarÃ¡s a conectarte con tu verdadero Ser, ese que te darÃ¡ las Verdaderas Respuestas que no tienen nada que ver con juicios, expectativas y carencias, sino con certeza, amor y abundancia.

Â¡Suerte a los valientes!

Atte. Bianca Pescador,

CEO de Bianca Romantic, Fun & Work Enterprises

TEXT:
A cake with pimples that can actually be popped is here to take your spot-squeezing obsession to the next stage. Or, you know, make you gag a bit.

The cake portrays a womanâ€™s face, covered in angry-looking pimples. When you squeeze them, sponge cake and chocolate pops out.

The Cakescape company in Kuala Lumpur has been receiving orders for the unusual creation for months, according to Mashable, with plenty of women ordering them in for their hen parties. (Yeah, weâ€™re not sure why either.)

A post shared by The Cakescape, Kuala Lumpur (@thecakescape) on Oct 9, 2017 at 7:34pm PDT

The cake represents a growing appetite for spot-squeezing content. A dermatologist called Dr Pimple Popper (aka Sandra Lee) has 2.5 million followers who tune in to watch her squeeze spots, blackheads and drain cysts on a daily basis.

People are divided by the edible creation. John Legere tweeted a photo of the cake and added: â€œThere are just some things we donâ€™t need in life...â€

Tony Pizza (who clearly loves a good pun) tweeted: â€œA pus of this cake will please anyone who eats zit.â€

Not grossed out enough yet? Hereâ€™s a video of the cake in action.

A post shared by The Cakescape, Kuala Lumpur (@thecakescape) on Oct 9, 2017 at 5:10pm PDT

Itâ€™s not the first time spot-squeezing cakes have taken the internet by storm, last year bakers from Blessed By Baking were inspired by Dr Pimple Popperâ€™s work to create cupcakes resembling huge pimples with white heads.

When the tops were squeezed, yellow icing resembling spot gunk oozed out.
TITLE: This Spot-Squeezing Cake Might Put You Off Dessert

TEXT:
Laut einem Medienbericht plant die EU-Kommission eine Quote fÃ¼r Elektroautos

Bis 2030 sollten 15 Prozent aller Neuwagen mit einem Elektromotor oder anderen emissionsfreien Antrieb ausgestattet sein

Die EU-Kommission plant nach einem Bericht der "Frankfurter Allgemeinen Zeitung" eine Quote fÃ¼r Elektrofahrzeuge.

Bis 2030 sollten 15 Prozent aller Neuwagen in Europa mit einem Elektromotor oder anderen emissionsfreien Antrieben ausgestattet sein, berichtet die Zeitung. EU-Energiekommissar Maros Sefcovic bestÃ¤tigte dies am Mittwoch aber noch nicht. Erst in November werde man "ehrgeizige VorschlÃ¤ge" vorlegen.

Man prÃ¼fe mehrere Optionen, sagte Sefcovic auf die Frage nach einer Quote oder anderen Mitteln zur FÃ¶rderung der ElektromobilitÃ¤t.

"Wir wollen das richtig machen"

"Wir wollen saubere Fahrzeuge - Fahrzeuge ohne Emissionen - voranbringen", betonte er. Die Industrie rufe nach flexiblen LÃ¶sungen. Erwogen werde unter anderem ein System, bei dem Hersteller Pluspunkte fÃ¼r Fahrzeuge mit wenig oder gar keinen Emissionen auf den Markt bringen. Noch prÃ¼fe man mÃ¶gliche Auswirkungen.

"Wir wollen das richtig machen." Er sagte aber auch, Studien gingen von einem Anteil von 25 Prozent Elektrofahrzeugen bereits 2025 aus.

Klares Signal an den Markt

Die "FAZ" berichtete, zu den fÃ¼r November angekÃ¼ndigten PlÃ¤nen zÃ¤hle die E-Quote. Dies solle ein klares Signal an den Markt werden.

Die Quote solle fÃ¼r jeden einzelnen Hersteller gelten. UnabhÃ¤ngig davon sollten Hersteller verpflichtet werden, den CO2-AusstoÃŸ ihrer Neuwagen zwischen 2021 und 2030 um ein Drittel zu verringern.

Momentan gilt fÃ¼r die Vorgabe, den CO2-AusstoÃŸ bis 2021 im Durchschnitt auf 95 Gramm je Kilometer zu senken.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Bei diesen Argumenten der Gegner von Elektro-Autos solltet ihr besonders vorsichtig sein
TITLE: Bericht: EU-Kommission plant Quote fÃ¼r Elektroautos

SUMMARY:
Doch dem CDU-Politiker scheint es eh mehr um das Tanzen zu gehen.
Diesen Eindruck vermittelt Althusmann zumindest in einem aktuellen Interview mit der Illustrieren "Bunte".
Deswegen tanze er auch in seinem Wahlkampfvideo, sagt Althusmann zu "Bunte": "Leichtigkeit und gute Laune tun gut."
Albig erntete fÃ¼r diese Aussagen heftige Kritik, kurz darauf verlor er die Landtagswahl.
Althusmann gibt sich in der "Bunte" jedoch gelassen: "Wer in die Politik geht, muss wissen, dass es plÃ¶tzlich zu Ende sein kann."
TEXT:
"Ich mÃ¶chte durch mein Leben tanzen": Bernd Althusmann im Video zu seinem Wahlkampfsong "Was GroÃŸes" | Screenshot

Am Sonntag wird in Niedersachsen gewÃ¤hlt

CDU-Spitzenkandidat Peter Althusmann will den SPD-MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Stephan Weil schlagen

Um nahbar zu wirken, hat er nun der "Bunte" ein Interview gegeben - ein Fehler, der schon mal einen Politiker eine Wahl gekostet hat

Bernd Althusmann tanzt, er wippt, er schnippt mit den Fingern. Gezwungen wirkt das, richtiggehend unangenehm sogar.

Es ist Althusmanns persÃ¶nlicher Wahlsong, zu dem er da rhythmisch die HÃ¼fte anwinkelt: "Wir haben was GroÃŸes vor". Die CDU Niedersachsen hat dazu ein Video auf Youtube hochgeladen, voller nichtsaussagender Hochglanzaufnahmen von lachenden Menschen und Textzeilen wie: "Wir mÃ¼ssen den Weg gehen, wir mÃ¼ssen es wagen."

Zu Politikstil und Inhalten von Bernd Althusmann liefert das Video keine Erkenntnisse. Doch dem CDU-Politiker scheint es eh mehr um das Tanzen zu gehen. Diesen Eindruck vermittelt Althusmann zumindest in einem aktuellen Interview mit der Illustrieren "Bunte".

Darin offenbart er intime und private Momente aus seinem Familienleben. Politikinteressierten sollte das wie ein DÃ©ja-Vu vorkommen.

Althusmann: "Ich mÃ¶chte durch mein Leben tanzen"

So berichtet der CDU-Spitzenkandidat etwa, wie er sich nach Ã¶ffentlichen Terminen gerne entspannt.

NatÃ¼rlich zuhause mit seiner Frau - aber nicht einfach so. "Manchmal fangen wir auch an, im Wohnzimmer zu tanzen â€“ nur wir zwei", sagt Althusmann. "Ihr Lebensmotto lautet: Ich mÃ¶chte durch mein Leben tanzen. Das ist auch meines geworden."

Deswegen tanze er auch in seinem Wahlkampfvideo, sagt Althusmann zu "Bunte": "Leichtigkeit und gute Laune tun gut." Wie sein Tanzen seinem Bundesland Niedersachsen konkret helfen soll, lÃ¤sst Althusmann offen.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: TV-Duell in Niedersachsen: SPD-Mann Weil gerÃ¤t bei einer entscheidenden Frage ins Schwimmen

DafÃ¼r erzÃ¤hlt er von seinem Spitznamen "Panzer", einer Schlange, die am Elektrozaun seines Hauses in Namibia "verkohlt" sei. Und von seiner Familie.

Althusmann ist zum zweiten Mal verheiratet, insgesamt hat er fÃ¼nf Kinder - drei leibliche und zwei Stiefkinder, erfÃ¤hrt der "Bunte"-Leser. Durchaus kritisch sehe der CDU-Kandidat dieses Patchwork-Leben, schreibt die Illustrierte. "Zwei Familien zu haben ist auf jeden Fall verdammt anstrengend", klagt Althusmann.

Und imitiert damit einen Fehltritt, der in Schleswig-Holstein dem SPD-Spitzenkandidaten Torsten Albig die Chance auf das Amt des MinisterprÃ¤sidenten kostete.

Althusmann: "Es kann plÃ¶tzlich zu Ende sein"

Auch Albig hatte der "Bunte" ein Interview gegeben, auch er hatte Ã¼ber sein Familienleben gesprochen - und auch er hatte sich Ã¼ber seine geschiedene Ehe ausgelassen. Seine Frau sei nicht mehr mit ihm auf AugenhÃ¶he gewesen, hatte Albig der "Bunte" berichtet. Es sei stets unterwegs gewesen, wÃ¤hrend sie als Mutter im Haushalt gearbeitet habe.

Albig erntete fÃ¼r diese Aussagen heftige Kritik, kurz darauf verlor er die Landtagswahl. Althusmann riskiert mit seinem "Bunte"-Interview einen Ã¤hnlichen Gang der Ereignisse.

Doch der CDU-Politiker wurde darauf offensichtlich gut vorbereitet.

Immer wieder betont er im Interview, welchen Respekt er vor seine Ex-Frau hÃ¤tte - Ã¼berhaupt vor Frauen, die als MÃ¼tter und Hausfrauen wichtige Dienste fÃ¼r die Gesellschaft leisten wÃ¼rden. An einer Stelle sagt Althusmann wie in Reaktion auf Albigs Aussage Ã¼ber seine erste Ehe: "Der Respekt ging nie verloren, sie war immer auf AugenhÃ¶he mit mir."

Dennoch: Mit seinem "Bunte"-Interview hat sich der CDU-Spitzenkandidat wohl keinen Gefallen getan.

In Niedersachsen liegt er derzeit in den Umfragen knapp hinter seinem Konkurrenten Weil. Kleinigkeiten werden also Ã¼ber die Wahl entscheiden - auch der Eindruck eines hÃ¼ftsteif durch sein Wohnzimmer tanzenden MinisterprÃ¤sidenten kann WÃ¤hler vergraulen.

Althusmann gibt sich in der "Bunte" jedoch gelassen: "Wer in die Politik geht, muss wissen, dass es plÃ¶tzlich zu Ende sein kann." Immerhin: Zum Tanzen wÃ¤re dann wieder mehr Zeit.

(lp)
TITLE: Niedersachsens CDU-Kandidat Althusmann hat der "Bunte" ein Interview gegeben - es ist vollkommen absurd

SUMMARY:
The de facto charge for a checked bag, at $15 over the minimum fare, is less than on most other airlines.
With other giant carriers charging checked bag fees of $25 a pop, even one checked bag gives Southwest a $50 round-trip fare advantage.
Related: 10 Tasty Carry-on Snacks You Can Make Yourself (Photo: JetBlue)Japan Airlines' new-design Sky Wider economy seats provide the roomiest international economy class you can currently find.
The onboard catering generally earns high marks, as well; economy travelers enjoy individual 10-inch screens, and the new 777s and 787s provide satellite-based Wi-Fi.
La Compagnie's current fare is almost $1,000 less than the premium economy fares on Open Skies or Air France.
TEXT:
Even after the current downgrading, JetBlue's extra legroom still beats any other airline. The de facto charge for a checked bag, at $15 over the minimum fare, is less than on most other airlines. The satellite-based Wi-Fi is free, at slow speeds, and $9 an hour for enough bandwidth to stream movies. And seats in JetBlue's Airbus planes are an inch wider than on any competitors' 737s. Related: 7 Embarrassing Travel Gadgets That Actually Work (Photo: JetBlue)

Its "two checked bags at no extra charge" and "no ticket-change penalty" policies make Southwest a clear winner for being nice to customers. Fortunately, at least so far, Southwest seems to have convinced Wall Street that those passenger-friendly policies gain more revenue in total customers than it would gain by imposing fees and losing customers. With other giant carriers charging checked bag fees of $25 a pop, even one checked bag gives Southwest a $50 round-trip fare advantage. Southwest has even managed to tame the chaos of its unique no-advance-assignment boarding process: You get your boarding group and number when you check in, which you can do online starting 24 hours before departure; at the airport, you line up according to number, and get on the plane with a minimum of pushing and shoving. (Photo: Southwest Airlines)

At least for now, Alaska Airlines' Mileage Plan seems more generous than the big-line programs that are moving toward dollar-based earnings and rewards. You still get one mile for every mile flown, and the award chart mileage requirements are less than the effective requirements on the giant airlines. Alaska still has useful partnerships with Air France/KLM, American, British Airways, Delta, Korean, Qantas, and a few others. We don't know how long Alaska will retain its current system, but it's a winner as long as today's rules remain. If you accumulate miles or points through a credit card that allows transfers, such as American Express, the award chart for Air Canada's Aeroplan is more generous than current big lines' plans. But you get only partial mileage credit when you fly on Air Canada's lowest fares. Related: 6 Ways to Get the Best Coach Seat Every Time (Photo: Alaska Airlines)

Yes, JetBlue beats it by the measurements, but Virgin America keeps earning great survey ratings for its flashy decor, well-trained flight attendants, top inflight technology, and general flair. Obviously, lots of travelers like what it has to offer. You might like it, too. The "Branson cool factor" also applies to Virgin Atlantic and Virgin Australia. (Photo: Virgin America)

The nod for best ultra-low-fare carrier for coach-class service goes to Allegiant, not because of its base productâ€”which is down there with Spirit in terms of sheer tortureâ€”but because it alone brings the only low-fare mainline service to dozens of communities where travelers would otherwise have to rely on regional flights to nearby hubs, with the usual hassle, wasted time, and high fares of hub connections. Allegiant's "nowhere to somewhere" business model gives travelers to/from communities as small as Hagerstown, Missoula, Owensboro, Provo, South Bend, and Stockton access to nonstop flights to 16 of the country's primary leisure travel destinations, including Honolulu, Las Vegas, Myrtle Beach, Orlando, and Phoenix. If you live in or near a big city, you'd never even think about Allegiant. But it's a no-brainer if you live in the sticks. Related: How to Get a Refund on a Non-Refundable Flight (Photo: Allegiant via Chris Parypa Photography/Shutterstock.com)

Southwest is the only airline to offer useful senior fares for travelers 65 or over. Senior fares aren't as low as Southwest's initial lowest "Wanna Get Away" fares for travelers of any age, but when those lowest-fare buckets sell out or when they're no longer available less than a week in advance, Southwest's unrestricted senior fares are usually a lot less than any remaining any-age fares. (Photo: Southwest Airlines)

JetBlue, which starts out with a 1- to 3-inch advantage for regular coach, retains a similar advantage for its extra-legroom cabin. And the price, capped at $90 for a transcontinental flight, is likely to be lower than the variable prices other airlines charge. This is a big advantage JetBlue has over Virgin America, the one airline that surveys usually place in the same class as JetBlue. On Virgin America, the extra-legroom seats, limited to bulkhead and exit rows, cost more than three times the regular-coach fare: more than $900 on a transcon, for example, compared with a base coach fare of $300. Yes, you get extras along with the legroom, but that huge fare premium is a deal breaker for someone who just wants enough space to use an e-reader or tablet comfortably. Related: 10 Tasty Carry-on Snacks You Can Make Yourself (Photo: JetBlue)

Japan Airlines' new-design Sky Wider economy seats provide the roomiest international economy class you can currently find. Contrary to what most other airlines are doing, JAL is sticking with eight-across seats in its 787s and nine-across in its 777s. That's one fewer seat in each row than the current standard among most other lines, and the remaining seats are almost two inches wider than competitors' seats. The new cabins also offer an industry-leading 34-inch pitch, compared with the 30- to 32-inch pitch you find on most other intercontinental airlines. The onboard catering generally earns high marks, as well; economy travelers enjoy individual 10-inch screens, and the new 777s and 787s provide satellite-based Wi-Fi. Related: 8 Foods You Should Never Eat Before Flying (Photo: Japan Airlines via Vytautas Kielaitis/Shutterstock.com)

Like JAL, Turkish is sticking with nine-across seating in its 777s, and the onboard service generally earns high marks. Swiss International also rises above others for catering. (Photo: Turkish Airlines)

Norwegian flies 787s from a handful of U.S. cities to Scandinavia and from Los Angeles or New York to London/Gatwick. It recently started flying from Baltimore, Boston, and New York to Guadeloupe and Martinique. Fares are usuallyâ€”although not alwaysâ€”lower than on the giant airlines, and its 787 product is on par with what the big competitors offer. Related: We Flew on Norwegian's 787 Dreamliner (and It Was Awesome) (Photo: Norwegian Air)

The giant airlines will charge you around $1,200 for a nonstop summer round-trip flight between New York and Paris in a cattle-car economy cabin. But two people paying $1,495 each can move up to an angle-flat business-class seat, with business-class cabin service, on La Compagnie, the niche French airline offering low-cost business-class service from Newark to London/Luton and Paris/DeGaulle. La Compagnie's current fare is almost $1,000 less than the premium economy fares on Open Skies or Air France. The price gap between regular economy and La Compagnie isn't always this small. But whenever it is, you sure feel better when you arrive in London or Paris after an overnight in business class than in economy. It's worth considering. Related: 7 Secrets of Ultra-Cheap Europe Flights (Photo: La Compagnie)

SUMMARY:
While talking to ANI, the Jamiat Secretary said, "The decision to allow Muslim women aged above 45 years to go on Haj alone is entirely illegal and is an intervention in Islam.
Touting Islam as a religion which respects women the most, Jamiat Secretary said, "I do not understand which religion respects women more than Islam."
Questioning the issue of gender equality, Azmi said, "If we talk about equality then there should be equality even in carrying a child in womb.
First there should be equality in the birth process then other aspects of equality should be implemented in Islam."
Azmi even warned the government regarding the consequences if they forcefully implement the decision to allow Muslim women aged above 45 years to go on Haj.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

MUMBAI -- In a bizarre statement, Gulzar Azmi, the Secretary of Jamiat Ulama on Tuesday said that if everyone wants equality on the basis of gender, then why men and women don't carry pregnancy for four and half months each.

This statement from the cleric came days after Union Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi proposed a Haj Policy that will allow women above 45 to travel in a group of at least four, without a male member.

While talking to ANI, the Jamiat Secretary said, "The decision to allow Muslim women aged above 45 years to go on Haj alone is entirely illegal and is an intervention in Islam. It is clearly stated in Quran that a woman cannot go on Haj alone."

"From the time this government has come to power, they tend to touch upon such issues that make Muslim anxious which makes the people of our religion believe that this government is against Muslims. The promises that were made by Prime Minister Narendra Modi have not been fulfilled yet, so to divert the attention they raise issues against Muslims," Azmi said.

Touting Islam as a religion which respects women the most, Jamiat Secretary said, "I do not understand which religion respects women more than Islam."

Questioning the issue of gender equality, Azmi said, "If we talk about equality then there should be equality even in carrying a child in womb. Then a man should carry the baby for four and half months and the women for rest of the half time. Then only one can say that there is equality. First there should be equality in the birth process then other aspects of equality should be implemented in Islam."

Azmi even warned the government regarding the consequences if they forcefully implement the decision to allow Muslim women aged above 45 years to go on Haj.

"Muslim clerics across the country have announced that the decision is illegal and we will never accept it. If the government forces us to accept this decision, then Muslims will have to hit the streets to protest against the government," he said.

Union government's proposed Haj Policy has been drafted by a committee appointed by the Centre highlights the abolishment subsidies of Haj pilgrims and allowing women above 45 to travel in a group of at least four without a male member. The draft has been submitted by the committee to the Union Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi.
TITLE: Men And Women Should Share Pregnancy For 4.5 Months: Cleric's Bizarre Remarks On Gender Equality

Vielen erschien Emmy Myers in der High School wie die Vorzeige-SchÃ¼lerin schlechthin. Sie turnte, machte Leichtathletik und war in der Landwirtschafts-AG.

Doch ihr Leben nahm eine dunkle Wende - sie wurde drogensÃ¼chtig und Opfer von Sex-Handel.

Heute will die 28-JÃ¤hrige aus Wisconsin andere Menschen darauf aufmerksam machen, dass dieses Schicksal jeden ereilen kann - und dass die Menschen, die Frauen und MÃ¤dchen kaufen, aus jeder sozialen Schicht kommen kÃ¶nnen.

"Das passiert nicht nur in Filmen, sondern auch normalen Menschen im echten Leben", sagte Myers der HuffPost.

"Lacey's Hope Project" macht auf Sex-Handel aufmerksam

Sie hat eine gemeinnÃ¼tzige Aktion Lacey's Hope Project gestartet und spricht offen Ã¼ber ihre Erfahrungen. Der Name der Organisation ist eine Anlehnung an ihren damaligen BÃ¼hnennamen, mit dem sie auftrat, um gegen Geld zu tanzen.

(Foto: Emmy Myers)

Menschenhandel nimmt in den USA stark zu. 2016 stiegen die FÃ¤lle im Vergleich zum Vorjahr laut der National Human Trafficking Hotline um 35,6 Prozent an.

Die Opfer werden gezwungen, kÃ¶rperliche Arbeit zu verrichten oder gegen ihren Willen mit Fremden Sex zu haben.

Armut und Arbeitslosigkeit helfen dem Menschen-Handel

Dass der Menschenhandel ansteigt, hat laut Experten mehrere GrÃ¼nde. Jarrett Luckett, GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼her der Organisation Exploit No More, sieht vor allem Armut und Drogenkonsum als Faktoren an.

Exploit No More unterstÃ¼tzt Menschen, die Opfer von Sex-Handel wurden. Luckett arbeitet gemeinsam mit Myers daran, Ã¼ber Sex-Handel in den StÃ¤dten aufzuklÃ¤ren und auf die Gefahr aufmerksam zu machen.

"Armut und Drogen machen die Opfer anfÃ¤lliger, in die Falle des Sex-Handels zu tappen", sagte Luckett der HuffPost.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: MÃ¤dchen von 1000 MÃ¤nnern vergewaltigt - ihr Schicksal zeigt das tragische AusmaÃŸ des Menschenhandels

Diese beiden Probleme sind daran schuld, dass Myers Geburtsstadt Milwaukee zu einem Knotenpunkt fÃ¼r Menschenhandel geworden ist.

Milwaukee ist ein perfekter Ort fÃ¼r die HÃ¤ndler. Sie kÃ¶nnen ihre Opfer an viele grÃ¶ÃŸere StÃ¤dte in der NÃ¤he transportieren - etwa nach Chicago und Madison. Weit verbreiteter Heroinmissbrauch und die hohe Arbeitslosenrate in Milwaukee helfen den HÃ¤ndlern, ihre Opfer zu kÃ¶dern.

Sex-Handel hat sich in Milwaukee so weit verbreitet, dass die Stadt auch "Harvard der ZuhÃ¤lter" genannt wird.

Jeder kann zum Opfer werden

Myers Geschichte zeigt, dass HÃ¤ndler aber auch Erfolg haben kÃ¶nnen, wenn die Opfer aus einer guten Familie kommen. Sie wuchs als das aufgeweckte, frÃ¶hliche Kind auf, das sich alle Eltern wÃ¼nschen.

In der Zeit zwischen ihrem dritten und sechsten Lebensjahr aber wurde sie von einem Freund der Familie mehrfach missbraucht. Einen GroÃŸteil ihrer Kindheit Ã¼ber machte sie sich VorwÃ¼rfe.

Myers wurde mehrfach verhaftet. Sie hat ein Strafregister, aber keine Einstufung als Schwerverbrecherin. (Foto: Emmy Myers)

Sie glaubte, sie sei selbst daran schuld, dass er sich immer wieder an ihr verging. Die Zweifel seien so stark geworden, dass sie angefangen habe, Drogen zu nehmen, sagt Myers. Und irgendwann sei sie einem manipulativen MenschenhÃ¤ndler in die HÃ¤nde gefallen.

Ihre ersten Erfahrungen mit Drogen habe sie in der High School gemacht, erzÃ¤hlt sie. In ihrem letzten Jahr an der Schule wurde das Geld knapp und sie begann zu strippen, um ihre Sucht zu finanzieren. Nach der High School steig sie auf Heroin um und war zwei Mal in einer Entzugsklinik - das alles geschah, bevor sie 20 Jahre alt war.

Mit 24 versuchte sie erneut, clean zu werden und zog ausgerechnet mit ihrem gewalttÃ¤tigen Drogendealer zusammen. Er wusste von ihrer Situation und bot ihr an, sie unter seine Obhut zu nehmen und sich um sie zu kÃ¼mmern. Er stellte ihr eine Wohnung zur VerfÃ¼gung und versorgte sie mit Kleidung und Essen.

Myers konnte sich nicht wehren

Dass er plante, sie fÃ¼r Sex zu verkaufen, ahnte sie nicht. Er erstellte eine Werbeanzeige auf Backpage.com, einer Seite, die Produkte und Dienstleistungen anbietet. (Dieses Jahr musste die Firma ihren Bereich fÃ¼r Erwachsenen-Werbung schlieÃŸen, da sie wegen UnterstÃ¼tzung von Prostitution und Menschen-Handel unter Verdacht steht.)

"Ich hÃ¤tte niemals gedacht, dass ich mich jemals verkaufen wÃ¼rde", sagt Myers. "Aber als ich an diesem Punkt angelangt war, gab es keine Ausweg mehr", sagt Myers. "ZuhÃ¤lter wissen, was sie tun. Sie geben vor, dich zu lieben. Sie finden heraus, wie du tickst und wovor du am meisten Angst hast."

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: "Gewalt gegen Frauen ist eben unsere Kultur" - ich setzte mich weltweit fÃ¼r Frauenrechte ein, diese Ausrede kann ich nicht mehr hÃ¶ren

Als Myers sich wehrte, drohte ihr der Dealer. Er sagte, wenn sie nicht einwillige, wÃ¼rde er ihre Neffen tÃ¶ten. Er konfiszierte ihren Personalausweis und nahm ihr das wenige Geld, das sie noch hatte.

Ihr ZuhÃ¤lter und seine Freundin brachten Myers zu Hotels in verschiedenen StÃ¤dten. Dort musste sie sich schon um 6.30 Uhr mit MÃ¤nnern treffen, bevor diese zu ihren Meetings gingen. Bis spÃ¤t in die Nacht musste sie mit den Klienten Sex haben. Damit sie sich nicht wehren konnte, verabreichte der Dealer ihr permanent Drogen.

"Es sind hÃ¤ufig die MÃ¤nner, die in ihrem Umfeld anerkannt sind"

GewissermaÃŸen hatte sie "GlÃ¼ck" - keiner der MÃ¤nner, mit denen sie schlafen musste, war ihr gegenÃ¼ber gewalttÃ¤tig. Viele von ihnen waren erfolgreiche GeschÃ¤ftsmÃ¤nner. Viele von ihnen hatten Familie.

"Das Ã¼berrascht viele Menschen am meisten", sagt Myers. "Es sind nicht immer die groÃŸen, fetten, ekligen Typen. Es sind hÃ¤ufig die MÃ¤nner, die in ihrem Umfeld anerkannt sind."

Einen Monat spÃ¤ter wurde Myers in Milwaukee verhaftet - fÃ¼r eine Sache, die nichts mit Sex-Handel oder Prostitution zu tun hatte. Die Anzeige gegen sie machte das FBI auf sie aufmerksam. Die Ermittler boten an, ihr zu helfen und sie aus dieser Situation zu befreien.

2013 musste sie fÃ¼r etwa einen Monat ins GefÃ¤ngnis und ging danach erneut in eine Entziehungsklinik - zum dritten Mal. Nachdem sie wieder drauÃŸen war, fiel sie erneut fÃ¼r kurze Zeit dem Sexhandel zum Opfer.

Heute will die 28-JÃ¤hrige darauf aufmerksam machen, dass jeder Opfer von Sex-Handel werden kann. (Foto: Emmy Myers)

Ein halbes Jahr spÃ¤ter war sie wieder im GefÃ¤ngnis - dieses Mal fÃ¼r sieben Monate. In dieser Zeit durfte sie arbeiten gehen (Anm. d. Red.: In den USA gibt es Integrations-Programme fÃ¼r Insassen. Sie kÃ¶nnen an ihren Arbeitsplatz zurÃ¼ckkehren, werden aber streng Ã¼berwacht. Nach ihrer Schicht mÃ¼ssen sie zurÃ¼ck ins GefÃ¤ngnis.).

Nach dieser Zeit im GefÃ¤ngnis zog Myers fÃ¼r zwei Monate in eine soziale Einrichtung fÃ¼r Gewaltopfer. Mit Hilfe eines Ãœbergangsprogramms fand sie eine eigene Wohnung.

Die AufklÃ¤rung in den groÃŸen StÃ¤dten ist wichtig

Heute hat Myers seit drei Jahren keine Drogen mehr genommen. Sie hat ein Strafregister, ist aber nicht als Schwerverbrecherin eingestuft - zu ihrem groÃŸen GlÃ¼ck.

Viele, die in Amerika Opfer von Sex-Handel geworden sind, haben Prostitutions-VorwÃ¼rfe in ihrem Register stehen - und das, obwohl sie dazu gezwungen wurden.

Sie haben keine MÃ¶glichkeiten, ihre Register lÃ¶schen zu lassen. Das bedeutet: FÃ¼r sie ist es beinahe unmÃ¶glich, eine Arbeit oder eine Wohnung zu finden.

Derzeit arbeitet Myers als Pflegerin in einem Altersheim. ZusÃ¤tzlich engagiert sie sich fÃ¼r ihr gemeinnÃ¼tziges Projekt, mit dem sie FÃ¤lle von Sex-Handel verhindern will.

Sie erzÃ¤hlt ihre Geschichte in Schulen, Kirchen und anderen Gemeindeeinrichtungen. Sie klÃ¤rt Ã„rzte, SchÃ¼ler, Studenten, Eltern und OrdnungsÃ¤mter auf, spricht Ã¼ber die RealitÃ¤t des Sex-Handels und erklÃ¤rt, wie man ein solches Schicksal verhindern kann.

Ã„rzten erklÃ¤rt sie beispielsweise, dass sie auf blaue Flecken an sonderbaren Stellen achten sollen und dass mehrfache Fehlgeburten sie ebenso stutzig machen sollten wie Patienten, die nicht wissen, wie viele Geschlechtspartner sie hatten oder die nicht genau angeben kÃ¶nnen, wo sie wohnen.

Diese AufklÃ¤rung sei entscheidend, um den Sex-Handel aufzuhalten, bestÃ¤tigt Luckett.

"Diese prÃ¤ventive Arbeit ist wichtig, damit andere Menschen nicht in 'dieses Leben' abrutschen - sie sollen nicht auch noch durch diese HÃ¶lle gehen", sagt er. "Es lÃ¤sst sich nicht pauschal sagen, wie ein Menschen-HÃ¤ndler aussieht - oder wie ein Opfer aussieht. Das macht es besonders schwer. Aber es gibt Zeichen, die einen davor warnen."

Dieser Artikel erschien ursprÃ¼nglich in der HuffPost US und ist Teil der Serie "Listen To America". Er wurde von Martina Zink aus dem Englischen Ã¼bersetzt und bearbeitet.

TITLE: Emmy wurde Opfer von Sex-Handel - jetzt will sie andere vor der HÃ¶lle bewahren, die sie erlebte

SUMMARY:
The scientists studied data from children born in Finland between 1991 and 2004 who were diagnosed with ADHD from age seven onwards â€” the age they start school.
Therefore, the oldest children in a school year are born in January, and are seven years and seven months old, and the youngest are born in December, and are six years and seven months old.
Dr. Kapil SayalThe study also found that for children under 10 years old, this association got stronger over time.
Between 2004 and 2011, children born between May and August were 37 per cent more likely to be diagnosed with ADHD than those born between September and December, and 64 per cent more likely than oldest children, born between January and April.
School children raise their hands in a classroom.
TEXT:
Primary school children who are several months to a whole year younger than their same-year classmates are more likely to be diagnosed with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), according to research from the U.K.'s University of Nottingham and the University of Turku in Finland.

The scientists studied data from children born in Finland between 1991 and 2004 who were diagnosed with ADHD from age seven onwards â€” the age they start school. In Finland, school starts in mid-August. Therefore, the oldest children in a school year are born in January, and are seven years and seven months old, and the youngest are born in December, and are six years and seven months old.

Around five per cent of "school-age children" are affected by ADHD worldwide. On average, they are diagnosed around the age of six or seven â€” the age they generally start primary school â€” where the school environment requires them to concentrate, focus their attention and stay calm.

The study found that younger children were more likely to be diagnosed with ADHD than their older peers in the same school year â€” boys by 26 per cent and girls by 31 per cent.

With an age variation of up to 12 months in the same class, teachers and parents may misattribute a child's immaturity. Dr. Kapil Sayal

The study also found that for children under 10 years old, this association got stronger over time. Between 2004 and 2011, children born between May and August were 37 per cent more likely to be diagnosed with ADHD than those born between September and December, and 64 per cent more likely than oldest children, born between January and April.

School children raise their hands in a classroom.

The study's authors suggest that parents, teachers and clinicians involved assessing children for ADHD should bear in mind the child's "relative age" within their school year.

"With an age variation of up to 12 months in the same class, teachers and parents may misattribute a child's immaturity. This might lead to younger children in the class being more likely to be referred for an assessment for ADHD," explains Kapil Sayal, lead author of the study and Professor of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry at the University of Nottingham School of Medicine and the Institute of Mental Health in Nottingham, UK.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: ADHD Is Over-Diagnosed In The Youngest Children In A Class: Study

TEXT:
The Triumphalism Of Corbyn's Conference t's entirely possible the Lib Dems or even UKIP could revive support under new leadership in a snap election, to assume that it would result in an almost automatic victory for Labour is a very dangerous thing indeed, if recent events are anything to go by. Aspiring journalist with a passion for news, current affairs and politics

Lines In The Political Sand So it is that time of year again. The time when political hacks descend on the British seaside to drink too much warm wine and eat soggy sandwiches together. Also known as party conference season. Acting Senior UK Political Adviser at Christian Aid. Previously worked in health policy, UK Parliament & UK civil service.

The Lib Dems' Prospects Are Bleak The Liberal Democrats are still not sure how to feel about the 2017 general election. For many, it is ambiguous whether their increased number of seats constitutes a comeback, or whether their failure to make significant electoral gains exposes the party's long-term problems. Opinion owner.

Did The Old Really 'Shaft' The Young Over Brexit? If young people really do feel 'shafted', they have largely their own age group to blame - while turnout among 18-24s was at a high level (64%), among those aged 65+ it was 25% points higher at a massive 89%. Chairman, ComRes

On The 50th Anniversary Of The Sexual Offences Act 1967, Look How Far We've Come I think today we can all celebrate a more open liberal society, with same-sex couples able to marry and huge steps forward being made for gender recognition, and I further think we Lib Dems have a bit of a right to blow our own trumpet about it. Yes, we are by no means the only party to have furthered LGBT+ rights: but we were, for example, the first party to host a gay rights fringe at party conference. Acting chair of LGBT+ Lib Dems

Given The Choice Between Theresa May And Jeremy Corbyn, Dear Lord Please Just Let It Be Vince Cable At 74, he has proved that age is no barrier to ambition and for this he should be applauded. No matter what profession we're in, we all deserve one last hurrah. You can't help feeling that this is his. Would be multi-millionaire, would be celebrated writer- sadly neither (yet)

Vince Cable Can Carve Out A New Identity For The Liberal Democrats As leader of the Liberal Democrats, Vince Cable has an opportunity to re-brand the party. He will be starting with a clean slate and can carve out distinctive new policies. During the election, I left the Conservatives and joined the Liberal Democrats, but a lot of my friends, and people I talk to, are confused about what the party stands for. former member of the British Army, Parliamentary Candidate, Author, and Entrepreneur

Students Need Urgent Reassurance On The Safety Of Student Halls I call on the Government, Universities and Local Authorities to act on this and reassure students and their families as soon as they can. The Summer should be for relaxation and recuperation, not worry and consternation. Lib Dem MP for Oxford West and Abingdon

Why I'm Urging Ed Davey To Stand As The New Leader Of The Liberal Democrats Despite growing evidence that the environment is not getting better that voice has faded in all our political discussions. We need that voice now from the Liberal Democrats and for me, as a committed environmentalist that would be enough to support Ed Davey. Liberal Democrat Member of the European Parliament for South East England

Norman Lamb Is The Leader The Lib Dems Need He has the sincerity and integrity to appeal to a wider electorate than currently consider voting for the Liberal Democrats. I believe in his ability to offer the country a vision that we've been desperate for, for many years. Liberal Democrat members have a huge opportunity in this contest to elect an honest, caring man as their leader. I hope he stands and I hope they do. Political campaigner for the Liberal Democrats and European Movement UK.

Tim Farron Supports A Disestablished Church Of England - He Was A Monument To Liberalism But it is time to dispel any rumours of Tim Farron's own illegitimacy due to his beliefs. He was a true Liberal, anyone who argues otherwise is merely carrying on the trend of illiberal intolerance. Lib Dem campaigner in Cambridge, bodyman for Susan van de Ven. Toby Ziegler wannabe.

Tim Farron And The Gay Issue So yet another twist in this extraordinary election is the resignation of Lib Dem leader Tim Farron. The blunt truth is that although he got more MPs elected, this was a very poor election for a party that went into the campaign with high hopes of kicking off a bounce-back from the disastrous wipe-out of a few years ago. CEO of the International Fur Trade Federation, former Lib Dem MP

The Lib Dems Need A Fresh Pitch To Young Voters I'm not sure enough people understand what the Liberal Democrats stand for. I want to help the party to develop a new way of thinking and a distinctive identity that allows us to make a strong pitch for the youth vote. former member of the British Army, Parliamentary Candidate, Author, and Entrepreneur

The Election Results Is Much Ado About Nothing For Labour, revel in your success, you have deserved it but be aware of why it tastes so sweet. Exceeding expectations has its own trappings. The fight is only just beginning, and it is only going to get dirtier. Lib Dem campaigner in Cambridge, bodyman for Susan van de Ven. Toby Ziegler wannabe.

DisMayed You will all remember from school science lessons that two minuses make a plus. Not in politics it seems. Westminster based political consultant. Associate Director with JBP.
