"Detroit" est le film le plus inconsÃ©quent et dangereux de lâ€™annÃ©e.

L'Ã©glise est pleine. Un flyer annonce: "DÃ©couvrez une justice Ã©quitable, rendue par des citoyens de la communautÃ©. Examinez le dossier par vous-mÃªme."

PrÃ¨s de 2000 Noirs et quelques Blancs se pressent dans la Central United Church of Christ du rÃ©vÃ©rend Albert Cleage, dans la soirÃ©e du 30 aoÃ»t 1967. Ils viennent participer au procÃ¨s des policiers qui ont tuÃ© trois jeunes gens Ã  l'Algiers Motel. Les policiers n'ont pas Ã©tÃ© inculpÃ©s et les mÃ©dias ont refusÃ© de s'emparer de l'affaire. En rÃ©action, de jeunes radicaux, menÃ©s par Dan Aldridge et Lonnie Peek, organisent un "Tribunal du peuple". H. Rap Brown, prÃ©sident du Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, en a suggÃ©rÃ© l'idÃ©e "dans le but de rÃ©vÃ©ler les faits et de faire la lumiÃ¨re sur ce qui s'est rÃ©ellement passÃ©".

Le procÃ¨s se dÃ©roule sous l'effigie d'une vierge noire de plus de cinq mÃ¨tres de haut, peinte par Glanton Dowdell, un artiste local. Elle Ã©tait auparavant installÃ©e sur le fronton de l'Ã©glise "afin de pouvoir imaginer que le fils de Dieu puisse avoir eu une mÃ¨re noire".

L'assemblÃ©e rÃ©unie entend l'affaire des trois policiers blancs, Ronald August, Robert Paille et David Sendak, et d'un agent de sÃ©curitÃ© noir, Melvin Dismukes, accusÃ©s d'avoir, selon les tÃ©moins, "exÃ©cutÃ©" trois jeunes Noirs, Carl Cooper (17 ans), Aubrey Pollard (19 ans) et Fred Temple (18 ans) Ã  Manor House, annexe de l'Algiers Motel, Ã  l'aube du 26 juillet, au quatriÃ¨me jour de l'Ã©meute raciale qui a secouÃ© la ville.

L'avocat Milton R. Henry joue le rÃ´le du procureur, Solomon A. Plapkin, celui d'un avocat blanc, et Russell L. Brown Jr., membre de la Central Church, l'avocat de la dÃ©fense. Par crainte d'intimidation et de reprÃ©sailles policiÃ¨res, les tÃ©moins n'interviendront qu'Ã  la derniÃ¨re minute. Kenneth V. Cockrel Sr., diplÃ´mÃ© en droit de l'universitÃ© de Wayne et futur fondateur de la Ligue des travailleurs noirs rÃ©volutionnaires, est le juge (l'association du barreau de Detroit envisagera d'exclure les avocats ayant participÃ© Ã  ce procÃ¨s.)

Les tÃ©moins rappellent les faits de maniÃ¨re trÃ¨s graphique. Rosa Parks, l'Ã©crivain afro-amÃ©ricain John O. Killens et le libraire Edward Vaughn font partie du jury. Des journalistes franÃ§ais et suÃ©dois couvrent l'Ã©vÃ©nement (leur confrÃ¨res de Detroit y assistent, mais ne seront pas autorisÃ©s Ã  publier des articles sur le sujet). Le jury reconnaÃ®t les accusÃ©s coupables de meurtre. La sentence est accueillie par une explosion de "joie (...) car la vÃ©ritÃ© avait enfin Ã©clatÃ©", se souviendra Dan Aldridge.

"Dans le 'Detroit' de Kathryn Bigelow et Mark Boal, l'activisme noir n'existe pas avant ces Ã©meutes."

Visuellement fort et impressionnant, le Tribunal du peuple a l'envergure d'un grand scÃ©nario. Pourtant, il est complÃ¨tement passÃ© sous silence dans Detroit, qui sort le 11 octobre en France. Ã‰crit par Mark Boal, ce film de Kathryn Bigelow revient sur les meurtres de l'Algiers Motel pendant les Ã©meutes raciales de 1967. Si le corps des Noirs y joue un rÃ´le clÃ©, on ne peut en dire autant des rÃ©cits et de l'histoire des Noirs de Detroit. Pourtant encensÃ© pour son "travail de documentation", le film dÃ©forme et brouille l'histoire du Detroit des annÃ©es 1960, les Ã©vÃ©nements de l'Algiers Motel et la vie quotidienne de la population noire en gÃ©nÃ©ral.

Dans le Detroit de Kathryn Bigelow et Mark Boal, l'activisme noir n'existe pas avant ces Ã©meutes. En rÃ©alitÃ©, un mouvement des droits civiques est Ã  l'Å“uvre depuis longtemps, notamment sur le terrain de la sÃ©grÃ©gation rÃ©sidentielle et scolaire, de la discrimination Ã  l'embauche et des violences policiÃ¨res. Quatre ans plus tÃ´t, le 23 juin 1963, prÃ¨s de 200.000 Noirs ont dÃ©filÃ© Ã  travers la ville pour protester contre les inÃ©galitÃ©s et clamer qu'ils ne les tolÃ©reraient plus. Treize jours plus tard, un policier tuait Cynthia Scott d'une balle dans le ventre et deux balles dans le dos. Il n'a pas Ã©tÃ© inculpÃ©. De jeunes militants ont manifestÃ© en masse contre les violences policiÃ¨res.

On voit beaucoup de Noirs dans le film, mais la communautÃ© noire est absente. Ã€ l'exception de la sÃ©quence oÃ¹ le groupe vocal "The Dramatics" attend de monter sur scÃ¨ne, on ne voit pas les gens s'amuser ou passer du temps en famille, ou aucun moment de leur vie quotidienne. Les premiÃ¨res images du film se dÃ©roulent dans un bar de nuit clandestin sans vraiment planter le dÃ©cor. Cette nuit-lÃ , des gens sont rÃ©unis pour cÃ©lÃ©brer le retour de deux vÃ©tÃ©rans du Vietnam, mais la joie et le sens de la fÃªte sont occultÃ©s.

Pour Kathryn Bigelow et Mark Boal, la vie politique des Noirs semble n'avoir qu'une importance toute relative. Ce qu'il importe de montrer, et de banaliser, c'est leur mort.

Lorsque la police investit le bar, Ã  quatre heures du matin, les clients rÃ©sistent et refusent de se soumettre Ã  l'ordre de dispersion. C'est un acte politique. Ã€ l'Ã©poque, les Noirs sont exclus de la plupart des restaurants et lieux de divertissements de Detroit et les entrepreneurs noirs ont du mal Ã  trouver les capitaux et obtenir les permis nÃ©cessaires pour ouvrir un Ã©tablissement. Les Noirs de la classe ouvriÃ¨re frÃ©quentent donc beaucoup ces lieux clandestins.

Ã€ l'instar de cette scÃ¨ne d'ouverture, Mark Boal n'a pas rÃ©ussi Ã  dÃ©velopper une intrigue cohÃ©rente ni Ã  replacer l'histoire dans son contexte, en particulier pour les personnages centraux que sont Carl Cooper, Aubrey Pollard, Fred Temple et Melvin Dismukes. Nous ne saurons rien de leur vie de famille ou d'Ã©tudiants, leur femme, leur partenaire, leurs collÃ¨gues ou leur communautÃ©. DÃ©pouillÃ©s de leur humanitÃ©, les Noirs de Detroit n'ont aucune capacitÃ© d'agir.

Mars Films

Le drame de l'Algiers Motel est totalement dÃ©connectÃ© d'un contexte politique plus gÃ©nÃ©ral favorisant de tels actes. Les trois policiers sont montrÃ©s comme des brebis galeuses. Nulle Ã©vocation des services de police et du reste de la sociÃ©tÃ© permettant et cautionnant ce qui s'est passÃ©. Au contraire, la plupart de ses collÃ¨gues rÃ©primandent Philip Krauss, le flic raciste, ou cherchent Ã  l'Ã©viter. Frank Schemanske, le juge qui a rejetÃ© l'accusation initiale d'association de malfaiteurs contre les policiers, n'est mÃªme pas Ã©voquÃ©.

Ã‰lu du Michigan Ã  la Chambre des reprÃ©sentants, John Conyers dÃ©crira les Ã©vÃ©nements de 1967 Ã  Detroit comme une "Ã©meute policiÃ¨re". Mais puisque Kathryn Bigelow et Mark Boal se cantonnent Ã  la version de la brebis galeuse, leur histoire n'aborde pas non plus cet aspect des Ã©vÃ©nements. La police a procÃ©dÃ© Ã  des milliers d'arrestations, la plupart sans fondement. Au printemps 1968, la moitiÃ© des 3200 personnes accusÃ©es de pillage seront jugÃ©es. Soixante pour cent seront relaxÃ©es et seulement deux condamnÃ©es pour les faits ayant motivÃ© leur mise en examen. MÃªme si les commissariats et les prisons, trÃ¨s prÃ©sents dans le film, dÃ©bordent de Noirs, rien ne laisse prÃ©sager qu'il s'agit d'arrestations arbitraires. L'unique librairie noire de Detroit, Vaughn's Bookstore, qui accueillait nombre de rÃ©unions militantes, a Ã©tÃ© incendiÃ©e par la police, qui a ensuite laissÃ© l'eau couler et ainsi dÃ©truit la quasi-totalitÃ© des livres. Cette attaque visant un espace de la communautÃ© noire n'est jamais mentionnÃ©e dans le film.

Le Tribunal du peuple Ã©tant absent du film, on ne comprend pas les raisons du procÃ¨s qui a lieu deux ans plus tard, incarnÃ© essentiellement par un affrontement entre avocats blancs. Le film donne l'impression qu'il arrive tout naturellement, au lieu de montrer comment les Noirs de Detroit ont voulu empÃªcher que cet incident soit jetÃ© aux oubliettes.

Ce qu'offre Kathryn Bigelow aux spectateurs, c'est un lynchage public. Nous sommes envahis par un fÃ©tichisme pour la violence exercÃ©e sur des corps noirs.

Etant donnÃ© le travail de documentation supposÃ© des scÃ©naristes, ces omissions majeures ne peuvent qu'Ãªtre volontaires. L'arrogance du titre â€“marketing oblige selon Kathryn Bigelowâ€“ rÃ©vÃ¨le que ses auteurs n'ont aucun scrupule Ã  exploiter l'image de la ville et de la communautÃ© noire. Pour Kathryn Bigelow et Mark Boal, la vie politique des Noirs semble n'avoir qu'une importance toute relative. Ce qu'il importe de montrer, et de banaliser, c'est leur mort. Quarante minutes sont consacrÃ©es aux tourments infligÃ©s Ã  ces jeunes hommes, dans des scÃ¨nes qui s'Ã©tirent jusqu'Ã  la nausÃ©e. Ce qu'offrent Kathryn Bigelow et Mark Boal aux spectateurs, c'est un lynchage public. Envahis par un fÃ©tichisme pour la violence exercÃ©e sur des corps noirs, on a l'impression d'assister Ã  des scÃ¨nes de guerre oÃ¹ des hommes sont mutilÃ©s, battus, rÃ©ifiÃ©s. Cette insistance sur la violence et cette fascination pour les corps d'hommes noirs rappellent Ã©trangement le film "Naissance d'une nation" de D.W. Griffith, sorti en 1915, dans lequel les stÃ©rÃ©otypes raciaux abondent. Les Noirs ne sont que des stÃ©rÃ©otypes: Ã©meutiers en colÃ¨re, victimes sanglantes ou familles Ã©plorÃ©es. La communautÃ©, le travail, le bonheur, ou mÃªme une intrigue secondaire n'y trouvent que peu de place. Les implications dans la vie rÃ©elle d'un film comme celui-ci sont aussi dÃ©sespÃ©rantes que les corps assassinÃ©s par la police qui s'affichent au quotidien. Quand bien mÃªme, il rÃ©ussit Ã  transformer cette histoire en spectacle.

Le film n'est pas simplement bÃ¢clÃ©, mais vÃ©ritablement dangereux, car c'est justement ce dÃ©ni de vie, ce refus d'aborder les expÃ©riences et les perspectives de la population noire qui permettent au comportement brutal, Ã  la discrimination raciale et Ã  l'impunitÃ© des forces de police d'Ãªtre si rÃ©pandus, aujourd'hui encore, aux Ã‰tats-Unis.

Si vous voulez voir un film qui s'intÃ©resse vraiment aux questions des violences policiÃ¨res envers la population noire ou Ã  la vÃ©ritable histoire de Detroit, n'allez pas voir celui-lÃ .

Ce blog, publiÃ© Ã  l'origine sur le HuffPost amÃ©ricain et HuffPost France, a Ã©tÃ© traduit par Sandrine Merle pour Fast For Word.

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTMalayalam filmmaker Sanal Kumar Sasidharan's contentious film 'Sexy Durga' has finally been cleared by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC), or, as it is more popularly known as, the Censor board.
The movie will now be released in theatres with a U/A certificate as S Durga with 21 audio mutes, but will retain its original title and audible abusive words when it is eventually screened online, reported Scroll.in.
""Sexy Durga" will be released in Indian Cinemas as "S Durga".
Bakths are specially requested to not imagine it as "Sexy" as they will be cursed by Durga.
S Durga, starring Rajshri Deshpande and Kannan Nayar, is the first Indian film in 23 years to win the Tiger Award at the International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR), where it premiered.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Malayalam filmmaker Sanal Kumar Sasidharan's contentious film 'Sexy Durga' has finally been cleared by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC), or, as it is more popularly known as, the Censor board. But not before the maker agreed to drop 'Sexy' from the title and mute 21 cuss words and sanitise the film and make sure it doesn't hurt the fragile sentiments of India's gatekeepers of culture.

The movie will now be released in theatres with a U/A certificate as S Durga with 21 audio mutes, but will retain its original title and audible abusive words when it is eventually screened online, reported Scroll.in.

The movie became a point of contention last month when it was refused censor exemption for screening at the Mumbai Film Festival because the Information and Broadcasting (I&B) Ministry felt that it may "affect the law and order as it hurts the religious sentiments," claimed Sasidharan. Without the exemption, the film would not have been eligible to be shown without censorship at the festival.

Upset and angry by this institutionalised attempt to muzzle the creativity of artists, the filmmaker had criticised the decision, saying India is "a land that's becoming like Iran".

Sasidharan may have agreed to change the film's title and mute the words to ensure that the movie gets screened, his words make it amply clear what he really thinks about the CBFC-mandated cuts.

""Sexy Durga" will be released in Indian Cinemas as "S Durga". S is a letter open for your imaginations. Bakths are specially requested to not imagine it as "Sexy" as they will be cursed by Durga. Be nice and come and watch the film," he wrote in a Facebook post.

According to the filmmaker, the reason for naming the film 'Sexy Durga' was not to hurt religious sentiments or defame the Hindu goddess, but to point out the irony that on the one hand our society worships goddesses and on the other, we treat women around us so poorly.

"Now when I see the name, I feel really crazy because it is a representation of typical mindset," news agency IANS quoted Sasidharan as saying. About the abusive words that he's been made to mute, he says, "It is just insignificant words. It was only to show that the characters are raw. The mutes are beeped so people will understand the words are something bad. That's more effective."

S Durga, starring Rajshri Deshpande and Kannan Nayar, is the first Indian film in 23 years to win the Tiger Award at the International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR), where it premiered.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: CBFC Certifies â€˜Sexy Durgaâ€™, But Asks For The S-word To Be Dropped From The Title

Esta es la selecciÃ³n del HuffPost Reino Unido, en la que se incluyen aquel gato que no hablaba y un viento que no dejaba de soplar.

Una madre que pasÃ³ un dÃ­a muy estresante con su hijo decidiÃ³ buscar consuelo en otros padres para sentir que no estaba sola. Y, obviamente, no lo estaba; a ella se le uniÃ³ una legiÃ³n de padres que compartieron los motivos mÃ¡s graciosos por los que a sus hijos les ha entrado una rabieta.

Lisa5201 via Getty Images

"Siempre me sorprende cuÃ¡nta ira tienen esas personitas tan pequeÃ±as. La hija de una amiga una vez tuvo una rabieta porque el perro la miraba".

"Cuando se enterÃ³ de que Ã­bamos a llevarlo a un restaurante, mi hijo se puso a llorar y dijo que odiaba ese sitio. AsÃ­ que le dijimos: 'Vale, pues no vamos'. Entonces tuvo una crisis que le durÃ³ una hora porque querÃ­a ir y le encantaba el restaurante".

"Mi hijo, de tres aÃ±os, una vez tuvo una pataleta de una hora porque la salchicha no dejaba de salirse del bocadillo".

Andria Patino via Getty Images

6. Porque hice la comida.

"A mi hija hoy le ha entrado una llorera porque le he hecho la comida. Se ha puesto a gritar: 'Comer no, comer no' al mismo tiempo que se metÃ­a la comida en la boca".

7. Porque el gato no le dijo hola.

"El gato no le devolviÃ³ el saludo cuando mi hijo le dijo hola. Y tuvo un berrinche de 10 minutos".

8. Porque querÃ­a hacer caca de pie.

"Mi hijo se puso a llorar desconsolado cuando le expliquÃ© que no podÃ­a poner el culo 'de frente' por mÃ¡s que se empeÃ±ara en hacer caca de pie".

9. Porque pensÃ³ que le habÃ­a robado el pito a su hermana.

"Mi hijo se pasÃ³ 30 minutos llorando cuando me vio cambiÃ¡ndole el paÃ±al a su nueva hermanita. 'Â¿Por quÃ© quÃ© le quitas el pito?', me preguntÃ³. Ã‰l creÃ­a seriamente que se lo habÃ­a robado y cuando le dije que su hermana nunca habÃ­a tenido pito se puso a llorar con mÃ¡s ganas. TodavÃ­a me sigue diciendo: 'Vale, puedes quitarme los calzoncillos, pero dÃ©jame el pito".

10. Porque el viento no dejaba de soplar.

"Cuando mi hija era mÃ¡s pequeÃ±a le dio un berrinche en mitad de la calle y se tirÃ³ al suelo. Â¿Por quÃ©? Porque yo no fui capaz de parar el viento".
TITLE: 10 motivos (peregrinos) por los que los niÃ±os tienen berrinches

TEXT:
Das "Venedig des Nordens" hat mehr zu bieten als eine groÃŸe Werft und Millionen von KrÃ¤utertÃ¶pfen

Emsflorenz. Der kleine Aufkleber am Bahnhof von Papenburg sagt viel aus. Denn es ist die Ems mit ihren KanÃ¤len, die das Leben in der beschaulichen Stadt bestimmt. HÃ¼bsch ist es hier, die Grenze zu Holland ist nur ein paar Kilometer entfernt und die bekannte Meyer Werft baut ganz in der NÃ¤he die berÃ¼hmtesten Kreuzfahrtschiffe der Welt. Klar, der Name des Schiffsbauers ist vielen bekannt, nicht aber die Stadt selbst. Denn sie gehÃ¶rt eben nicht in die GrÃ¶ÃŸenordnung von Touristenmagneten wie Hamburg, DÃ¼sseldorf oder MÃ¼nster. Papenburg ist die versteckte SchÃ¶nheit unter den Reisezielen. Umso mehr lohnt es sich, das â€Venedig des Nordens" zu entdecken.



"Den ersten sien Dod, den Twedden sien Not, den Dridden sien Brot!" Ludger Stukenbrock mit einem StÃ¼ck Torf.

Ludger Stukenbrock ist geborener Papenburger. Durch und durch. Meist trifft man ihn in der Von-Velen-Anlage. Hier taucht er ein in die Vergangenheit und nimmt die GÃ¤ste mit. Er erzÃ¤hlt von den ersten Siedlern und auch von der einen oder anderen Moorleiche. Denn hier gibt es noch die Untiefen, das Moor, das einst erschlossen wurde, um auf den abgetorften FlÃ¤chen Landwirtschaft zu betreiben.

Ab Mitte des 17. Jahrhunderts gruben die Bewohner ausgehend vom Fluss KanÃ¤le von insgesamt 43 Kilometern LÃ¤nge. Neben der EntwÃ¤sserung des Moores dienten diese gleichzeitig als WasserstraÃŸen. Mit einfachen Plattbodenschiffen transportierte die frÃ¼here BevÃ¶lkerung den abgebauten Torf zu den ostfriesischen Ziegeleien und spÃ¤ter nach Emden, Bremen und Hamburg. Auch der Weg zur Nordsee wurde dadurch frei.

Die Von-Velen-Anlage mit dem PapenbÃ¶rger Hus.

Papenburg - das ehemalige Armenhaus

Die ersten Siedler lebten in erbÃ¤rmlichen auf dem Hochmoor erbauten fensterlosen HÃ¼tten aus BirkenstÃ¤mmen, Reisig und Heideplaggen. In der Mitte dieser Katen befanden sich die Kochstellen. Mensch und Vieh teilten sich den kargen Wohnraum. Erst viel spÃ¤ter gab es einen bescheidenen Wohlstand, der zweifellos den ersten Siedlern zu verdanken ist. Gegen Ende des 18. Jahrhunderts fanden viele Papenburger Arbeit im Schiffbau. Zur BlÃ¼tezeit des Werftwesens gab es 23 Werftanlagen. Auf einer lÃ¤ngs des Kanals errichteten Helling wurde das Schiff auf Kiel gelegt und konnte dadurch ins Wasser gleiten.

Abgebaute Torf-Briketts.

Stukenbrock deutet auf einen Sumpf, der abgetrennt und gesichert ist. "Wer hier reinfÃ¤llt, kommt nicht mehr raus", betont er. Und dann erzÃ¤hlt er von dem Jungen, der 1939 im Moor gefunden wurde. Sein Skelett wies eine HÃ¼ftdeformation auf. Nachforschungen ergaben, dass das Kind im 11. Jahrhundert lebte und stark gehbehindert war. "Man hat den Jungen wohl umgebracht und im Moor verschwinden lassen", mutmaÃŸt Stukenbrock. "Damals, zu Zeiten groÃŸer Not, konnte er nicht zum Ãœberleben der Familie beitragen und man entledigte sich ihm." Es gibt einige Menschen, die im Moor einfach verschwanden und nie wieder aufgetaucht sind.

Das GeschÃ¤ft mit der Frische.

Landwirtschaft und Gartenbau stehen in der norddeutschen Stadt heute mit an vorderster Stelle. Die Gartenbauzentrale Papenburg steht fÃ¼r das GeschÃ¤ft mit der Frische. Anfang der 1970er Jahre begann sie mit dem Anbau von Topfblumen, spÃ¤ter, zu Beginn der 1980er Jahre mit TopfkrÃ¤utern. Salbei, Rosmarin, BleifuÃŸ, Minze und viele mehr. Allein 80 Millionen TopfkrÃ¤uter werden von hier aus jÃ¤hrlich auf den Markt gebracht. Die Genossenschaft arbeitet mit selbstÃ¤ndigen GÃ¤rtnern zusammen und fÃ¶rdert somit den Wohlstand der Region.



Papenburg - ein charmantes StÃ¤dtchen.

Auf der Meyer Werft werden regelmÃ¤ÃŸig FÃ¼hrungen veranstaltet. Und die GÃ¤ste kÃ¶nnen den spÃ¤teren Luxus erahnen, der die halbfertigen Ozeanriesen schon beim Bau umgibt. Hier sieht man ihre Gerippe und beobachtet Hunderte von Arbeitern, die einer neuen AIDA Form geben oder dem Disney-Kreuzfahrtschiff den letzten Anstrich verpassen. Es ist eine Welt der Superlative. Es lohnt sich, sie zu entdecken. Dabei zu sein, hautnah. Sich eine Reise Ã¼ber die Ozeane unserer Welt vorstellen. Einfach so. TrÃ¤ume werden hier wahr, nicht nur fÃ¼r die leidenschaftlichen Kreuzfahrt-Fans.



Die HollÃ¤nder Astrid van der Wel und Kees van Veen mit ihren Hunden TrÃ¼ffel und Hazel kommen gerne zum Einkaufen nach Papenburg.

"BoÃŸeln" - Was ist denn das?

Am frÃ¼hen Abend trifft man sich zum BoÃŸeln. Nur Insider wissen, um was es da genau geht. â€Ran an die Kugel und den Kopf einziehen!", lautet das Motto. Und nach der AusÃ¼bung des hiesigen Volkssports geht es zum GrÃ¼nkohlessen. Das muss sein. Denn Papenburg ist diesbezÃ¼glich nicht nur eigenwillig sondern auch lukullisch ein Genuss.

Das charmante StÃ¤dtchen an der Ems hat viel zu bieten, nicht nur fÃ¼r Insider. Auch im Nachbarland weiÃŸ man Papenburg als Einkaufsziel zu schÃ¤tzen. Wie das hollÃ¤ndische Paar Astrid van der Wel und Kees van Veen, die Latte Macchiato und Kuchen in einem CafÃ© am Kanal genieÃŸen. "Gutes deutsches MÃ¼hlenbrot kaufen und leckere TortenstÃ¼cke essen", lacht die 61-JÃ¤hrige. Kees van Veen, ein ehemaliger Koch, schÃ¤tzt die Auswahl an KÃ¼chenutensilien in dem nahen Laden. "Hier werde ich oft fÃ¼ndig", sagt der 68-JÃ¤hrige. Neben Torten, KochlÃ¶ffel, eine groÃŸe Werft und Millionen an KrÃ¤utertÃ¶pfen hat Emsflorenz noch viel mehr zu bieten. Einen kurzen oder langen Abstecher ist das StÃ¤dtchen allemal wert.

TEXT:
"Ich mÃ¶chte durch mein Leben tanzen": Bernd Althusmann im Video zu seinem Wahlkampfsong "Was GroÃŸes" | Screenshot

Am Sonntag wird in Niedersachsen gewÃ¤hlt

CDU-Spitzenkandidat Peter Althusmann will den SPD-MinisterprÃ¤sidenten Stephan Weil schlagen

Um nahbar zu wirken, hat er nun der "Bunte" ein Interview gegeben - ein Fehler, der schon mal einen Politiker eine Wahl gekostet hat

Bernd Althusmann tanzt, er wippt, er schnippt mit den Fingern. Gezwungen wirkt das, richtiggehend unangenehm sogar.

Es ist Althusmanns persÃ¶nlicher Wahlsong, zu dem er da rhythmisch die HÃ¼fte anwinkelt: "Wir haben was GroÃŸes vor". Die CDU Niedersachsen hat dazu ein Video auf Youtube hochgeladen, voller nichtsaussagender Hochglanzaufnahmen von lachenden Menschen und Textzeilen wie: "Wir mÃ¼ssen den Weg gehen, wir mÃ¼ssen es wagen."

Zu Politikstil und Inhalten von Bernd Althusmann liefert das Video keine Erkenntnisse. Doch dem CDU-Politiker scheint es eh mehr um das Tanzen zu gehen. Diesen Eindruck vermittelt Althusmann zumindest in einem aktuellen Interview mit der Illustrieren "Bunte".

Darin offenbart er intime und private Momente aus seinem Familienleben. Politikinteressierten sollte das wie ein DÃ©ja-Vu vorkommen.

Althusmann: "Ich mÃ¶chte durch mein Leben tanzen"

So berichtet der CDU-Spitzenkandidat etwa, wie er sich nach Ã¶ffentlichen Terminen gerne entspannt.

NatÃ¼rlich zuhause mit seiner Frau - aber nicht einfach so. "Manchmal fangen wir auch an, im Wohnzimmer zu tanzen â€“ nur wir zwei", sagt Althusmann. "Ihr Lebensmotto lautet: Ich mÃ¶chte durch mein Leben tanzen. Das ist auch meines geworden."

Deswegen tanze er auch in seinem Wahlkampfvideo, sagt Althusmann zu "Bunte": "Leichtigkeit und gute Laune tun gut." Wie sein Tanzen seinem Bundesland Niedersachsen konkret helfen soll, lÃ¤sst Althusmann offen.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: TV-Duell in Niedersachsen: SPD-Mann Weil gerÃ¤t bei einer entscheidenden Frage ins Schwimmen

DafÃ¼r erzÃ¤hlt er von seinem Spitznamen "Panzer", einer Schlange, die am Elektrozaun seines Hauses in Namibia "verkohlt" sei. Und von seiner Familie.

Althusmann ist zum zweiten Mal verheiratet, insgesamt hat er fÃ¼nf Kinder - drei leibliche und zwei Stiefkinder, erfÃ¤hrt der "Bunte"-Leser. Durchaus kritisch sehe der CDU-Kandidat dieses Patchwork-Leben, schreibt die Illustrierte. "Zwei Familien zu haben ist auf jeden Fall verdammt anstrengend", klagt Althusmann.

Und imitiert damit einen Fehltritt, der in Schleswig-Holstein dem SPD-Spitzenkandidaten Torsten Albig die Chance auf das Amt des MinisterprÃ¤sidenten kostete.

Althusmann: "Es kann plÃ¶tzlich zu Ende sein"

Auch Albig hatte der "Bunte" ein Interview gegeben, auch er hatte Ã¼ber sein Familienleben gesprochen - und auch er hatte sich Ã¼ber seine geschiedene Ehe ausgelassen. Seine Frau sei nicht mehr mit ihm auf AugenhÃ¶he gewesen, hatte Albig der "Bunte" berichtet. Es sei stets unterwegs gewesen, wÃ¤hrend sie als Mutter im Haushalt gearbeitet habe.

Albig erntete fÃ¼r diese Aussagen heftige Kritik, kurz darauf verlor er die Landtagswahl. Althusmann riskiert mit seinem "Bunte"-Interview einen Ã¤hnlichen Gang der Ereignisse.

Doch der CDU-Politiker wurde darauf offensichtlich gut vorbereitet.

Immer wieder betont er im Interview, welchen Respekt er vor seine Ex-Frau hÃ¤tte - Ã¼berhaupt vor Frauen, die als MÃ¼tter und Hausfrauen wichtige Dienste fÃ¼r die Gesellschaft leisten wÃ¼rden. An einer Stelle sagt Althusmann wie in Reaktion auf Albigs Aussage Ã¼ber seine erste Ehe: "Der Respekt ging nie verloren, sie war immer auf AugenhÃ¶he mit mir."

Dennoch: Mit seinem "Bunte"-Interview hat sich der CDU-Spitzenkandidat wohl keinen Gefallen getan.

In Niedersachsen liegt er derzeit in den Umfragen knapp hinter seinem Konkurrenten Weil. Kleinigkeiten werden also Ã¼ber die Wahl entscheiden - auch der Eindruck eines hÃ¼ftsteif durch sein Wohnzimmer tanzenden MinisterprÃ¤sidenten kann WÃ¤hler vergraulen.

Althusmann gibt sich in der "Bunte" jedoch gelassen: "Wer in die Politik geht, muss wissen, dass es plÃ¶tzlich zu Ende sein kann." Immerhin: Zum Tanzen wÃ¤re dann wieder mehr Zeit.

(lp)
TITLE: Niedersachsens CDU-Kandidat Althusmann hat der "Bunte" ein Interview gegeben - es ist vollkommen absurd

SUMMARY:
OTTAWA â€” The federal Conservative candidate vying for Rona Ambrose's former seat once tried to recruit enough members to incorporate a Canadian chapter of the National Rifle Association.
Use of ' Feminazi' raises eyebrowsThe Conservative candidate made headlines recently for another Facebook comment he made in 2009 in response to the University of Guelph's decision to shutter its women studies program.
Sturgeon River-Parkland Conservative candidate stands next to a campaign sign.

"I said Dane has big shoes to fill, they're not actually big shoes, they're metaphorically big shoes.
TEXT:
OTTAWA â€” The federal Conservative candidate vying for Rona Ambrose's former seat once tried to recruit enough members to incorporate a Canadian chapter of the National Rifle Association.

Dane Lloyd, who is a 26-year-old candidate running in the Sturgeon River-Parkland byelection, started a Libertarianism-inspired Facebook group in 2009 with the intention to turn it into a "big movement."

"Libertarianism and the right to bear arms are synonymous since the freedoms of Libertarianism are guaranteed by a well armed citizenry," the then-18-year-old wrote.

Screengrab of a post from 2009.

In a statement to HuffPost Canada on Wednesday, Lloyd commented on the post and said his stance on firearms has since changed:

That statement does not reflect my current view and policy on firearm ownership in Canada. My policy on firearms is a commitment to cost-effective gun control programs designed to keep guns out of the hands of criminals while respecting the rights of law-abiding Canadians to own and use firearms responsibly, and includes measures like safe storage provisions, firearms safety training, and mandatory minimums for criminal use of firearms.

Lloyd, who self-describes his political views as "very Conservative," beat out former party leadership contender Rick Peterson, local party organizer Jamie Mozeson, and ex-political staffer Luke Inberg for the Tory nomination.

Ambrose, the party's former interim leader, had endorsed Mozeson.

Past support for memorializing Confederate figure

In 2015, two years after Lloyd graduated from Trinity Western University, he shared his thoughts on a Russia Today story suggesting that he no qualms about memorializing the legacy of the U.S. Confederacy, as old social media posts suggest.

The story reported on Baltimore officials mulling a plan to remove Confederate general Robert E. Lee's name from a city park.

"This would be a real shame to see go through," the post on an account associated with Lloyd's name reads. He said the former Confederate general's "actions at the end of the war did much to heal and unite a deeply divided nation."

Baltimore eventually introduced legislation to rename the city park to Lake Roland.

The timing of the post preceded renewed public pressure to rename monuments linked to U.S. Confederate figures after a white nationalist rally in Charlottesville, Va. this summer.

In another post, this time from 2014, Lloyd shared a link to a fundraising campaign by The Rebel to fight "anti-Christian bigots on Nanaimo city council."

"It just goes to show that when people actually stand up to intolerant anti-Christian rhetoric, common sense and justice will prevail," reads the post.

The Vancouver Island municipality stirred some controversy at the time for pulling a permit for the Leadership telecast, a so-called Christian conference, days before the event. One city councillor had an issue with the event sponsor's link to anti-gay views and "support of the traditional family."

Reaction to the event's cancellation was mixed: former NDP MP Jean Crowder and the Vancouver Island Rainbow Association praised council's decision, while right-wing pundit Ezra Levant blasted it, and one letter to the editor called it "over-the-top panic."

Lloyd did not respond to a request for comment for the views he expressed in these two posts.

Use of ' Feminazi' raises eyebrows

The Conservative candidate made headlines recently for another Facebook comment he made in 2009 in response to the University of Guelph's decision to shutter its women studies program.

"I'll probably get assassinated by the Feminazi's for saying that cutting this program is a good thing, saves a lot of wasted money on a useless program," he wrote. "Way to go Guelph way to be politically incorrect."

Sturgeon River-Parkland Conservative candidate stands next to a campaign sign.

Lloyd explained himself to CTV News last week, saying: "Sometimes you get in to emotionally charged debates and you say things that you regret and I would say that would not be a term I would use today."

He told the broadcaster he didn't think an old social media post would affect his campaign.

Despite Lloyd being a new public figure, he has earned some political experience working under former cabinet ministers Ed Fast and Jason Kenney.

He is also a Canadian Armed Forces reservist and most recently worked as a political staffer for St. Albertâ€”Edmonton MP Michael Cooper.

Scheer jokes about metaphorical shoes

Conservative Leader Andrew Scheer joined Lloyd at an event in Stony Plain, Alta. on Tuesday to kick off his campaign.

Lloyd addressed a crowd of supporters by drawing parallels between himself and the Tory leader, noting how both men are "strong Conservatives." â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

"He's got big shoes to fill coming in after Rona Ambrose, she was a great member of Parliament," Scheer said.

After the crowd applauded his tribute to his predecessor, Scheer joked with supporters. "I said Dane has big shoes to fill, they're not actually big shoes, they're metaphorically big shoes. I think he probably wears a few sizes bigger than Rona did."

Sturgeon River-Parkland voters will head to the polls on Oct. 23.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Dane Lloyd, Federal Tory Candidate, Once Tried To Start A Canadian NRA 'Movement'

TEXT:
Bloomberg via Getty Images

La commissione bicamerale d'inchiesta sulle banche inizierÃ  il suo lavoro dal dossier piÃ¹ recente, cioÃ¨ quello della Popolare di Vicenza e di Veneto Banca. Le indagini seguiranno "il criterio dell'attualitÃ " e in virtÃ¹ di ciÃ² "appare ragionevole partire dalle audizioni sugli interventi piÃ¹ vicini che i governi pro-tempore hanno posto in essere per poi risalire a ritroso a quelli piÃ¹ lontani", si legge nella relazione del presidente della commissione, Pier Ferdinando Casini.

Un focus sarÃ  dedicato al tema degli stipendi dei manager. La tematica - prevista tra le quattro principali dalla legge istitutiva della commissione "andrÃ  trattata separatamente" perchÃ© "acquista particolare rilievo alla luce del fatto che a volte gli standard stipendiali in questione non sono risultati in linea con la situazione di difficoltÃ  delle singole banche", si legge sempre nella relazione.

L'ufficio di presidenza, allargato anche ai rappresentanti delle opposizioni, continua a lavorare sul metodo di lavoro da seguire e sulla stesura di "un cronoprogramma", ha riferito il vicepresidente della commissione, Renato Brunetta, al termine della riunione aggiungendo: "lo stiamo definendo e il presidente Casini si Ã¨ impegnato a fornire nei prossimi giorni un calendario che arriverÃ  fino a marzo". Al momento la commissione si Ã¨ riaggiornata a data da definirsi.

Il Movimento 5 Stelle chiede che siano auditi, tra gli altri, il presidente della Bce ed ex governatore della Banca d'Italia, Mario Draghi, il segretario del Pd Matteo Renzi, la sottosegretaria Maria Elena Boschi, il ministro dell'Economia Pier Carlo Padoan, il Csm e la Consob.

"Cuando Paltrow tenÃ­a 22 aÃ±os", arranca el texto, "consiguiÃ³ un papel que la convertirÃ­a de actriz en estrella: el productor Harvey Weinstein la contratÃ³ para el papel principal en la adaptaciÃ³n de Jane Austen Emma.
Angelina Jolie viviÃ³ algo parecido cuando estaba inmersa en la promociÃ³n de la pelÃ­cula Jugando con el corazÃ³n (1998).

TEXT:
El caso de Harvey Weinstein no parece tocar fondo, ni mucho menos. Tras las acusaciones de abusos sexuales al productor publicadas por The New York Times el jueves 5 de octubre, el martes 10 la actriz Asia Argento ha acusado a Weinstein de haberla violado en un largo reportaje publicado en The New Yorker que tambiÃ©n recoge declaraciones de Rosanna Arquette o Mira Sorvino. Ahora, a esa larga lista de mujeres que han sufrido el acoso, se unen dos de las caras mÃ¡s reconocibles del mundo: las de las actrices Angelina Jolie y Gwyneth Paltrow.

Jolie y Paltrow lo han contado al diario The New York Times. "Cuando Paltrow tenÃ­a 22 aÃ±os", arranca el texto, "consiguiÃ³ un papel que la convertirÃ­a de actriz en estrella: el productor Harvey Weinstein la contratÃ³ para el papel principal en la adaptaciÃ³n de Jane Austen Emma. Antes de empezar el rodaje, la citÃ³ en su suite del Hotel PenÃ­nsula Beverly Hills para una reuniÃ³n de trabajo que empezÃ³ sin sobresaltos. AcabÃ³ con el seÃ±or Weinstein toqueteÃ¡ndola y sugiriÃ©ndole que tendrÃ­an que ir a la habitaciÃ³n a hacerse unos masajes, cuenta ella misma".

Angelina Jolie viviÃ³ algo parecido cuando estaba inmersa en la promociÃ³n de la pelÃ­cula Jugando con el corazÃ³n (1998). "Tuve una mala experiencia con Harvey Weinstein en mi juventud y, como resultado, decidÃ­ no volver a trabajar con Ã©l nunca mÃ¡s y advertir a otros cuando asÃ­ lo hicieran", ha contado Jolie, que entonces tenÃ­a apenas 23 aÃ±os. "Este comportamiento hacia las mujeres, en cualquier Ã¡mbito y en cualquier paÃ­s, es inaceptable", ha contado la actriz a The New York Times en un correo electrÃ³nico.

Angelina Jolie y su padre, el actor Jon Voight, en el estreno de 'Jugando con el corazÃ³n', el 10 de diciembre de 1998 en Beverly Hills, California.

SegÃºn el artÃ­culo, este era el procedimiento habitual del productor. "Incluso en una industria en la que el acoso estÃ¡ presente desde lejos, el seÃ±or Weinstein es especialmente llamativo, segÃºn las actrices y sus exempleados [...]: sus asistentes cerraban las reuniones y acordaban un encuentro en una habitaciÃ³n de hotel". DespuÃ©s venÃ­an las insistencias para masajes, tocamientos y, como en el caso de Argento, abusos con sexo oral y vaginal.

"Era una niÃ±a, habÃ­a firmado [el contrato], estaba petrificada", explica Gwyneth Paltrow al diario The New York Times y sobre el hombre que "la acosÃ³, le dio el empujÃ³n para iniciar su carrera y finalmente la ayudÃ³ a conseguir un Oscar", un premio que llegÃ³ en 1999 por Shakespeare in Love. Como explica, la actriz rechazÃ³ las intentonas del productor y se lo contÃ³ a su entonces pareja, Brad Pitt, que se peleÃ³ con Weinstein. Poco despuÃ©s, el productor la amenazÃ³ para que no le contara nada a nadie. "PensÃ© que me iba a despedir", cuenta ella.

Gwyneth Paltrow ante un pÃ³ster de 'Emma' en el estreno de la pelÃ­cula.

Paltrow asegura que veÃ­a a Weinstein como un mentor, que "pensaba que era el tÃ­o Harvey". Una vez que hablÃ³ con Pitt del asunto, Ã©ste se acercÃ³ al productor en un estreno y le dijo que no volviera a tocar nunca mÃ¡s a Paltrow, como han confirmado representantes del actor a The New York Times. Al parecer, Weinstein llamÃ³ a Paltrow para discutir sobre el asunto y le gritÃ³ "durante mucho rato", por lo que ella temiÃ³ perder el papel de Emma. "Fue brutal"â€‹â€‹, asegura la que durante un tiempo fue llamada "la primera dama de Miramax", en referencia a los papeles que hacÃ­a para la productora de Weinstein.

"Se supone que debÃ­a guardar el secreto", afirma la ahora empresaria, que con los aÃ±os se ha distanciado de Ã©l. "Lo mismo era generoso y te daba todo su apoyo y te alababa como te castigaba y te hacÃ­a sentir mal", ha dicho. "Estamos en un momento en el que las mujeres han de mandar un mensaje claro de que esto ha terminado. Este modo de tratar a las mujeres acaba ahora", ha zanjado la ganadora del Oscar.

La actriz Gywneth Paltrow con su Oscar a la Mejor actriz protagonista por 'Shakespeare in Love' junto a Harvey Weinstein (junto a ella, a la izquierda de la imagen) y el resto del equipo de la pelÃ­cula el 21 de marzo de 1999.

Aunque son sin duda las mÃ¡s conocidas, Paltrow y Jolie no son las Ãºnicas. Otras mujeres como Rosanna Arquette â€”"Cometes un tremendo error", le dijo Weinstein despuÃ©s de que Ã©l la obligara a tocarle la entrepierna y ella se apartaraâ€”, Tomi-Ann Roberts â€”a la que pidiÃ³ desnudarse y mostrarle el pecho, y que despuÃ©s dejÃ³ la actuaciÃ³n y ahora enseÃ±a psicologÃ­a y en concreto trata sobre el acoso sexualâ€”, Judith GodrÃ¨che â€”con quien quedÃ³ a desayunar en el Festival de Cannes en 1996 y a la que intentÃ³ arrancar el jerseyâ€”, Dawn Dunning â€”a quien le dio un papel en sus tres prÃ³ximas pelÃ­culas... si aceptaba tener sexo en un trÃ­o, algo que ella rechazÃ³â€” o Katherine Kendall han hablado. Esta Ãºltima ha dicho que, cuando se citÃ³ con Weinstein en su apartamento, primero todo fue "muy profesional", estuvieron tranquilos, tomando algo, y vio fotos de su mujer en la pared. "Hablamos de cine, arte y libros durante una hora. PensÃ©: me toma en serio". Luego Weinstein fue al baÃ±o... y volviÃ³ en bata pidiendo un masaje. "Todas lo hacen", recuerda Kendall que le dijo, citando a una famosa modelo. Cuando ella se negÃ³, Ã©l volviÃ³ a salir de la habitaciÃ³n y regresÃ³ desnudo.

"Literalmente me persiguiÃ³. No me dejaba pasar para llegar a la puerta", recuerda Kendall al NYT. "Me preguntÃ³ si podÃ­a verme el pecho, por lo menos". Ella se negÃ³ y pensÃ³ que no podÃ­a creerse lo que le estaba pasando. "SÃ³lo era una reuniÃ³n de trabajo", recuerda. Aunque apareciÃ³ en algunas pelÃ­culas, todo el episodio le quitÃ³ las ganas: "Si hay que pasar por esto, no puedo hacerlo".

Muchos recordarÃ¡n el anuncio de los nominados a los Oscar de 2013, que hizo Seth MacFarlane (creador de Padre de familia) y que rememora el artÃ­culo del NYT. "Enhorabuena", anunciÃ³ el cÃ³mico cuando llegÃ³ el turno de las actrices, "ustedes cinco no tendrÃ¡n que fingir mÃ¡s que les atrae Harvey Weinstein". Y todos rieron.

Este artÃ­culo se publicÃ³ originalmente en El HuffPost
TITLE: Angelina Jolie y Gwyneth Paltrow acusan a Harvey Weinsten de acoso sexual

SUMMARY:
My Wind-Down Ritual When I was younger I was always able to survive on not much sleep or irregular sleep.
Presenter, world traveller, Strictly Come DancerIs Treating Myself The Same As Self Compassion?
My understanding of self-compassion has changed dramatically in the last three months or so.
Up until I really started learning about it, I believed that self-compassion and treating myself were the same thing.
I enjoy the process - no I love the process - as much as the end result.
TEXT:
My Wind-Down Ritual When I was younger I was always able to survive on not much sleep or irregular sleep. But being a junior doctor working night-shifts in my late 20s, was the first time I realised the link between sleep and how it affects my health and the way I feel. Doctor, GP, media personality and fitness expert

How To Fall In Love With A City I travel all the time - mainly for work and chances are a city will feature - even if I am going to the countryside or some far-flung destination - because cities are portals to lots of different places. Presenter, world traveller, Strictly Come Dancer

Is Treating Myself The Same As Self Compassion? My understanding of self-compassion has changed dramatically in the last three months or so. Up until I really started learning about it, I believed that self-compassion and treating myself were the same thing. They're not. There's a world of a difference between the two. Self-compassion is defined by two key features: Sunny Spells and Scattered Showers

Bullet Journalling Isn't Just About Organising My Life, It's Like Therapy For Me What has surprised me the most is how much I've enjoyed time to create and decorate my pages to make them look nice. So many people have commented on how much effort it must take to manually create a diary and if that's what you're thinking then it's 100% not for you. I enjoy the process - no I love the process - as much as the end result. Life Writer, HuffPost UK
TITLE: Downtime

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Washington â€” India needs to grow at a faster pace, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has said, while asserting that there was public support for the government's reform initiatives despite the difficulties arising from implementing GST, for instance.

"The obvious challenge to the country is to grow and grow fast. It has to grow at a much higher rate than we have been growing in recent history," Jaitley said in an address via video conference to the Berkeley India Conference prior to his departure for the US.

He is due to leave for the US on Monday to attend the forthcoming annual meeting of International Monetary Fund and World Bank here.

"I do hope that India is able to retain its growth rate once again and live up to the aspirations of its people because we must not forget that we not only have a large population to service, we have a very young population to service," he said.

"We have to grow at a much faster pace," he said, adding that a young and aspirational population wants change and reforms at a fast pace, and is impatient to see results.

"Time therefore is running against us," Jaitley said.

Pulled down by sluggish manufacturing, growth in the Indian economy, during the first quarter (April-June), fell to 5.7 per cent, clocking the lowest GDP growth rate under the Narendra Modi dispensation.

On reforms, the Finance Minister said the Goods and Services Tax (GST) has resulted in creation of a national tax structure.

"In the three months, you have all the check points in states disappeared, you have clear flow of goods and services which has started all over the country," he said.

Acknowledging issues related to compliance, Jaitley said the GST Council had noted these challenges and is taking steps to address them.

GST has been a "reasonable smooth transformation," but there is scope for improvement, he said.

"I think in GST Council we have succeeded in creating India's first federal institution."

On the demonetisation of high value currency, he said the Indian normal was to live with a high-cash economy and not pay taxes.

"You buy a property, you transact partly in cash, and in business you maintain two sets of accounts," he said.

"How can a country, which aims to be the fastest growing major economy in the world, which aspires to grow from a developing to a developed economy, continue with the normal of this type," he asked.

He said demonetisation had led to a sharp drop in insurgent and terror activities in states like Jammu and Kashmir and Chhattisgarh.

"You are having terrorist incidents, but the fact that you were finding 5,000-10,000 stone throwers being provided with money by the terrorist organisations, why is it that in the last eight-ten months it has not happened," he asked.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: India Has To Grow At A Much Faster Pace, Admits Finance Minister Arun Jaitley

Er glaubt, dass sich die Bundesregierung und der Vorstand von Lufthansa die Ãœbernahme von Air Berlin abgesprochen haben.
Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel habe den Flugbetrieb von Air Berlin nur deshalb aufrecht erhalten wollen, damit Lufthansa die Slots, die bisher Air Berlin besaÃŸ, Ã¼bernehmen kann.
Mit dem Kauf von Air Berlin sind nun der grÃ¶ÃŸte Teil der Slots in der Hand von Lufthansa.
Niki Lauda war an einem Kauf von Air Berlin interessiertNiki Lauda grÃ¼ndete er nach seiner Formel-1-Karriere seine eigene Fluggesellschaft Niki Luftfahrt GmbH, die 2004 von Air Berlin Ã¼bernommen wurde.
TEXT:
Niki Lauda vor einem Flugzeug seiner Fluggesellschaft | JOE KLAMAR via Getty Images

Luftfahrtunternehmer Niki Lauda kritisiert die Ãœbernahme von Air Berlin durch die Lufthansa

Aufgrund der Monopolbildung erwartet Lauda steigende Flugpreise

Lufthansa sei auÃŸerdem nicht an Air Berlin selbst, sondern nur an den Flugstrecken interessiert

Im Interview mit dem Deutschlandfunk hat der Luftfahrtunternehmer Niki Lauda Kritik an der Ãœbernahme von Air Berlin durch die Lufthansa geÃ¤uÃŸert.

Er wirft der Bundesregierung unter anderem vor, eine gezielte Monopolbildung in Kauf zu nehmen, wodurch die Preise fÃ¼r Flugtickets weiter ansteigen werden. "Es kann doch nicht sein, dass wir EuropÃ¤er plÃ¶tzlich ein Monopol schaffen", sagte der ehemalige Formel-1-Rennfahrer.

Auch andere Experten wie der Chef der Monopolkommission, Achim Wambach in der "FAZ" warnten vor einem solchen Monopol der Lufthansa. Bereits jetzt gebe es wenig Wettbewerb auf innerdeutschen Strecken. Das kÃ¶nne sich nicht nur in steigenden Preisen bei Flugtickets Ã¤uÃŸern.

"Auch die Bahn, die ja auf mittleren Strecken durchaus mit der Lufthansa konkurriert, muss sich dann weniger anstrengen und kann ohne groÃŸe Sorge (...) ebenfalls die Preise anheben", sagte Wambach.

Auch Lauda klagt: "Wenn Sie sich in Deutschland die Inlandsstrecken anschauen, kÃ¶nnen Sie jeden Tag sehen, wie die Tickets teurer werden."

Kritik am Vorgehen der Bundesregierung

Der 68-JÃ¤hrige kritisiert im Interview die staatliche UnterstÃ¼tzung der Bundesregierung. Er glaubt, dass sich die Bundesregierung und der Vorstand von Lufthansa die Ãœbernahme von Air Berlin abgesprochen haben.

Die UnterstÃ¼tzung von 150 Millionen Euro begrÃ¼ndete die Bundesregierung im August mit dem Erhalt des Flugbetriebs. Niki Lauda hingegen hÃ¤lt einen anderen Grund fÃ¼r entscheidend.

Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel habe den Flugbetrieb von Air Berlin nur deshalb aufrecht erhalten wollen, damit Lufthansa die Slots, die bisher Air Berlin besaÃŸ, Ã¼bernehmen kann.

â–º Slots werden an die Fluggesellschaften vergeben und sind bestimmte Zeitfenster, in denen eine Airline starten oder landen darf. Mit dem Kauf von Air Berlin sind nun der grÃ¶ÃŸte Teil der Slots in der Hand von Lufthansa.

Die Mitarbeiter haben fÃ¼r Lufthansa keine groÃŸe Bedeutung

Lauda kritisierte auÃŸerdem, die Lufthansa sei nicht in erster Linie am Unternehmen Air Berlin interessiert, sondern nur an den frei werdenden Slots.

Die Lufthansa werde sich einzelne Strecken, die sie noch nicht besetzt haben, herauspicken und den Rest der Strecken einstellen.

Bei dieser Planung wÃ¼rden die Mitarbeiter des insolventen Unternehmens keine groÃŸe Rolle spielen, glaubt der ehemalige Rennfahrer. Sie werden nach der Ãœbernahme einen neuen Vertrag unterschreiben mÃ¼ssen, der mÃ¶glicherweise schlechtere Arbeitsbedingungen als der bisherige Vertrag bei Air Berlin beinhaltet.

â–º HÃ¤tte eine andere Fluggesellschaft Air Berlin gekauft, wÃ¤re womÃ¶glich ein stÃ¤rkerer Wettbewerb in der Flugbranche entstanden. Die Flugtickets wÃ¤ren so eher billiger geworden.

Niki Lauda war an einem Kauf von Air Berlin interessiert

Niki Lauda grÃ¼ndete er nach seiner Formel-1-Karriere seine eigene Fluggesellschaft Niki Luftfahrt GmbH, die 2004 von Air Berlin Ã¼bernommen wurde.

Im Sommer diesen Jahres hatte Lauda zusammen mit den Unternehmen Kondor und Thomas Cook selbst Interesse an einer Ãœbernahme von Air Berlin angemeldet. Der GlÃ¤ubigerausschuss lieÃŸ ihn jedoch nicht am Verfahren teilnehmen, wie der Deutschlandfunk berichtet.

â¨ Mehr zum Thema: Lufthansa kauft die insolvente Fluglinie Air Berlin
TITLE: Airline-Unternehmer Lauda bringt auf den Punkt, warum wir Air Berlin noch vermissen werden

Ayer, Trump recibiÃ³ en la Casa Blanca al dueÃ±o Los PingÃ¼inos de Pittsburgh, Ronald Burkle, por el triunfo del equipo en la Copa Stanley, la mayor competencia de la liga profesional de hockey sobre hielo de Estados Unidos y CanadÃ¡.

TEXT:
La obsesiÃ³n del presidente estadounidense Donald Trump con el Tratado de Libre Comercio de AmÃ©rica del Norte (TLCAN) llegÃ³ hasta el campo del humor o, debemos decir, de la mala comedia.

Ayer, Trump recibiÃ³ en la Casa Blanca al dueÃ±o Los PingÃ¼inos de Pittsburgh, Ronald Burkle, por el triunfo del equipo en la Copa Stanley, la mayor competencia de la liga profesional de hockey sobre hielo de Estados Unidos y CanadÃ¡.

En su mensaje de bienvenida, Trump hizo una broma al copropietario del equipo de hockey. Le dijo que es un gran negociador y lo invitÃ³ a negociar el TLCAN, que calificÃ³ como uno de "horribles" acuerdos comerciales que tiene Estados Unidos.

Pero la broma no parÃ³ ahÃ­. Trump tambiÃ©n insinuÃ³ que el dueÃ±o del equipo de hockely podrÃ­a estar "del otro lado" en la negociaciÃ³n del tratado en referencia a los cientos de empresarios que le pidieron al presidente estadounidense no salirse del acuerdo.

Ayer, empresarios de 310 cÃ¡maras de comercio, estatales y locales en Estados Unidos enviaron una carta al presidente estadounidense para decirle que el TLCAN debe actualizarse, pero tambiÃ©n debe reconocerse que el acuerdo ha sido beneficioso para ese paÃ­s.

AdemÃ¡s, los firmantes le advirtieron a Trump que terminar con el acuerdo serÃ­a catastrÃ³fico, pues 14 millones de empleos en EU dependen del comercio con CanadÃ¡ y MÃ©xico y mÃ¡s de 1 mil millones de dÃ³lares se comercian todos los dÃ­as a travÃ©s de sus fronteras (sur y norte), entre otras razones.

La broma de Trump puso muy incÃ³modo al copropietario del equipo de hockey, quien sonreÃ­a ante las continuas provocaciones del presidente estadounidense.

Al final, el empresario Ronald Burkle decidiÃ³ ceder a las preguntas de Trump. "Â¿Tu no estÃ¡s del otro lado del TLCAN, Ron, verdad?", le dijo. "No, no lo estoy", contestÃ³.

Como candidato y presidente, Donald Trump ha amenazado con terminar con el tratado, que ha calificado como "el peor" acuerdo comercial de la historia de Estados Unidos. Durante este periodo, premios Noble de EconomÃ­a, empresarios, exfuncionarios e, incluso, miembros de su gabinete le han dicho que terminar con el acuerdo no es la mejor idea.
TITLE: Trump hizo un chiste (malÃ­simo) al dueÃ±o de un equipo de hockey sobre el TLCAN

SUMMARY:
Conservative MP for Eastleigh, member of the Women and Equalities Select CommitteeTory Coup Speculation Is Rife: Will Replacing The Prime Minister Solve The Conservative Party's Problems?
The Conservative Party is a survivalist party with ruthless ambitions.
It would not have secured its reputation as the most successful political party in Britain were it not.
Conservative Justice Secretary David Lidington had an opportunity to show that he was getting a grip during his keynote speech at Conservative Party conference.
Labour MP for East Leeds, Shadow Justice Secretary
TEXT:
The International Day Of The Girl Is A Day For Poignant Reflection On this day, the sixth Annual Day of the Girl, I am grateful to think of the progress this Government has made and eager to see how we can shape the future opportunities for women and girls which are growing and must be taken advantage of - but I must also stress how much further there is to go. Conservative MP for Eastleigh, member of the Women and Equalities Select Committee

Tory Coup Speculation Is Rife: Will Replacing The Prime Minister Solve The Conservative Party's Problems? The Tory party is tearing itself apart through infighting, and the disunity grows by the day. You only have to look at history to discover what happens when a party is disunited - the public will not vote for you. The Conservative Party is a survivalist party with ruthless ambitions. It would not have secured its reputation as the most successful political party in Britain were it not. Former media adviser to Liverpool City Region Metro Mayor Steve Rotheram

Social Media: Politicians' One-Stop Shop For A Cult Of Personality When a cult of personality for a previously "unheard of" backbencher can create public demand and expectation for that person to be front and centre within the party - far more quickly and easily than the social climbing previously demanded to get to the upper echelons of power - it will be interesting to see how this tactic diversifies. Deputy Chairman of the Parliament Street Technology Forum

Reclaiming The T-word What do politics, sports and rock music have in common? It could be a number of things. During the summer of 2017 in the UK it was Tourette Syndrome (... Chartered Psychologist and research manager at Tourettes Action. Raising public awareness and how research improves peopleâ€™s lives.

World Mental Health Day: Helping People Affected By Mental Ill-Health Into Work Mental health is complex and can impact on any - or every - aspect of the lives of those affected. Environment, housing, relationships and, crucially, work can often be intrinsically linked to the problems associated with mental health issues. But that also means they can be a vital part of the solution... Secretary of State for Work and Pensions and Conservative MP for Hertfordshire South West

Only Labour Can Deliver The Transport Investment Britain Needs The Conservatives are refusing to say precisely where the Â£400 million of transport investment will be spent. Why make an announcement without a plan? The reason is that this is a government without a plan, and merely shows how out of the touch the Tories are with the needs and ambitions of the North. Shadow transport secretary and Labour MP for Middlesborough

Oh, Theresa May... If she hangs on, it'll be for one reason and one reason alone. Her party can't think of anyone who they'd prefer. I suspect Jeremy Corbyn is smiling contentedly as he does some gentle digging in his allotment. Journalist and broadcaster

7,000 Words And Not A Single Mention Of Wales After this conference season, it's becoming increasingly clear that Theresa May is content with providing "second best" solutions to the issues which face communities across Wales and the UK as a whole. Member of Parliament for Ogmore

If You Dumb Down Politics, We All Lose I'm a lifelong Labour member. And at the Tory conference in Manchester yesterday, Theresa May gave a speech with a lot of substance. That doesn't make her someone I would vote for, but that does make her someone worth listening to. PR guru and Media Podcast presenter

This Must Be The Start, And Not The End, Of Building More Social Homes The government deserves credit for changing its course. It's good news that it is now acting to ease the misery of at least some private renters. If delivered, the new social homes promised will benefit some of the very people Shelter exists to help - those facing bad housing and homelessness. Chief executive of Shelter

Southern Rail Dispute And Uber Debacle Shows Labour Will Fight For The Unions, Not You The strikes on Tuesday and Thursday by the RMT Union have caused yet more indignation for so many of my constituents in East Surrey who commute into London for work and all the other passengers reliant on the service. What makes it all the more galling for the passengers is the persistent support the unions receive from Jeremy Corbyn. Rather than condemning the union bosses for playing games, the Labour leader has made it abundantly clear he stands with the union barons. Prisons and probation minister and Conservative MP for East Surrey

Tory Conference Diary, Day 3: Do They Have Even A Semblance Of A Plan For Britain? With one day left, it's down to Theresa May to put forward her vision for the future and prove she has a semblance of a plan. If the last three days are anything to go by, I think the Tory faithful are going to be leaving Manchester very disappointed. Labour MP for Hemsworth and Shadow Minister for the Cabinet

The Roaring Lion And The Dutiful Public Servant: Johnson And May's Wildly Different Views Of Brexit Britain In her speech, Theresa May said that "the Tories must win the battle of ideas again." But perhaps it is not only the Tories that must win the battle of ideas within the nation, but within their own party. For in this moment, these two competing ideas of post-Brexit Britain, the lion and the servant cannot sustain the standoff. Lions often eat unaware but dutiful servants and dutiful servants, often kill lions. Before the current prime minister can carry out her vision of dutifully serving the nation, she needs to win the battle of ideas within her own party. PhD student, Queen Mary University of London

Frozen Tuition Fees Leave Me Feeling Cold The real struggle for students I speak to and those up and down the country is cost of living. Paying for ever rising rents, food and bills that are a necessity when starting life at university. These are the things that matter here and now and the government not addressing this or mentioning maintenance grants at all is the real injustice. President of the NUS

The Conservatives Have Run Out Of Ideas Of How To Repair Our Broken Justice System Crisis after crisis rocked the justice system this summer. Conservative Justice Secretary David Lidington had an opportunity to show that he was getting a grip during his keynote speech at Conservative Party conference. Sadly for the millions who depend on a properly functioning justice system, he fluffed his chance. Labour MP for East Leeds, Shadow Justice Secretary
TITLE: Conservatives: Latest news and updates from the Tories, blogs and videos

Die Angst vor einem mÃ¶glichen Brustkrebs veranlasste auch sie dazu, sich beide BrÃ¼ste abnehmen zu lassen, wie sie 2012 bekanntgab.
Kathy BatesAuch Kathy Bates (69, "Misery") verÃ¶ffentlichte 2012, dass sie sich wegen Brustkrebs ihre beiden BrÃ¼ste abnehmen lieÃŸ.

TEXT:
Dem Tod von der Schippe gesprungen? Vielleicht! In jedem Fall haben sich Stars wie Christina Applegate (45) und Angelina Jolie (42) einschneidenden Operationen unterzogen, um den Krebs zu besiegen. Sie und viele andere Promi-Damen lieÃŸen sich beide BrÃ¼ste entfernen, im Fachjargon Mastektomie genannt.

"Eine schrecklich nette Familie " mit Christina Applegate kÃ¶nnen Sie sich bei Amazon Prime ansehen

Christina Applegate

Als Kelly "Dumpfbacke" Bundy wurde sie mit der Erfolgssitcom "Eine schrecklich nette Familie" (1987-1997) bekannt. Alles andere als dumm war dagegen ihre Entscheidung fÃ¼r das Leben: 2008 lieÃŸ sich Christina Applegate nach einer Brustkrebs-Diagnose die Original-BrÃ¼ste entfernen. Vor zwei Wochen wurden ihr auch EierstÃ¶cke und Eileiter entfernt.

Angelina Jolie

Eine riesige Welle schlug auch das Ã¶ffentliche Bekenntnis zur Brust-OP von Hollywood-Superstar und Sex-Symbol Angelina Jolie. Sie hatte sich 2013 die BrÃ¼ste entfernen lassen, ein Jahr spÃ¤ter folgten die EierstÃ¶cke - "Meine Kinder werden nicht sagen mÃ¼ssen: 'Meine Mutter ist an Eierstockkrebs gestorben'."

Anastacia

SÃ¤ngerin Anastacia (49) wÃ¤hlte ebenfalls die drastische Variante, nachdem sie seit der Diagnose 2003 jahrelang gegen den Brustkrebs angekÃ¤mpft hatte. Als der Krebs 2013 wiederkam, unterzog sie sich einer beidseitigen Mastektomie.

Rita Wilson

Das Thema erneut auf den Tisch gebracht hat Filmemacherin Rita Wilson (60, "My Big Fat Greek Wedding"). Wie sie 2015 bekanntgab, war bei ihr Brustkrebs diagnostiziert worden, woraufhin sie sich zur OP entschloss.

Olivia Newton-John

Bei dem britisch-australischen "Grease"-Star Olivia Newton-John (69) wurde 1992 Brustkrebs diagnostiziert. Sie unterzog sich einer Mastektomie. 25 Jahre lang hÃ¶rte man nichts mehr zum Thema. Tolle Aussichten eigentlich, doch leider gab die KÃ¼nstlerin im Mai 2017 bekannt, erneut gegen die heimtÃ¼ckische Krankheit ankÃ¤mpfen zu mÃ¼ssen.

Sharon Osbourne

Reality-Star und Schockrocker-Gattin Sharon Osbourne (65) erhoffte sich ebenfalls viel von der drastischen Operation. Die Angst vor einem mÃ¶glichen Brustkrebs veranlasste auch sie dazu, sich beide BrÃ¼ste abnehmen zu lassen, wie sie 2012 bekanntgab.

Kathy Bates

Auch Kathy Bates (69, "Misery") verÃ¶ffentlichte 2012, dass sie sich wegen Brustkrebs ihre beiden BrÃ¼ste abnehmen lieÃŸ. "Nach langer Ãœberlegung habe ich eine doppelte Mastektomie vornehmen lassen. Zum GlÃ¼ck muss ich mich keiner Strahlen- oder Chemotherapie unterziehen", erklÃ¤rte sie damals in einem Interview. Zuvor hatte sie bereits ihren Eierstockkrebs Ã¼berstanden.

Patricia Kelly

Kurz vor ihrem 40. Geburtstag wurde bei Patricia Kelly (47) Brustkrebs diagnostiziert. Daraufhin lieÃŸ sie sich im Oktober 2010 das Gewebe in ihrer Brust herausoperieren. "Es hat unmenschlich wehgetan. Man hatte das GefÃ¼hl, als wenn tausend Messer die Brust zerschneiden. Es brannte alles wie Feuer", schilderte die SÃ¤ngerin die Operation spÃ¤ter im Interview mit "Stern TV". Seitdem trÃ¤gt sie eine Prothese.

Wie genau die OP ablÃ¤uft, erklÃ¤rte der einstige Kelly-Family-Star im Interview auch: "Der Innenbereich, also das Gewebe wurde entfernt, die Haut bleibt bestehen und die Prothese ersetzt das Gewebe." Sie sei dankbar, dass sie sich trotz der Prothese weiblich fÃ¼hlen kÃ¶nne und freut sich: "Ich hÃ¤tte vor der OP nie gedacht, dass es so schÃ¶n ist. Ich bin nur dankbar: Ich kann trotzdem schÃ¶n und weiblich sein." So wird es den anderen Stars hoffentlich auch ergangen sein...
TITLE: Diese Promi-Frauen lieÃŸen wegen Krebs ihre BrÃ¼ste entfernen

TEXT:
You Can't Always Get What You Want, But If You Try Sometimes You Might Find Technology Gives You What You Need One only needs to go to an industry show these days to see that the sheer number of tech firms in attendance trying to sell into that market is staggering. These tech firms, however, are all offering to do the same thing, provide data analytics to retailers about their customers. Managing Director UK of global technology consultancy DataArt

The UK Has Some Great Education Ideas It turns out, the UK is a hotspot for innovative talent. A list of 100 inspiring education innovations has been collected over the past two years and ... Editor, freelance consultant in creativity and innovation in education

Rethinking The Robot Tax Last week, Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn announced his latest plans to implement a "Robot Tax" in a bold effort to face the "challenge" of automation. This proposed tax is part of his larger plan to "urgently manage" the evolution of robotics and technology for the sake of society. Chief of Staff, Redwood Software

How Do We Get The Educational Innovation We Need To Bridge The Learning Gap? In the area of technology and data-powered solutions, the space that receives the most hype, Brookings argues that many approaches are simply not innovative enough. It finds that tech is mostly being used to augment or substitute existing approaches, and concludes that just 1 in 5 technology-based innovations can considered to be genuinely transformative. Co-author of 'China-Ready: Equipping Britain for an Asian Future'

Why Failure Can Be The Path To Success September marks the date that the aptly named Museum of Failure closes. It displayed more than 70 products and services from around the world. They included those from well-known brands such as a Harley-Davidson perfume, Bic for Her, the Apple Newton, Google Glass, and Kodak Digital Cameras. Chief Executive Officer at CPA Global, the IP technology leader

The Power Of Technology In Preparing For Brexit Uncertainty The UK workforce is witnessing first-hand how quickly the political landscape can impact a business from one day to the next. The social and political events of the past 12 months have been turbulent to say the least General Manager, UK & Ireland, at IT management software and solutions company CA Technologies

Could Clean Energy Be Brexit Britain's Get Out Of Jail Free Card? Now is the time to plant the seeds from which the UK can develop substantial domestic supply chains and become one of the world's leading exporters of clean energy skills, services and products, helping to improve access to energy in developing nations and building the global low carbon energy system demanded by the Paris Agreement. President of the Energy Institute

Redefining Female Innovation: Addressing Antibiotic Immunity What makes someone an innovator? I doubt that many of us set out deliberately to be pioneers but perhaps we share a mindset. We don't see limitations - obstacles are there to get over, under or round. One of those obstacles is that intangible - confidence! CEO of Absynth Biologics

Redefining Female Innovation: Air Quality My ambition for the future is to secure funding for EarthSense and to make the company a global leader in environmental monitoring, modelling and data. It's also to demonstrate to my children and their generation that gender or location doesn't stop us from trying to address global issues, its only limited by our willingness to try. Commercial Director of EarthSense

Why Protect Innovation? It is debatable whether teachers or parents would thank her for it, but Catherine Hettinger was the inventor of the fidget spinner. In 1993, Hettinger... Chief Executive Officer at CPA Global, the IP technology leader

Bharti told media, "Mahatma Gandhi's murder only benefitted Congress as he was about to disband Congress."
Bharti's comments come after the Supreme Court on October 6 appointed senior advocate and former additional solicitor general Amrender Sharan as amicus curiae on a plea seeking re-probe of Gandhi's murder.

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

BANASKANTHA -- Union Minister Uma Bharti on Thursday said Mahatama Gandhi's murder only benefitted Congress.

Bharti told media, "Mahatma Gandhi's murder only benefitted Congress as he was about to disband Congress."

She further said, the murder of Mahatma Gandhi needs reconsideration.

"Godsey may have killed Gandhi, but who instigated him?," questioned Bharti.

Mahatma Gandhi was murdered on January 30, 1948 in Delhi by Nathuram Vinayak Godse, who was a member of Hindu Mahasabha.

Bharti's comments come after the Supreme Court on October 6 appointed senior advocate and former additional solicitor general Amrender Sharan as amicus curiae on a plea seeking re-probe of Gandhi's murder.

The plea is filed by Mumbai-based Dr Pankaj Phadnis , a researcher and a trustee of Abhinav Bharat.

Bharti, who was here to participate in Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Gaurav Yatra, said that the people of Gujarat have given the BJP as well as the nation a sense of pride.

She claimed that the BJP will win 160-165 seats in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections.

The 14th legislative assembly election in Gujarat is to be held by the end of 2017 as the term of 13th assembly ends on January 22, 2018.

"BJP President Amit Shah has said about winning 150 seats, but I want to add that we (BJP will get 160-165 seats in Gujarat assembly elections," said Bharti.

When asked to comment on Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi's allegations against the BJP and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, she refused to comment by saying that "for his own party, he must be a big leader but for me he is not so big that I comment anything on him."

She said because of the Gujarat model, Modi became the Prime Minister of India and even Opposition accepted Gujarat Model that Prime Minister Modi developed while being Chief Minister of Gujarat.

Also on HuffPost India
TITLE: Mahatma Gandhi's Murder Only Benefitted Congress, Says Uma Bharti

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTA Muslim teen has alleged that he was picked up by the police in Uttar Pradesh and charged with hacking, following a status update he posted on a recent court ruling on rivers Ganga and Yamuna.
Tyagi's status message had read: "The Ganga has been declared a living entity; will criminal charges be initiated if someone drowns in it?"
Telegraph reports that Tyagi had meant it as a wisecrack on a High Court ruling on Ganga and Yamuna, asking the rivers to be treated as persons with rights.
The Telegraph quotes the FIR accusing Tyagi of posting 'galat tareeke ke (wrong type of) comments" on Facebook.
Tyagi was also booked under Section 420 of the IPC for having the picture of a police officer as his profile picture.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

A Muslim teen has alleged that he was picked up by the police in Uttar Pradesh and charged with hacking, following a status update he posted on a recent court ruling on rivers Ganga and Yamuna. Speaking at a press conference organised by the Bhim Army in New Delhi, 18-year-old Zakir Ali Tyagi said that in April this year, police arrested him and then tortured him in their custody on the basis of various unfounded allegations.

Tyagi's status message had read: "The Ganga has been declared a living entity; will criminal charges be initiated if someone drowns in it?" Telegraph reports that Tyagi had meant it as a wisecrack on a High Court ruling on Ganga and Yamuna, asking the rivers to be treated as persons with rights.

However, he was charged under Section 66 of the Information Technology Act which could lead to a jail term of three years and deals with 'hacking'. The Telegraph quotes the FIR accusing Tyagi of posting 'galat tareeke ke (wrong type of) comments" on Facebook.

The Telegraph spoke to Wasim Nadeeq Khan, who got Tyagi legal aid. He told them: "The police had initially registered the FIR under Section 66A, which prescribes three years' jail for offensive posts, unaware that the Supreme Court had struck it down as unconstitutional in March 2015. When they realised the mistake, they merely dropped the letter 'A'."

Tyagi was also booked under Section 420 of the IPC for having the picture of a police officer as his profile picture. The picture was of Akhtar Khan, a police officer killed on duty in Greater Noida, he had out the picture as a protest against his murder like people on Facebook tend to do.

Tyagi was let off almost after a month, following postponed bail hearings. In fact, once he was remanded in custody as the magistrate decided his was a 'serious' matter and he deserved to spend more time in jail.

Read the complete Telegraph story here.
TITLE: In UP, A Teen Was Arrested And Allegedly Tortured In Jail For A Facebook Post On River Ganga

While Garner and estranged husband husband Ben Affleck split after 10 years of marriage in 2015 amid cheating allegations, the actress maintains that the film is not a case of life imitating art.

TEXT:
Prepare to see Jennifer Garner like youâ€™ve never seen her before.

While the Golden Globe winner usually leans toward more family-friendly fare on screen, sheâ€™s taking a walk on the dark side with her upcoming film, â€œThe Tribes of Palos Verdes,â€ which released its first trailer on Tuesday.

Based on the celebrated novel by Joy Nicholson, the film follows a family that moves to California looking for a fresh start until things being to unravel. Garner stars as the matriarch who becomes unhinged after her husband, played by Justin Kirk, reveals heâ€™s in love with another woman.

While Garner and estranged husband husband Ben Affleck split after 10 years of marriage in 2015 amid cheating allegations, the actress maintains that the film is not a case of life imitating art.

â€œYou actually, believe it or not, donâ€™t use your own life as much as you might think,â€ Garner told Entertainment Tonight at the filmâ€™s premiere. â€œIt really is its separate, own, bear to get through. You just get into the place because thatâ€™s your job, and then you shake it off because you have to go home and raise your kids.â€

Her commitment to the role was so strong that she said she popped a blood vessel during the scene where her character discovers her husbandâ€™s affair, according to director Emmett Malloy.

Garner and Affleck continue to co-parents their kids, Violet, 11, Seraphina, 8, and Samuel, 5, while the actor has entered into a new relationship with â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ producer Lindsay Shookus.
TITLE: Jennifer Garner Goes Dark In New Movie About Cheating Husband

Another Trump confidant disagreed: Fox host Sean Hannity made clear in a phone call and on his show that Trump must draw a harder line on broader immigration enforcement as his price.
Trump sided with Hannity, according to a person close to the White House.
The result was a list of demands unveiled Sunday night â€” conditions seemingly guaranteed to thwart a bipartisan deal.
â€œThe President has started to call people more on the weekends, from the cellphone, which he didnâ€™t used to do,â€ the person said, noting that Trump often calls Hannity after the Fox News hostâ€™s nightly show.
TEXT:
When President Trump agreed last month with Democrats to strike a deal granting legal status to so-called Dreamers brought to this country illegally as children, his chief of staff, John F. Kelly, was all for it. Another Trump confidant disagreed: Fox host Sean Hannity made clear in a phone call and on his show that Trump must draw a harder line on broader immigration enforcement as his price.

Trump sided with Hannity, according to a person close to the White House. The result was a list of demands unveiled Sunday night â€” conditions seemingly guaranteed to thwart a bipartisan deal.

â€œThe President has started to call people more on the weekends, from the cellphone, which he didnâ€™t used to do,â€ the person said, noting that Trump often calls Hannity after the Fox News hostâ€™s nightly show.
TITLE: 5 Times Donald Trump Showed Mind-Boggling Ignorance During His Sean Hannity Interview

SUMMARY:
Conventional relationship wisdom says couples should settle their disagreements before bed and never go to sleep still mad at each other.
â€œWe are not in a good place to hash things out when we are angry and triggered and need time to process whatâ€™s happening.
It is up to you to determine what you need, and not your partnerâ€™s job to predict this after simply telling them youâ€™re upset.
But once their event is over, do talk about it, because buried resentments wreak havoc over time.â€ â€• Ryan Howes7.
When youâ€™ve lost sight of what you were even arguing about in the first place.
TEXT:
Conventional relationship wisdom says couples should settle their disagreements before bed and never go to sleep still mad at each other. And while this advice is well-intentioned, in some cases, it can actually worsen the problem at hand.

We asked relationship experts to tell us the types of arguments that call for hitting the hay and revisiting the discussion at a later time. Below, seven times to sleep on it, according to therapists and psychologists:

1. When youâ€™re really tired.

â€œLack of sleep can greatly exacerbate conflict. When couples are exhausted, they are more irritable and snippy. Going to bed mad can often mean that you wake up feeling okay, especially if the conflict was exacerbated or even entirely caused by two irritable, fatigued people sniping at one another.

Also, the idea that going to bed angry is â€˜badâ€™ leads to many couples staying up later than they should, trying to resolve fights and often failing, as they get more and more entrenched in their positions. When you have a good nightâ€™s sleep, you can much more easily see your partnerâ€™s position and empathize, which means that making up is finally possible.â€ â€• Samantha Rodman, psychologist and dating coach

2. When youâ€™ve been drinking.

â€œThe heated conversations of the overserved can travel to strange places, and the more drunk, the less constructive they tend to be. It might be best to call a time out, have a glass of water, and revisit the squabble in the morning, if you still remember it.â€ â€• Ryan Howes, psychologist

3. When youâ€™re really worked up.

â€œWhen in conflict, the body often goes into fight-or-flight mode. â€˜Fightâ€™ usually results in an elevated heart rate, an increase in stress hormones and an inability to think rationally. You cannot have a meaningful conversation, much less attempt problem solving, when your body is in this state. If you recognize it, you need to find a way to self-soothe. Some people go for a walk, some take a shower, some meditate and some sleep. If your anger has gotten the best of you, sleep may in fact be your best strategy for repair, especially if itâ€™s late.â€ â€• Zach Brittle, therapist and founder of the online couples therapy series forBetter

4. When you need more time to process your feelings.

â€œWe are not in a good place to hash things out when we are angry and triggered and need time to process whatâ€™s happening. Anger provides useful information to us and is a signal that something needs to change. Specifically, you want to do this in a constructive way (journaling, reflecting, physical activity, sleep) and not destructively (lengthy discussions, yelling, violence). It is up to you to determine what you need, and not your partnerâ€™s job to predict this after simply telling them youâ€™re upset. Sleep also provides a mental filing of things experienced or learned throughout the day, so itâ€™s an even better time to allow for processing of these strong emotions.â€ â€• Kari Carroll, couples therapist

5. When the conflict requires a mediator.

â€œSome conflicts are ongoing and require intervention, like therapy. Trying to resolve these in one evening just so you donâ€™t go to sleep angry would be impossible, and would leave both partners feeling hopeless and like they must be doing something wrong if they canâ€™t resolve things.â€ â€• Samantha Rodman

6. When you have a big day the next day.

â€œYou may have a bone to pick, but itâ€™s 11 p.m. and your partner has a job interview first thing in the morning. Or a final exam. Or major surgery. If itâ€™s possible to hold onto your moderate grudge until their major event has passed, that may be the most loving, considerate thing to do. But once their event is over, do talk about it, because buried resentments wreak havoc over time.â€ â€• Ryan Howes

7. When youâ€™ve lost sight of what you were even arguing about in the first place.
TITLE: 7 Reasons It's Totally OK To Go To Bed Angry, Despite What You've Heard

TEXT:
